label: Time Management
description: Prioritizes tasks, allocates time efficiently, and meets deadlines consistently while balancing competing demands.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Time Management' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows assigned schedules and meets basic deadlines with supervision.
Creates simple to-do lists; prioritizes routine tasks; arrives on time.
Uses time-blocking or calendar management; balances multiple projects; adjusts priorities as circumstances change.
Optimizes team schedules; delegates effectively; builds buffer time for contingencies; models time discipline.
Designs organizational time-management systems; mentors others; aligns time allocation with strategic priorities.

label: Self-Motivation
description: Drives oneself to achieve goals with sustained energy, without constant external supervision.
source_frameworks: Informed by O*NET Work Style 'Achievement/Effort' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Completes assigned tasks when prompted.
Sets personal targets aligned with team objectives; monitors own progress.
Pursues stretch goals; maintains focus despite routine obstacles.
Energizes others through example; sustains momentum on long-term projects.
Establishes systems that foster intrinsic motivation across teams; mentors colleagues in self-leadership techniques.

label: Resilience
description: Maintains performance and a positive outlook when faced with adversity, stress, or rapid change.
source_frameworks: Derived from O*NET Work Style 'Stress Tolerance' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recovers from minor setbacks with guidance.
Persists through routine challenges; seeks support when stress affects performance.
Uses coping strategies to remain effective during extended pressure; helps teammates regain focus after setbacks.
Demonstrates optimism in crises; guides teams in stress-management techniques.
Builds organizational resilience frameworks; leads cultural initiatives that normalize adaptive coping and recovery.

label: Professionalism
description: Demonstrates reliability, respectful conduct, appropriate appearance, and a commitment to ethical standards.
source_frameworks: Synthesized from widely accepted professional-conduct guidelines (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows basic workplace etiquette and dress code when reminded.
Consistently meets attendance and punctuality expectations; maintains courteous interactions.
Represents the organization positively; handles confidential information responsibly.
Models professional conduct under pressure; mentors peers in workplace etiquette and ethics.
Shapes organizational policies on professionalism; leads initiatives to uphold and evolve ethical standards industry-wide.

label: Learning Agility
description: Rapidly acquires and applies new knowledge and skills to novel situations; reflects on experience to improve future performance.
source_frameworks: Adapted from Korn Ferry & O*NET 'Learning Strategies' (public-domain descriptions)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Seeks guidance and resources when faced with unfamiliar tasks.
Learns new tools or processes quickly using available training; applies lessons to similar tasks.
Experiments with multiple learning methods; transfers insights across domains; solicits feedback to refine practice.
Learns ahead of need for upcoming challenges; designs learning resources for others; evaluates learning return on investment (ROI).
Embeds continuous-learning systems in the organization; anticipates skill trends and orchestrates upskilling strategies at scale.

label: Initiative
description: Proactively identifies opportunities and takes action without waiting for direction.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Initiative' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Completes assigned work promptly when asked.
Volunteers for additional tasks; suggests small improvements to processes.
Launches modest projects that add value; overcomes obstacles with minimal supervision.
Drives significant initiatives aligned with organizational goals; secures resources and stakeholder buy-in.
Cultivates a culture of proactive behavior; mentors others in opportunity recognition and entrepreneurial action.

label: Emotional Intelligence
description: Recognizes, understands, and manages one’s own emotions while perceiving and positively influencing the emotions of others.
source_frameworks: Concept aligned with Daniel Goleman’s EI model (publicly summarized); wording original

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic personal emotional states after they occur.
Notices emotional cues in others; adjusts tone to maintain positive interactions.
Regulates emotional reactions under stress; practices empathy to build rapport.
Coaches others in emotional self-management; diffuses tense situations through skilled emotional insight.
Embeds emotional-intelligence practices in organizational culture; mentors leaders in leveraging EI for strategy and change.

label: Effective Communication
description: Conveys information clearly in oral and written forms, actively listens, tailors messages to the audience, and facilitates mutual understanding.
source_frameworks: Based on U.S. OPM competencies for Oral & Written Communication (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Shares basic information politely; follows communication protocols.
Writes and speaks with clarity on routine topics; practices active listening by paraphrasing key points.
Explains complex ideas in simple terms; adapts tone and format (email, presentation) to audience needs; provides constructive feedback.
Persuades diverse stakeholders with well-structured messages; facilitates discussions to resolve misunderstandings and reach consensus.
Crafts compelling narratives that influence organizational direction; mentors others in advanced communication strategy and active-listening techniques.

label: Digital Literacy
description: Possesses fundamental computer and internet skills needed in most modern jobs; can operate a computer or smart device; understands basic cybersecurity practices (strong passwords, recognizing phishing) and can learn new software or systems with minimal guidance. Confidently uses digital tools, evaluates online information, and applies technology to solve problems and communicate effectively.
source_frameworks: Derived from EU DigComp framework (publicly released) and O*NET 'Computers & Electronics' knowledge

proficiency_levels.indicator: Has seen or used a computer/phone for simple tasks (social media, typing a short document); knows basic terminology (file, browser, login); performs basic actions (email, word processing); navigates the internet safely with guidance.

Performs essential digital tasks (i.e.uses documents, spreadsheets, presentations, and collaboration platforms) independently; manages file storage, retreival, and sharing securely; writes emails, fills online forms, follows security basics (doesn’t share passwords, runs antivirus if prompted).

Adapts to new software at work after some practice; uses collaborative tools (shared drives, video meetings) comfortably; troubleshoots minor issues (restart program, check internet) and seeks help appropriately for bigger problems; stays safe online (recognizes suspicious emails, uses multi-factor authentication).

Integrates multiple digital tools to streamline workflows; customizes settings for efficiency and accessibility. Becomes the go-to person for basic IT help in a small team; quickly learns specialized software for a role; efficiently manages data (organizing files, using formulas in spreadsheets, etc.); proactively updates skills through online tutorials and aligns with frameworks like DigComp for well-rounded competency.
Leads digital adoption initiatives; ensures digital-inclusion best practices; mentors others in advanced tool optimization and cybersecurity hygiene.

label: Critical Thinking
description: Objectively analyzes information, evaluates arguments, and applies logical reasoning to reach sound conclusions.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Analytical Thinking' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic facts and assumptions when prompted.
Distinguishes relevant from irrelevant information; applies simple decision rules.
Evaluates evidence, compares alternatives, and supports decisions with rationale.
Synthesizes complex data; anticipates implications; challenges unsupported conclusions.
Establishes analytical standards; mentors others in rigorous evidence-based reasoning; innovates new analytic frameworks.

label: Creative Thinking
description: Develops novel ideas and approaches by questioning assumptions, connecting disparate concepts, and experimenting with alternatives.
source_frameworks: Inspired by U.S. OPM ECQ 'Creativity & Innovation' (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Suggests simple alternatives when solving routine problems.
Combines existing ideas in new ways; participates in brainstorming sessions constructively.
Generates multiple, diverse solutions to complex challenges; prototypes and tests promising concepts.
Leads innovation initiatives; removes barriers to creative risk-taking; secures resources for experimentation.
Shapes organizational strategy through breakthrough ideas; mentors others in structured creativity techniques.

label: Collaboration
description: Works cooperatively with others toward shared goals, valuing diverse perspectives and resolving conflicts constructively.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Cooperation' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Participates in team meetings when asked; completes assigned group tasks.
Shares information openly; offers help to teammates; accepts feedback.
Facilitates group problem-solving; manages minor disagreements respectfully.
Builds cross-functional partnerships; mediates conflicts to consensus.
Fosters a collaborative culture across the organization; designs systems that reward teamwork and shared success.

label: Attention to Detail
description: Thoroughly accomplishes tasks, ensuring accuracy and identifying even small errors or inconsistencies.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Attention to Detail' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reviews work for obvious mistakes when reminded.
Checks data or documents carefully; corrects simple errors before submission.
Detects subtle discrepancies; follows detailed procedures without omission.
Designs quality-control checks; prevents errors through proactive safeguards.
Establishes organization-wide standards for accuracy; mentors others on precision and quality assurance.

label: Adaptability
description: Adjusts effectively to new information, shifting priorities, and evolving circumstances while remaining productive.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Work Style 'Adaptability/Flexibility' (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Accepts changes in tasks or schedules when directed.
Modifies personal work methods when priorities shift; remains calm with minor disruptions.
Reprioritizes workload independently when conditions change; quickly learns new procedures or tools.
Anticipates change drivers; helps team adjust plans and resources proactively.
Champions adaptive culture across functions; designs processes that remain effective in rapidly changing environments.

label: Accountability
description: Takes responsibility for actions, decisions, and results; upholds ethical standards and follows through on commitments.
source_frameworks: Based on O*NET Work Value 'Integrity' and USA OPM guidance (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges own errors when pointed out; meets basic deadlines with supervision.
Completes assigned tasks on time; owns mistakes and initiates corrective action.
Sets clear expectations; tracks performance metrics; meets quality standards without external prompting.
Holds self and others accountable; enforces ethical guidelines; transparently reports outcomes.
Embeds accountability mechanisms into organizational culture; mentors others on ethical decision-making and responsibility.

label: Workforce Scheduling & Gig Retail Management
description: Uses advanced labor-optimization software and gig-worker marketplaces to forecast staffing needs, auto-generate schedules, and comply with Fair Workweek laws while boosting employee engagement.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands labor KPIs (sales per labor hour, schedule variance); explains gig shift concept.
Inputs availabilities; publishes schedules two weeks ahead per Fair Workweek ordinance.
Uses AI demand forecasting to adjust staffing; fills call-outs via gig app within 1 h.
Optimizes labor cost % vs. sales; integrates scheduling API with POS for real-time adherence.
Leads flexible-workforce strategy; mentors managers; raises retention 15 % while cutting overtime 20 %.

label: Sustainable & Circular Retail Sourcing
description: Sources products and packaging using circular-economy principles—reuse, recycle, regenerate—aligned with Sedex and World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) indicators.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies eco-labels (FSC, GRS); records supplier ESG scores.
Calculates recycled-content %; screens suppliers via Sedex SAQ.
Implements Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) calculations; sets circular-packaging KPI.
Executes take-back programs; reports WBCSD Circular Transition Indicator scores.
Leads end-to-end circular-procurement policy; mentors buyers; secures 30 % footprint reduction across own-brand lines.

label: Store Edge IoT & Computer-Vision Loss Prevention
description: Deploys edge computing, Radio-Frequency Identification (RFID), and computer-vision analytics to detect theft, scan avoidance, and operational anomalies in real time while preserving customer privacy.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies shrink categories; explains difference between CCTV and AI cameras.
Installs edge nodes; configures basic object detection for empty-shelf alerts.
Integrates RFID door antennas; triggers real-time alerts to LP team; achieves 95 % detection precision.
Implements privacy-safe facial blurring; reduces total shrink by ≥ 8 %.
Leads enterprise edge-analytics roadmap; mentors LP analysts; collaborates with data-privacy KSA to ensure compliance.

label: Warehousing & Distribution Operations
description: Manages inbound, storage, picking, packing, and outbound processes in a distribution center (DC) using Warehouse Management System (WMS) and material-handling automation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows 5S; understands put-away locations.
Uses RF scanners; meets pick accuracy ≥ 99 %.
Implements slotting optimization; manages cross-dock flow.
Deploys Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMR); reduces dock-to-stock to < 4 hours.
Designs greenfield DCs; mentors supervisors; achieves 98 % OTIF with cost per order ≤$3.

label: Reverse Logistics & Returns Optimization
description: Designs and manages returns flows—including in-store, mail, and third-party drop-off—using disposition algorithms (resell, refurbish, recycle) to cut cost-to-return and environmental impact.
source_frameworks: Acta Technologia 2024 paper on reverse logistics

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains RMA (Return Merchandise Authorization) flow; recognizes serial/lot controls.
Processes returns in POS/OMS; prints prepaid labels; meets refund SLA < 48 h.
Applies disposition matrix; recovers value via recommerce marketplaces; tracks reason codes.
Deploys AI to predict return risk; reduces return rate ≥ 15 %; embeds sustainable packaging.
Leads closed-loop circular program; mentors logisticians; reports ESG savings in annual CSR.

label: Omnichannel Order Fulfillment & OMS Orchestration
description: Executes Buy Online Pick-Up In Store (BOPIS), ship-from-store, curbside, and drop-ship models; configures Order-Management System (OMS) sourcing and routing rules to balance speed, cost-to-serve, and inventory health while delivering on customer promise dates.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains basic flows for BOPIS, ship-from-store, and drop-ship; locates order status in OMS dashboard and verifies Service-Level Agreement (SLA) timers.
Picks, packs, and stages orders with ≥ 99 % scan accuracy; prints GS1-128 shipping labels; meets curbside pickup SLA < 2 hours.
Configures OMS sourcing logic (margin, proximity, capacity); orchestrates split shipments; maintains inventory integrity via real-time ATP (Available-to-Promise) feeds; keeps OTIF ≥ 95 %.

Implements micro-fulfillment centers and dark stores; optimizes cost-to-serve using AI dynamic sourcing; integrates last-mile carrier APIs for real-time delivery ETA; reduces average fulfillment cost ≥ 8 %.

Leads unified inventory and fulfillment strategy across regions; mentors operations and IT teams; attains 98 % customer-promise accuracy with same-day or next-day speed across 90 % of the network while maintaining net-margin goals.

label: Inventory Management Optimization
description: Balances inventory levels across warehouses, stores, and drop-ship partners using Economic Order Quantity (EOQ), safety-stock formulas, and warehouse management systems (WMS) to achieve target service levels at lowest carrying cost.
source_frameworks: APICS Inventory Management Body of Knowledge

proficiency_levels.indicator: Calculates days-of-supply; identifies stock-outs vs. overstocks.
Runs EOQ; sets min-max reorder points; performs cycle counting with ≤1 % variance.
Implements vendor-managed inventory (VMI); optimizes pick-face locations by ABC velocity.
Deploys AI demand-sensing and probabilistic safety stocks; reduces total inventory ≥ 10 % while raising fill rate to 97 %.
Leads network-wide inventory optimization using digital twin; mentors planners; aligns inventory turns with working-capital strategy.

label: Demand Forecasting & Replenishment
description: Generates sales forecasts using time-series, causal, and machine-learning models; drives automated store and DC replenishment with forecast accuracy bias < ±5 %.
source_frameworks: HBR Retail Demand Forecasting Case Study

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads forecast error metrics (MAPE, Bias); understands seasonality.
Applies moving-average and exponential smoothing; reviews exception reports.
Trains ML models with weather, promo lifts; tunes safety-stock to forecast error.
Conducts end-to-end forecast-value-add (FVA); collaborates with marketing for event uplift curves.
Leads Integrated Business Planning (IBP); mentors data scientists; delivers 30 % error reduction YOY.

label: Wholesale Negotiation & Vendor Management
description: Sources products, negotiates cost-of-goods-sold (COGS), terms, and trade funding; manages vendor scorecards on fill-rate, on-time, in-full (OTIF), and compliance fines.
source_frameworks: ISM CPSM Sourcing Body of Knowledge

proficiency_levels.indicator: Prepares request-for-quote (RFQ); tracks basic lead times.
Calculates landed cost; negotiates payment terms (e.g., 2 % 10 / Net 30).
Uses vendor scorecards (OTIF ≥ 95 %); negotiates co-op advertising and markdown money.
Structures joint business plans (JBP); mitigates currency and freight risk.
Leads global vendor-portfolio strategy; mentors buyers; achieves double-digit margin lift via strategic sourcing.

label: Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)
description: Manages concept-to-retire lifecycle—ideation, design, sourcing, launch, refresh, end-of-life—using PLM software and stage-gate governance to hit target cost and time-to-market.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists lifecycle stages; logs item setup data in PIM.
Tracks critical path for packaging and regulatory approvals.
Conducts cost-yield analysis; executes line reviews with vendors.
Integrates sustainability KPIs (recycled content, CO₂); accelerates iterations via digital samples.
Leads portfolio rationalization; mentors product developers; delivers 95 % hit rate on initial margin targets.

label: Merchandising Planning & Assortment
description: Builds localized assortment plans using sales, space, and shopper data; balances breadth, depth, and gross-margin return on inventory investment (GMROII).  Acronyms such as Stock-Keeping Unit (SKU) are spelled out at first use.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads planograms; identifies high-velocity SKUs and long-tail items.
Uses ABC analysis to rank SKUs; maintains safety stocks in ERP.
Builds seasonality curves; sets shelf facings by elasticity; collaborates with vendors on scan-based trading.
Runs GMROII and gross-margin return on space (GMROS) trade-offs; pilots localized assortments via test-and-learn.
Leads enterprise category-management strategy; mentors planners; drives AI-assortment optimization with 95 % in-stock at <15 days cover.

label: Unified Commerce Platform Architecture
description: Designs a single technology stack that unifies Point-of-Sale (POS), E-commerce, Order-Management System (OMS), Customer-Relationship Management (CRM), and Inventory into one data layer for real-time customer view.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines unified vs. omnichannel; identifies core systems.
Maps data flows; enables Single Sign-On (SSO) between POS and e-commerce.
Implements real-time inventory API; synchronizes loyalty points across channels.
Deploys micro-services Event-Driven Architecture (EDA); attains sub-second order status updates.
Leads enterprise re-platforming; mentors solution architects; raises NPS by 8 pts via frictionless CX.

label: Product Information Management & Digital Shelf
description: Curates accurate product content—titles, images, attributes—via Product Information Management (PIM) systems and distributes to e-commerce, in-store kiosks, and marketplaces using GS1 standards.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies Global Trade Item Number (GTIN); recognizes GS1 image naming.
Uploads hero images meeting 300-dpi rule; tags attributes for facets.
Syndicates content via GDSN; audits digital-shelf KPI (search rank, share of page).
Implements dynamic content optimization (360° spins, AR); reduces content defect rate < 1 %.
Leads global PIM governance; mentors teams; collaborates with GS1 workgroups on future digital-link standards.

label: Omnichannel Retail Operations
description: Coordinates retail operations across multiple channels (physical store, online store, mobile app, etc.);   ensures consistent inventory management (syncing stock between online and in-store), handles online order fulfillment and in-store pickup, aligns promotions and customer experience across channels, and utilizes retail tech (POS systems, order management software) to run a seamless omnichannel business.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Knows that a store can also sell online; has seen things like “buy online pick up in store” (BOPIS) as a concept.

Uses a POS system that also processes online orders; assists with packing online orders for shipment or setting aside pickup orders; updates inventory counts when something is sold or returned in either channel as instructed.

Manages daily e-commerce operations alongside the store (monitors online sales, adjusts in-store staffing for pickup rush hours); coordinates with warehouse or suppliers to keep both store and online stock replenished; handles basic customer inquiries that move between channels (like return an online purchase in store).

Implements new omnichannel services (curbside pickup, ship-from-store); utilizes analytics from each channel to optimize product placement and marketing; ensures the technology platforms (POS, e-commerce site, inventory system) are integrated and data is consistent; follows NRF best practices for unified commerce.

Develops omnichannel strategy at a regional or company level; leads digital transformation projects for a retail chain; ensures a single view of inventory and customer for the organization; stays at the forefront of retail tech innovations and possibly contributes to industry playbooks or case studies on successful omnichannel integration.

label: GS1 Barcode & RFID Standards
description: Implements Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) barcodes, GS1-128 case labels, and Electronic Product Code (EPC)-enabled RFID tags for end-to-end item visibility per GS1 Sunrise 2027 roadmap.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Differentiates EAN-13 vs. UPC-A; scans barcodes at POS.
Allocates GTIN; prints GS1-128 labels; validates check digit.
Deploys EPCglobal Gen 2 RFID readers; achieves ≥ 97 % read rate in DC.
Integrates RFID with WMS and OMS; uses real-time stock accuracy > 98 %.
Leads 2-D barcode transition (QR); mentors suppliers; collaborates with GS1 workgroups.

label: E-Commerce Platform Management
description: Configures and optimizes e-commerce platforms—Shopify Plus, Adobe Commerce (formerly Magento)—covering product catalogs, payment gateways, and performance SEO.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Navigates admin dashboard; updates product pages.
Sets tax rules; enables PCI-compliant checkout; installs apps.
Configures headless storefront API; optimizes Core Web Vitals < 2 s First Contentful Paint.
Implements A/B tests; integrates OMS and CRM via REST; reduces cart abandonment to < 60 %.
Leads multi-region rollout with localized content; mentors devs; lifts conversion rate 25 % YOY.

label: Customer Experience (CX) Design & Personalization
description: Maps end-to-end customer journeys, designs seamless store and digital touchpoints, and deploys Artificial-Intelligence-driven personalization engines that raise Net Promoter Score (NPS) and Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) while protecting privacy.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies primary personas and pain-points through observation and mystery shopping; defines baseline NPS and CSAT metrics.
Builds empathy maps and journey maps; launches A/B tests on page layout; establishes feedback loop for Voice of Customer (VOC) surveys.
Configures rules-based personalization (e.g., first-visit welcome, browsed-category messaging); segments customers via Recency–Frequency–Monetary (RFM) analysis; improves NPS ≥ 5 points.

Deploys real-time Machine-Learning recommender models using first-party data; coordinates omnichannel experience to achieve < 3 % friction-rate across touchpoints; links predictive CSAT to lifetime value.

Leads enterprise-wide CX and personalization strategy; mentors cross-functional design teams; delivers 10 % YoY revenue lift from hyper-personalized journeys while meeting GDPR/CCPA privacy standards.

label: Supply-Chain Security – ISO 28000
description: Establishes a Security Management System per ISO 28000 to protect cargo, facilities, and information throughout the supply chain, including C-TPAT criteria and incident response.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common cargo-theft risks; verifies seal numbers.
Maintains visitor logs; secures truck yards; files C-TPAT reports.
Conducts threat assessments; audits 3PL compliance; tracks incident KPIs.
Deploys IoT geo-fencing; integrates ISO 28000 with ISO 9001 and 14001; tests contingency plans.
Leads global supply-chain security program; mentors security managers; passes ISO 28000 certification audit.

label: Payment Security – PCI DSS 4.0
description: Implements Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) 4.0 controls—network segmentation, tokenization, multifactor authentication—to safeguard cardholder data.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes cardholder-data environment (CDE); completes security awareness training.
Maintains SAQ (A) or SAQ D; installs PA-DSS compliant payment app.
Implements point-to-point encryption (P2PE); monitors logs via SIEM.
Completes yearly ROC with QSA; reduces scope via tokenization; zero out stored PAN.
Leads enterprise PCI strategy; mentors info-sec staff; passes ROC with no high findings.

label: Occupational Safety – Retail (OSHA 1910)
description: Applies OSHA 29 CFR 1910 requirements—walking-working surfaces, ergonomics, powered industrial trucks—to mitigate retail workplace injuries.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies trip hazards; wears PPE; follows ladder safety.
Conducts daily PIT inspections; files incident reports within 24 h.
Performs hazard assessments; implements safe-lifting training; tracks DART rate.
Leads ergonomics program; integrates near-miss reporting dashboard; reduces recordable rate 25 %.
Achieves OSHA VPP Star status; mentors store safety champions; represents company in OSHA consultations.

label: Data Privacy & Consumer Trust (CCPA/GDPR)
description: Ensures compliance with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and the European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) by governing data collection, consent, deletion, and breach-response processes, thereby safeguarding consumer trust.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines personal data; locates privacy-policy link on site; explains consumer opt-out right.
Maps data flows; tags consent fields; fulfills deletion requests within 45 days.
Implements “Do Not Sell/Share” preference center; maintains records of processing; passes GDPR Article 30 audit.
Deploys data-minimization and tokenization; tests breach-response playbooks; reduces subject-access-request cycle to < 20 days.
Leads global privacy-by-design program; mentors DPOs; aligns consumer-trust KPIs with brand equity.

label: Retail Media Network Monetization
description: Builds and scales a Retail Media Network (RMN) that sells on-site, in-app, and in-store ad inventory, leveraging first-party data clean rooms to deliver return on ad spend (ROAS) and closed-loop attribution.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines RMN, ROAS, and on-site vs. off-site placements.
Sets CPM/CPC rate cards; activates sponsored-product ads; tracks click-through rate.
Uses clean rooms for privacy-safe targeting; reports closed-loop sales uplift.
Optimizes ad density and relevance per RMN UX guidelines; drives ROAS > 5 ×.
Leads multi-retailer RMN federation; mentors ad-ops; generates > 3 % incremental EBIT via media revenue.

label: Retail Data-Driven Decision Making
description: Leverages sales data, customer data (loyalty programs, CRM), and market trends to inform retail decisions;   analyzes point-of-sale reports and KPIs (like conversion rate, average basket size), monitors inventory turnover, identifies top-selling vs. slow-moving products, and uses customer insights to optimize merchandising, personalize marketing (targeted promotions), and improve store layout or product assortment.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Sees daily sales numbers and basic reports at store meetings; understands if sales are up or down generally and hears simple reasons (e.g., holiday, weather).

Reviews daily/weekly sales figures and foot traffic; assists in basic inventory counts or checks due to data indicating low stock; uses loyalty program info to recognize frequent customers and ensure their usual products are in stock.

Runs and interprets sales and inventory reports (e.g., sell-through rates, GMROI); makes recommendations like reordering a hot seller or marking down slow stock; segments customers from loyalty data to target promotions (e.g., send a coupon to high spenders); experiments with product placement and measures impact on sales.

Uses advanced analytics tools or dashboards provided by corporate; identifies complex patterns (like seasonal variation by category, or cross-product purchase correlations); plans store merchandising and staffing using data forecasts; works with marketing to execute data-driven campaigns (leveraging CRM insights) and then measures ROI.

Drives a culture of data in retail ops; possibly oversees multiple stores’ performance analysis; collaborates on selecting or customizing retail analytics software; mentors managers in interpreting data; provides shopper insights that influence higher-level assortment and marketing strategies, following NRF guidelines for analytics use and customer data ethics.

label: Retail Data Analytics & Insight
description: Collects and analyzes point-of-sale (POS), e-commerce, and loyalty data; builds dashboards and predictive models to drive basket size, margin, and customer lifetime value (CLV).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Pulls POS reports; plots basic KPIs (sales, units, margin).
Builds BI dashboards; segments customers by RFM (Recency, Frequency, Monetary).
Trains propensity models; A/B tests price elasticity; lifts promo ROI 10 %.
Deploys real-time streaming analytics; integrates in-store traffic sensors; links CX to CLV.
Leads enterprise data strategy; mentors analysts; monetizes data with vendors, adding > 2 % EBIT.

label: Meal Planning & Nutrition (DOmestic))
description: Creating balanced, budget‑friendly meal plans, accommodating dietary restrictions, and practising safe food handling per USDA guidelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads nutrition labels; separates raw vs. cooked foods; sets portion sizes.
Creates weekly menus; shops with budget lists; checks food temperatures; uses portion plates; accounts for allergies.
Adjusts for diabetes/gluten‑free diets; adapts texture; budgets groceries; tracks hydration; batch cooks; reduces food waste.
Utilizes meal‑planning software; analyses macro/micro nutrients; manages garden‑to‑table sourcing; monitors weight/BMI; reduces food waste %.
Leads community nutrition classes; develops culturally inclusive recipes; mentors families; publishes household‑nutrition guides.

label: Household Budgeting & Financial Management
description: Creating and maintaining household budgets, tracking expenses, and planning for emergencies using basic accounting principles.
source_frameworks: AARP Tech Tools for Financial Caregiving

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists income sources; records expenses; identifies essential vs. discretionary spending; notes income sources.
Sets budget categories; balances checkbook; saves receipts; sets reminders; dyncs bank feeds; analyses variances; flags anomalies.
Utilizes budgeting apps; monitors cash flow; plans savings goals; syncs bank feeds; analyses variances; flags anomalies.
Manages debt repayment; builds emergency fund; prepares basic tax records; manages power-of-attorney accounts; optimizes cashflow.
Coaches other caregivers; advises on benefit programs; publishes household‑finance tips.

label: Safe Mobility & Transfer Techniques
description: Utilises gait belts, slide sheets, and mechanical lifts to move care recipients safely, following OSHA Safe Patient Handling guidelines and AOTA caregiver ergonomics recommendations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies high-risk tasks; lists assistive devices.
Applies gait belt; uses proper body mechanics; communicates steps.
Employs slide sheet; adjusts wheelchair; prevents shear injuries.
Operates sit-to-stand lift; tailors home layout; reduces caregiver strain.
Teaches workshops; audits safety incidents; advises home-modification grants.

label: Infection-Control in Home-Care Settings
description: Applies CDC hand-hygiene, PPE, and environmental-cleaning guidance in the household, preventing cross-contamination for immunocompromised care recipients.
source_frameworks: WHO Five Moments for Hand Hygiene

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains transmission routes; identifies high-touch surfaces.
Performs 20-sec handwash; disinfects equipment; uses disposable gloves.
Implements isolation precautions; launders linens safely; tracks expiry of supplies.
Develops household IPC chart; coaches family; monitors adherence.

Oversees large-scale deployment of automation in a mining operation; works with engineers to implement new autonomous systems; contributes to shaping safety standards or best practices for mining automation; ensures integration of these systems yields ROI and safety gains.

Installs or monitors fixed sensor networks (for air quality, vibration); interprets readings to take preventive action; coordinates regular safety drills using automated alert systems.

Analyzes safety data trends to predict hazards (e.g., increasing gas readings in a section); implements new tech like wireless miner tracking or advanced ventilation controls; ensures MSHA compliance in all safety plans.

Designs comprehensive mine safety systems integrating IoT sensors, AI analytics for hazard prediction; updates company protocols in line with latest MSHA or ISO safety guidelines; leads accident investigations and contributes to industry-wide safety improvements through committees or publications.
