label: Informal Microenterprise Management
description: Runs small-scale businesses or hustles in the informal economy (e.g. street vending, unregistered home services); handles operations without formal frameworks – manages cash transactions, informal credit, supply sourcing through personal networks – demonstrating adaptability and entrepreneurial problem-solving under resource constraints.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes what constitutes informal work and basic survival strategies used (e.g. rotating savings clubs, cash-only sales).
Carries out a simple informal business (sells goods or offers a service locally); keeps basic mental/written notes of sales and costs; uses personal connections to find customers.

Grows an informal venture (expands product range or service reach); manages relationships with suppliers and customers reliably; navigates local informal rules or norms (market times, community credit practices).

Innovates to improve the microenterprise (adopts a mobile phone for orders/payments even if business unregistered); mentors others in the community starting their own informal ventures; adapts quickly to regulatory changes or enforcement crackdowns by shifting methods.

Operates multiple or highly profitable informal enterprises; plays a leadership role in informal sector networks; engages with NGOs or local authorities to improve conditions for informal traders, aligning with ILO recommendations for transitioning to formality.

label: Street-Vendor Operations
description: Manages product display, hygiene, and customer flow using Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) street-food center guidelines and local vendor association codes.
source_frameworks: UN Women Safe Markets Hygiene Checklist

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists layout and cleanliness rules; knows peak hours.
Sets stall ergonomically; stores perishables safely; greets customers.
Diversifies menu; tracks sales; manages waste disposal responsibly.
Meets hygiene audit; introduces digital payments; reduces wait time.
Chairs vendor union; negotiates shared utilities; mentors newcomers.

label: Peer-Network Trust Building
description: Cultivates cooperative relationships and social-capital using Harvard Business Review (HBR) trust frameworks and WhatsApp/Telegram group governance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies trust drivers (competence, reliability).
Joins local group; shares info; adheres to group rules.
Facilitates resource sharing; mediates disputes; logs contributions.
Structures rotating-savings group; tracks credit scores; organises training.
Leads federation; negotiates with buyers; mentors cluster leaders.

label: Barter & Alternative-Currency Trade
description: Conducts value exchange through barter, time-bank, and complementary-currency systems while maintaining accurate ledgers and aligning with community governance rules (e.g., LETS – Local Exchange Trading System).
source_frameworks: OECD Measuring the Non-Observed Economy Handbook

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains double-coincidence of wants; lists local barter platforms.
Prices goods in barter credits; records transactions; resolves simple disputes.
Calculates tax equivalence where required; promotes marketplace trust; tracks inventory rotation.
Designs community barter events; mitigates default risk; maintains ledger transparency using mobile apps.
Advises municipalities on complementary-currency policy; mentors exchange coordinators.

label: Pathway-to-Formalization Strategy
description: Evaluates timing, costs, and benefits of transitioning to semi-formal or formal status—selecting legal forms, registrations, and incentive programs.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies constraints (cost, bureaucracy, trust).
Maps incentives; sets milestones; defines KPIs.
Pilots simplified regime; monitors uptake; iterates.
Scales program; integrates digital ID & payments; reduces informality by 20 %.
Advises national taskforce; publishes policy brief; mentors NGOs.

label: Transition to Formal Economy Basics
description: Understands the basic steps and implications of moving informal businesses or work into the formal economy;   knows about business registration processes, basic licensing/permit requirements, simple accounting and taxation for micro-enterprises, and the benefits (and challenges) of formalization.
source_frameworks: World Bank Informal to Formal Toolkit

proficiency_levels.indicator: Has heard of business licenses and taxes; aware that formal businesses need to register but unsure of details.
Can identify local authorities or offices where one would register a business; understands simple record-keeping and that some tax might be due once formal.
Prepares minimal paperwork to register a small business (with help); navigates obtaining a permit or opening a bank account; calculates roughly how much tax or fees would apply.
Advises an informal peer on pros/cons of formalizing; completes formalization steps for own business; maintains basic financial records and complies with most regulations (e.g. gets a tax ID).

Works with NGOs or community programs to guide many informal workers into formal registration; influences policy by highlighting formalization barriers; possibly consults on reforms or tools (World Bank toolkit) to simplify formalization for micro-entrepreneurs.

label: Pathways to Formalisation & Social‑Protection Navigation
description: Guiding informal workers and micro‑enterprises through registration, taxation, and social‑protection schemes—health insurance, pensions—while leveraging digital‑identity and mobile‑money platforms.
source_frameworks: ILO Transition from the Informal to the Formal Economy Recommendation (No. 204)
World Bank Social Protection & Jobs Core Diagnostic

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains benefits of formalisation; lists basic registration steps; identifies social‑protection programs.
Completes business‑registration forms; opens mobile‑money accounts; submits simplified tax declarations.
Advises on simplified tax regimes; connects workers to micro‑insurance products; tracks contribution records.
Designs community outreach on formalisation; negotiates group‑registration incentives; analyses program uptake data.
Influences policy on social‑protection extension; builds digital platforms for one‑stop registration; publishes impact‑evaluation studies.

label: Micro-Enterprise Bootstrapping
description: Launches and sustains ultra-small ventures with minimal capital, leveraging recycled resources, sweat equity, and rapid reinvestment cycles.
source_frameworks: World Bank Skills for Informal-Sector Entrepreneurs

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines bootstrapping; lists low-cost resources; calculates break-even point and tracks basic expenses.
Utilises pre-order cash; barters services; rents equipment short-term.; reinvests early profits to expand inventory and reach.
Negotiates consignment; leverages supplier credit; reinvests profit.; applies lean-startup loops (build-measure-learn) in cash settings.
Crowdsources capital via mobile money groups; maintains 60-day cash runway; diversifies revenue streams; mentors peer entrepreneurs.
Scales micro-enterprise clusters; coaches cluster; documents case studies; influences micro-finance design and local policy.

label: Micro-Insurance & Risk Sharing
description: Accesses health, crop, and life micro-insurance via mobile platforms using International Association of Insurance Supervisors (IAIS) inclusive-insurance standards and index-based models.
source_frameworks: IAIS Application Paper on Inclusive Insurance

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines premium, coverage, claim; lists providers.
Registers policy via USSD; pays premium; knows claim hotline.
Understands exclusions; bundles with micro-credit; tracks renewal.
Participates in group policy; analyses payout triggers; educates community.
Negotiates customised schemes; influences regulators; mentors agent network.

label: Cash-Based Accounting
description: Maintains simplified cash-basis books—receipts, payments, petty-cash—aligned with International Federation of Accountants (IFAC) SME guidelines to support micro-enterprise decision-making.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Distinguishes cash vs accrual; identifies basic records (sales, expenses).
Uses columnar book or spreadsheet; reconciles cash daily; retains receipts.
Calculates profit, cash flow; separates personal and business funds; prepares simple tax worksheet.
Implements mobile-money sync; analyses seasonal trends; reduces cash-leakage risks.
Trains peer entrepreneurs; migrates to hybrid accrual when scaling; liaises with micro-financiers.

label: Platform Rights & Advocacy (Micro-Task)
description: Understands terms-of-service, rating algorithms, and dispute mechanisms on crowd-work platforms; advocates fair pay following Fairwork Foundation principles.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads platform terms; lists key metrics (acceptance, accuracy).
Tracks earnings per hour; avoids terms violations; files simple disputes.
Participates in forums; shares data; submits collective petitions.
Organises worker groups; negotiates rate increases; liaises with NGOs.
Influences policy hearings; publishes impact reports; mentors advocates.

label: Mobile-Money & e-Wallet Literacy
description: Sets up and safely uses mobile wallets, QR codes, and SMS banking to receive payments, transfer funds, and build transaction history.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes PIN safety; recognizes fee schedule; installs wallet app and performs test transfer.
Accepts customer e-payments; secures SIM and PIN; checks balance.
Uses analytics to track sales trends; negotiates lower fees; pays bills; saves in mobile wallet; resolves errors via call center.
Integrates wallet APIs with micro-inventory apps; analyses SMS statements; tracks business expenses.
Educates community on digital-payment security and adoption; partners with agents; advocates consumer-protection..

label: Digital Identity Inclusion for Informal Workers
description: Obtains and uses foundational or functional digital identity—SIM registration, mobile e-KYC—aligned with World Bank Identification for Development (ID4D) principles to access finance and formal services.
source_frameworks: GSMA Digital Identity for the Unregistered

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains benefits of digital ID; lists enrollment options.
Submits biometric data; secures One-Time Password (OTP); stores credentials safely.
Links ID to mobile money; retrieves e-records; updates status.
Uses self-sovereign ID wallet; accesses cross-border services; educates peers.
Advocates inclusive ID policy; mentors NGOs; contributes to interoperability pilots.

label: Personal Safety & Risk Mitigation
description: Implements situational-awareness, cash-handling, and gender-based-violence (GBV) prevention strategies for street and home-based workers per UN Women Safe-Markets toolkit.
source_frameworks: ILO OSH for Informal Workers Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common threats; lists emergency contacts.
Uses buddy system; conceals cash; practices safe routes.
Carries alarm devices; trains self-defense; logs incidents.
Coordinates community patrol; partners with police; advocates safer infrastructure.
Leads citywide safety campaign; secures funding; mentors trainers.

label: Informal‑Work OSH & Risk Management
description: Identifying and mitigating occupational‑safety and health (OSH) hazards in informal workplaces—street vending, home‑based production, waste picking—using participatory risk‑assessment tools and low‑cost protective measures.
source_frameworks: International Labour Organization (ILO) Participatory OSH Training Manual
ILO Safety & Health Toolkit for Informal Economy

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common informal‑sector hazards; uses basic personal protective equipment (PPE); knows local emergency contacts.
Conducts simple hazard mapping; implements housekeeping and hygiene practices; documents near misses.
Leads peer‑to‑peer safety dialogs; adapts low‑cost engineering controls; tracks incident data in logbooks.
Designs community OSH training; collaborates with local authorities on waste‑management safety; measures intervention outcomes.
Advises NGOs and governments on informal‑sector OSH programs; publishes research on participatory risk‑reduction models; advocates for OSH policy reforms.

label: Informal-Market Regulatory Awareness
description: Understands local bylaws, taxation thresholds, and pathways to partial or full formalization, mitigating fines and shutdowns.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies permits or fees commonly enforced in locality.
Displays permit; complies with waste and safety rules; adjusts operating hours/locations to stay within tolerances.
Joins vendor association; negotiates space allocation; maintains complaint log; completes basic registrations or cooperatives to access services.
Participates in policy dialog; uses SMS alerts for rule changes; advises peers; negotiates group licensing or market charters.
Chairs vendor committee; drafts improved regulations; partners with NGOs/government on inclusive regulatory reform.

label: WebXR Frontend Development
description: Builds immersive web experiences using WebXR Device API, Three.js, and WebGPU; ensures performance, security, and progressive fallback on non-XR browsers.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Enables immersive-vr session; displays simple scene.
Handles enter/exit-XR flows; manages hit-test and input actions.
Implements multiview, hand-tracking, and secure-context checks.
Integrates service-workers for offline assets; optimizes shaders with WebGPU.
Leads cross-platform WebXR PWA strategy; contributes to WebXR spec.

label: XR Interaction Design & HCI
description: Architects intuitive gesture, controller, voice, and eye-tracking interactions- while minimizing motion sickness and cognitive load. Applies established patterns—dwell, drag, teleport, object-manipulation, spatial menus—and evaluates affordances using Nielsen heuristics adapted to 3-D.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists common locomotion and manipulation techniques; follows platform input guidelines; avoids teleport-motion mismatch.
Implements grab/throw mechanics with comfort options.
Conducts usability tests; iterates on locomotion, haptics, and affordances; tunes grabbing pivots, inertia, and snapping for precision tasks.
Designs multimodal frameworks (voice + hand) and adaptive interfaces; balances usability vs immersion.
Publishes HCI research; sets safety comfort thresholds adopted by platforms; contributes to standards bodies.

label: Immersive Interaction & UX Design
description: Designing intuitive, accessible user interactions—gestural, voice, eye‑tracking—in immersive environments, applying ergonomics, affordances, and spatial‑UX heuristics to minimise discomfort and maximise engagement.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common XR gestures; explains comfort vs. presence trade‑offs; uses default interaction prefabs.
Aligns UI elements within 30–60 cm comfort zone; ensures legible text sizes; designs ray‑casting selection; applies safe‑zone guidelines; conducts basic VR sickness checks.
Implements hand‑tracking and haptic feedback; runs hallway‑usability tests; iterates based on System Usability Scale (SUS) and task-time studies.
Designs multi‑modal interactions (voice + gesture); applies Fitts’s Law in 3D; integrates accessibility features for low‑vision users.

Defines design systems for enterprise XR suites; mentors cross-func teams on spatial design literacy; leads enterprise UX standards for XR; publishes research on spatial‑interaction metrics; consults on ISO/IEC XR usability standards.

label: XR Production Workflow & Asset Optimization
description: Managing end‑to‑end extended‑reality (XR) content pipelines—3D asset creation, optimization, versioning—to deliver high‑performance experiences across mobile, standalone, and tethered devices.
source_frameworks: Epic Games Unreal Engine VR Optimization Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes stages from concept to release; imports models into game engines; recognizes polygon‑count versus performance trade‑offs; understands basic baking.
Sets up source-control repos; uses naming conventions; applies Level‑of‑Detail (LOD) systems; compresses textures; tests build size against target hardware.
Sets up automated asset‑pipeline scripts; profiles CPU/GPU performance; optimizes lighting via baked Global Illumination (GI); manages asset-bundle size budgets.
Manages version control (Git/LFS) for large assets; implements asset‑bundling and streaming; Integrates mocap/volumetric capture; establishes branching, review, and continuous‑integration build farm.
Leads multi‑studio XR productions; standardises cross‑platform asset guidelines; publishes optimization benchmarks.

label: XR Performance Optimization & Profiling
description: Diagnoses and resolves CPU/GPU/thermal bottlenecks to maintain target FPS, low motion-to-photon latency, and user comfort across devices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads frame-time budgets; identifies CPU vs GPU bottleneck; uses built-in profiler to spot frame drops.
Applies draw-call batching, texture atlases, and occlusion culling; reduces overdraw and shader variants.
Implements single-pass instancing, foveated rendering, GPU instance clustering, and memory pooling.
Automates performance regression tests; tunes thermal throttling mitigations; tunes XR compositor settings; integrates eye-tracked foveation.
Publishes optimization white-papers; defines performance certification criteria.

label: XR Hardware Integration & Prototyping
description: Integrates depth cameras, haptic wearables, eye-tracking, and custom controllers via firmware, SDKs, and rapid-prototyping toolchains.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies display panels, lenses, and tracking sensors; connects off-the-shelf peripherals; verifies driver installation.
3-D-prints mounts; flashes firmware; calibrates IMU drift; reads sensor data streams (IMU, depth) into engine events.
Prototypes custom input devices; tunes SLAM pipeline; calibrates latency and drift.
Designs PCB/firmware iterations; integrates custom haptics and eye tracking; prototypes passthrough; validates ergonomics and thermal performance.
Leads hardware roadmaps; develops reference hardware kits; contributes to OpenXR hardware extensions; collaborates with silicon vendors on reference designs.

label: Volumetric-Capture Pipeline
description: Captures, reconstructs, and streams dynamic 3-D humans or environments via multi-camera arrays, depth sensors, and neural-radiance-field post-processing; optimizes mesh fidelity vs bandwidth.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes light-stage vs depth-sensor capture methods.
Calibrates cameras; syncs timecodes; reconstructs low-res mesh.
Applies compression (Draco, MIV) and mesh cleanup; streams to WebRTC clients.
Integrates neural radiance fields; automates retopology.
Runs large-scale capture stage; sets SMPTE/ISO standards for 4-D pipelines.

label: Haptics-Interface Design for XR
description: Designs tactile and force-feedback patterns using actuators (LRAs, ERMs, piezo, pneumatic) mapped to XR interactions; validates latency, intensity, and user comfort.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains vibration frequency vs perceived intensity.
Implements simple vibration cues on controllers or gloves.
Designs multi-modal haptic patterns synchronised with visuals/audio.
Tunes latency <20 ms; supports variable-stiffness force-feedback.
Invents novel haptic metaphors; contributes to open haptic code-libraries.

label: Enterprise XR Deployment & Safety Management
description: Plans and manages large-scale XR roll-outs—device fleet, user provisioning, IT-security, ergonomics, ISO 9241-960 locomotion safety, OSHA workplace guidelines, training, and design reviews— while ensuring physical safety, cybersecurity, and organizational change‑management.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies trip hazards; performs basic device hygiene; configures guardian boundaries; follows headset‑cleaning protocols.
Sets device management policies; applies basic encryption; trains users on safe interactions; enforces passcodes.
Conducts risk assessments; integrates single sign‑on (SSO); configures network QoS and zero trust; monitors device telemetry for anomalies.
Implements role‑based access to XR data; aligns deployments to OSHA guidelines; integrates SOC-2 logging, and eye-safety policies for 1000+ headsets; manages change‑management communications.
Oversees global XR fleet management; shapes corporate XR governance; publishes safety‑audit frameworks.

label: Spatial Audio Engineering
description: Captures, mixes, and renders dynamic ambisonic or object-based soundscapes that respond to head tracking and environment geometry; integrates dynamic occlusion and reverb zones.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists ambisonic orders and binaural basics; places mono/stereo cues with basic attenuation.
Implements head-locked vs world-locked sources; configures reverb zones.
Mixes ambisonic beds; optimizes occlusion, diffraction,  reverb sends, and CPU budgets for real-time convolution.
Builds adaptive music layers and physics-driven audio emitters.
Develops proprietary spatialization plugins; Crafts mixed-reality adaptive mixes; publishes perceptual-audio research; mentors cross-team audio pipelines.

label: Social & Multiplayer XR Networking
description: Designs synchronous and asynchronous multiplayer experiences with spatial voice, avatars, and shared object-state; addresses latency, moderation, and safety per IEEE P3079 VR-sickness reduction.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Integrates basic lobby/room systems; enables VoIP defaults.
Syncs avatar transforms and simple interactions with authoritative server logic; implements session IDs.
Implements prediction/lag compensation, spatial voice, custom avatars with lip-sync, and user-generated rooms.
Designs cross-platform account systems, persistence layers, proximity-based moderation, block/mute, and safe zones.
Architectures large-scale social hubs; defines safety and privacy standards for virtual communities; publishes research on social presence.

label: Real-Time Engine Development (Unity/Unreal)
description: Engineers performant AR/VR applications using engine subsystems—rendering, physics, XR plugin management, shaders, and build pipelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Builds sample scenes; toggles XR plugins; runs sample scene on target device.
Writes basic C#/Blueprint scripts; codes basic interactions; builds Android and iOS packages; manages prefabs/actors for multiple headsets.
Profiles CPU/GPU; implements scriptable render pipelines and asset bundles; implements multiplayer replications.
Custom-codes shaders, native plugins, XR, subsystems, and build automations (CI/CD).
Optimizes multi-threaded XR loop; contributes to open-source XR engine modules.

label: XR Storytelling & Narrative Design
description: Designs multi-path, spatial narratives that exploit presence, agency, and environmental cues to drive emotional engagement in AR/VR experiences.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic story beats, triggers, environmental cues, and spatial flow.
Writes linear scripts with spatial Foley and voice-over; maps branching choices; uses gaze/gesture triggers.
Designs branching choices; implements gaze-based triggers; integrates environmental storytelling and diegetic UI across scenes.
Leads cross-disciplinary script rooms; prototypes interactive narrative loops with analytics; balances agency vs guidance; integrates dynamic music cues.
Creates industry-benchmark XR sagas; directs award-winning XR narratives; mentors writers and designers; defines best practices for presence-driven storytelling.

label: 3-D Asset Pipeline & Optimization
description: Produces low-latency 3-D assets—modeling, UV, baking, LODs, lightmaps—optimized for real-time engines and mobile XR hardware constraints.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists target poly and texture budgets for mobile VR; imports ready-made models; applies basic decimation.
Reduces polygon count; bakes normal maps and lightmaps; executes retopology, PBR texturing, and generates collision meshes.
Automates LOD chains; profiles GPU memory ; balances draw-call budgets per headset targets.
Builds procedural pipelines (Houdini, Blender Python) and GPU instancing schemes; implements streaming assets with Oodle/Krakatoa; tunes shader variants.
Defines studio asset-quality standards; pioneers new compression workflows for emerging chipsets; sets PBR material standards for WebXR and native.

label: AR Cloud & Geospatial Anchoring
description: Builds world-scale augmented-reality (AR) experiences using VPS (Visual Positioning System) and SLAM; manages GPS drift, latency, and crowdsourced environmental meshes to enable persistent anchors across sessions and devices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Places local anchors using platform API defaults; observes drift over time.
Publishes simple cloud anchors with short-term persistence; stores anchor IDs and metadata.
Implements geospatial anchors, image-based relocalization, and basic conflict resolution (including occlusion and scale errors.).
Synchronizes large-scale VPS datasets; optimizes bandwidth and privacy safeguards; caches meshes; partitions regions; manages anchor lifecycle for large venues.
Designs global AR-cloud architectures; defines cross-platform geopose standards; contributes to Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) AR interoperability groups.

label: XR Analytics & Telemetry
description: Captures, visualizes, and interprets frame-time, input, and spatial user-behavior data (gaze, movement, drop-offs); respects privacy rules (GDPR, COPPA) and visualises KPIs to drive design and monetization decisions.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Logs session duration and device type.
Generates heatmaps for gaze and interaction events.
Builds ETL pipelines; correlates telemetry with KPI dashboards.
Performs cohort analysis, A/B testing, and predictive churn modeling.
Defines org-level XR-data governance; architects privacy-preserving analytics frameworks; guides product strategy through data storytelling.

label: XR Ethics & Privacy Governance
description: Establishes ethical guidelines, consent flows, and data-governance models for biometric capture, spatial mapping, and user identity in immersive systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies sensitive XR data types (eye-tracking, biometrics); recognizes consent prompts.
Implements basic consent dialogs, data-retention notices, and notice & choice UI; encrypts biometric streams in transit
Conducts DPIAs (Data Protection Impact Assessments) and audits third-party SDKs.
Aligns practices with GDPR/COPPA; establishes data-minimization pipelines; establishes red-team review of XR data pipelines; publishes ethics reports.
Chairs ethics boards; leads cross-industry ethics coalitions; authors governance frameworks adopted globally.

label: XR Accessibility & Safety Engineering
description: Applies inclusive-design, motion-comfort, and privacy principles to minimize cybersickness, ensure physical safety, and accommodate diverse abilities.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common barriers (motion, text size, reach); follows headset guardian guidelines; offers seated/standing modes.
Implements comfort options (snap-turn, teleport) and subtitle/contrast toggles.
Conducts safety risk assessments; integrates screen-reader, one-hand mode, voice commands, and comfort-vignettes.
Develops adaptive comfort algorithms; conducts VPAT audits; user-tests with diverse abilities; audits data privacy and boundary systems.
Leads inclusive-design programs; authors enterprise accessibility policies; influences industry standards bodies.

label: Sustainability & Eco-Certification
description: Implements environmental-management systems and achieves eco-certifications by reducing energy, water, and waste footprints and engaging guests in sustainable practices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Sorts recyclables and promotes towel/linen re-use programs.
Tracks utility usage, reports sustainability KPIs, and trains staff on green SOPs.
Implements energy/water retrofits, achieves local green-hotel labels, and markets eco-packages.
Attains GSTC/LEED certification, conducts carbon audits, and integrates supply-chain sustainability.
Sets net-zero roadmaps, influences destination sustainability policy, and publishes ESG disclosures.

label: Hospitality ESG Reporting & Compliance
description: Collects and discloses Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics per Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) 302/305, Sustainable Hospitality Alliance Pathway, and forthcoming Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists ESG data categories; explains scope 1–3 emissions.
Tracks utilities in spreadsheets; publishes annual sustainability highlights.
Uses ESG software; calculates carbon intensity per occupied room; responds to investor surveys.
Aligns disclosures with Task-Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD); assures data externally.
Leads CSRD readiness; influences industry benchmarks; mentors ESG officers.

label: Health & Safety Compliance (Hospitality)
description: Ensures Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and World Health Organization (WHO) food-handling and sanitation standards across lodging operations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists PPE types; identifies hazard signs.
Conducts daily walk-through; logs incident reports.
Implements Safety Data Sheets (SDS); conducts toolbox talks; meets inspection criteria.
Runs root-cause analysis; reduces Lost-Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR).
Leads enterprise safety culture; certifies ISO 45001; mentors officers.

label: Eco‑Tourism & Sustainability Operations
description: Implementing environmentally responsible practices—energy efficiency, waste reduction, community engagement—to achieve certifications such as Green Key Global, LEED EBOM, or Global Sustainable Tourism Council (GSTC) standards.
source_frameworks: UN World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) Sustainable Tourism Guidelines

proficiency_levels.indicator: Separates recyclables; turns off unused equipment; explains towel‑reuse programs to guests.
Tracks energy and water usage; sources eco‑friendly amenities; posts sustainability signage.
Conducts carbon‑footprint assessments; partners with local suppliers; submits eco‑certification audits.
Implements renewable‑energy systems; designs circular‑economy initiatives; integrates sustainability KPIs into budgeting.
Leads destination‑wide sustainability strategies; secures green-finance; influences tourism policy; publishes research on sustainable hospitality.

label: Housekeeping Operations
description: Oversees cleaning, linen, and maintenance standards to ensure hygienic, aesthetically pleasing environments and quick room-turnaround cycles.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows SOPs for guest-room cleaning and replenishes amenities correctly.
Conducts inspections, reports maintenance issues, and tracks linen usage.
Generates staffing schedules based on occupancy forecasts and audits quality metrics.
Implements green-cleaning protocols, controls costs, and drives guest-satisfaction scores.
Designs brand housekeeping standards, leverages IoT sensors, and leads multi-property programs.

label: Hospitality Technology & PMS
description: Implements and maintains property-management systems (PMS) and integrated tech stacks—including POS, CRS, IoT devices—to streamline operations and enhance guest experiences.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Navigates PMS modules and follows data-security guidelines.
Configures rate codes, interfaces POS, and troubleshoots routine system errors.
Integrates APIs (CRM, RMS), deploys mobile key solutions, and manages vendor SLAs.
Leads cloud-migration projects, implements smart-room tech, and ensures PCI compliance.
Architects enterprise tech roadmaps, leverages AI chatbots, and negotiates global MSP contracts.

label: Front-Office Operations
description: Manages reception, reservations, cashiering, and concierge services while optimizing occupancy, revenue, and guest satisfaction.
source_frameworks: Hotel Technology Next Generation (HTNG) Interface Spec

proficiency_levels.indicator: Greets guests; verifies ID; understands PMS fields; executes standard check-in/out procedures and issues room keys securely.
Checks guests in/out; balances cashier shift; resolves simple billing issues; handles reservations; processes payments; and upsells room categories.
Balances cash, solves overbooking conflicts, upsells rooms, and monitors KPI dashboards.
Optimizes staffing, sets upsell targets, and integrates mobile/self-service tech.
Designs enterprise front-office workflows, selects PMS platforms, and mentors global teams.

label: Food & Beverage Service Management
description: Plans, directs, and optimizes restaurant, bar, banqueting, and room-service operations—balancing guest experience, safety compliance, and profitability.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies critical control points; explains FIFO (First-In, First-Out); follows safe-food handling and basic service etiquette.
Monitors holding temps; trains staff on hygiene; updates log sheets; performs table-service; cash handling; and basic inventory counts.
Forecasts covers, engineers menus for margin, and supervises shift teams.
Controls food/labor cost ratios, optimizes labor via scheduling analytics, curates beverage programs, and ensures HACCP compliance.
Creates multi-outlet F&B strategies, negotiates supplier contracts, and innovates culinary concepts.

label: Contactless Guest-Technology Operations
description: Deploys mobile check-in, digital keys, and QR-code ordering, ensuring Payment Card Industry Data-Security Standard (PCI-DSS) and General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance while enhancing guest convenience.
source_frameworks: Hotel Technology Next Generation Contactless Guidelines

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains Near-Field Communication (NFC) vs Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) keys.
Configures mobile key in PMS; troubleshoots app pairing; secures Wi-Fi network.
Integrates QR-ordering with POS; manages consent for data usage; tracks adoption metrics.
Links authentication to loyalty; applies zero-trust security; reduces check-in time by 50 %.
Leads chain-wide digital-guest journey transformation; mentors IT teams; gains brand recognition.

label: Hospitality Revenue & Yield Management
description: Applying dynamic pricing, demand forecasting, and distribution‑channel optimization to maximise RevPAR (Revenue per Available Room) and GOPPAR (Gross Operating Profit per Available Room) in hotels and events.
source_frameworks: Cornell School of Hotel Administration Revenue Management Framework

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines ADR (Average Daily Rate), occupancy, RevPAR; monitors competitor sets.
Updates rate codes; manages inventory blocks; analyses booking‑pace reports.
Builds demand‑forecast models; applies length‑of‑stay controls; optimizes OTA (Online Travel Agency) mix.
Implements dynamic pricing algorithms; integrates events revenue into total‑revenue management (TRM); negotiates distribution contracts.
Leads multi‑property revenue strategies; mentors revenue managers; publishes yield‑management research.

label: Revenue Management & Pricing
description: Maximizes top-line revenue and RevPAR by applying demand forecasting, inventory control, and dynamic pricing across channels.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Tracks daily occupancy, ADR, and RevPAR basics; reads STR report.
Applies BAR (Best Available Rate); loads rates in CRS/PMS and applies length-of-stay restrictions; analyses comp-set.
Builds demand forecasts, analyzes pickup curves, and optimizes OTA allocations.
Leads total-revenue strategy (rooms, F&B, ancillary), deploys RMS algorithms, measures displacement, and manages distribution costs.
Crafts regional pricing strategies, leverages AI predictive models, and drives owner-stakeholder alignment.

label: Online Hospitality Platform Management
description: Manages presence on online travel agencies (OTAs) and review sites (e.g. Expedia, Airbnb, TripAdvisor);   optimizes listings, responds to customer reviews, adjusts pricing and promotions based on platform analytics to maximize visibility and bookings.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Aware of major booking and review platforms; understands that online reputation impacts bookings.
Updates hotel or tour listings with accurate information and photos; responds politely to simple online reviews or inquiries following guidelines.
Analyzes platform analytics (views, conversion rates); adjusts rates or promotions; responds to reviews in a professional, personalized manner to improve ratings.
Develops strategies for multi-platform management; negotiates better placement or deals with OTAs; uses digital marketing tactics (SEO for listings, targeted ads) to drive traffic.

Leads a hospitality business’s entire online distribution and reputation strategy; integrates channel management software; mentors staff on digital customer engagement, aligning with industry certifications (e.g. HSMAI).

label: Hospitality Marketing & Digital Distribution
description: Develops and executes omnichannel marketing strategies, manages brand presence, and optimizes digital distribution to drive direct bookings and loyalty.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines RevPAR, COA, and conversion; identifies main OTAs; posts brand-approved content on social media and tracks basic engagement.
Manages OTA listings, updates website offers, and executes email campaigns.
Conducts SEO/SEM, analyzes attribution metrics, executes email funnels, and manages meta-search bidding.
Leads brand storytelling; personalizes offers via CRM segmentation; calculates return-on-ad-spend (ROAS); leverages look-alike audiences; and balances channel mix cost.
Crafts brand-wide distribution strategy, negotiates distribution partnerships, integrates Customer Data Platform (CDP), and pioneers data-driven loyalty ecosystems.

label: Wellness-Tourism Experience Design
description: Curates holistic wellness itineraries—spa, nutrition, mindfulness—aligned with Global Wellness Institute (GWI) standards and International Spa Association (ISPA) protocols.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines wellness pillars; recognizes contraindications.
Schedules treatments; coordinates healthy menus; tracks guest feedback.
Designs multi-day retreats; integrates biometric screening; partners with local healers.
Measures ROI via Average Wellness Spend per Guest; markets via niche OTA.
Establishes flagship wellness brand; publishes outcomes research; mentors wellness directors.

label: Multicultural Guest Relations
description: Delivers culturally responsive service, anticipates diverse guest needs, and resolves cross-cultural misunderstandings to elevate global guest satisfaction.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Uses basic cultural greetings and avoids biased language.
Provides language-support resources and adapts menu / amenity preferences.
Trains staff on cultural protocols, manages special requests, and mitigates conflicts.
Designs inclusive service standards, analyzes guest-segment feedback, and collaborates with multicultural marketing.
Shapes enterprise diversity-service strategy, partners with tourism boards, and publishes inclusion guidelines.

label: Inclusive & Accessibility Guest Experience
description: Designs barrier-free stays following Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.2), and International Association of Accessibility Professionals (IAAP) best practices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common barriers; lists room ADA features.
Provides tactile signage; ensures alt-text on website; records guest preferences.
Implements room-ready accessibility kits; trains staff in inclusive language.
Audits facilities via IAAP standards; integrates accessibility in design & marketing.
Leads universal-design renovations; obtains third-party certification; mentors teams.

label: Guest Services and Hospitality Management
description: Oversees hospitality operations and guest services – from accommodations and events to customer service – ensuring positive guest experiences and efficient service delivery.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Greets guests and handles simple requests or inquiries courteously under supervision.
Handles luggage; books taxis/tours; logs requests; manages check-ins, reservations, or routine event logistics reliably and addresses common guest needs.

Curates local experiences; manages VIP arrivals; maintains supplier database; coordinates multiple service areas (front desk, housekeeping, catering) to meet guest expectations and resolves non-routine issues.
Optimizes guest experience processes, handles high-pressure situations (overbookings, VIP clients) smoothly, and trains staff in service excellence.
Directs large-scale hospitality operations or major events, innovates service offerings to enhance satisfaction, and sets industry-leading customer service standards.

label: Guest Recovery & Complaint Resolution
description: Applying proactive listening, empathetic communication, and service‑recovery frameworks—such as HEART (Hear, Empathise, Apologise, Resolve, Thank)—to turn service failures into loyalty‑building experiences.
source_frameworks: American Hotel & Lodging Educational Institute (AHLEI) Guest Service Gold Curriculum

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges guest issues; follows basic apology scripts; escalates unresolved problems.
Applies HEART steps; logs incidents in property‑management system (PMS); offers token gestures (amenity, discount).
Conducts root‑cause analysis; tracks service‑recovery scores; personalises recovery offers to guest profiles.
Designs property‑wide recovery playbooks; trains staff in empathetic communication such as LEARN (Listen, Empathise, Apologise, Resolve, Notify); integrates feedback loops into quality dashboards.
Leads multi‑property service‑excellence programs; benchmarks recovery ROI; publishes research on complaint‑resolution best practices.

label: Customer-Experience Design (Hospitality)
description: Crafts end-to-end guest journeys—before, during, and after stays—using service-design tools, sensory cues, and feedback loops to maximize satisfaction and brand loyalty.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists touchpoints (pre-stay, stay, post-stay); explains NPS basics; identifies key touchpoints and records guest preferences.
Gathers feedback via surveys; maps simple guest journey; removes minor pain-points; fevelops simple journey maps and resolves minor pain points.
Uses service blueprints; conducts root-cause analysis; aligns amenities to personas; conducts VOC research; applies service-recovery protocols; and analyzes NPS data.
Implements sentiment analytics; personalises offers via PMS data; hits ≥80 % promoter rate; leads cross-department CX initiatives; prototypes new experiences; and tracks ROI.
Shapes enterprise CX strategy, embeds personalization engines, and influences industry standards.

label: Enhanced Health & Safety Standards
description: Implements and adheres to rigorous health and safety protocols in hospitality settings; maintains cleanliness standards (e.g., post-pandemic sanitization procedures), ensures food safety and emergency preparedness, and obtains relevant health/safety certifications (like HACCP, GBAC).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Knows basic hygiene and safety expectations (handwashing, surface cleaning, emergency exits).
Follows established cleaning checklists and safety procedures; wears proper PPE and enforces simple guest safety rules as instructed.
Manages daily compliance with enhanced protocols (regular sanitizations, health screenings if required); maintains logs for inspections; trains new staff on these procedures.

Develops and updates the venue’s health & safety plans; ensures compliance with local health regulations; coordinates with certification bodies (e.g., for HACCP in kitchens or GBAC Star facility accreditation).

Designs industry-leading health/safety programs for multiple properties; consults on national hospitality safety policies or WHO initiatives; leads crisis response for health-related incidents in hospitality contexts.

label: Hospitality Crisis Management
description: Prepares for, responds to, and recovers from crises—natural disasters, pandemics, security incidents—ensuring guest safety, operational continuity, and brand reputation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies crisis types; knows emergency contacts; understands emergency response procedures and assists during drills.
Activates crisis checklists, communicates status updates, and documents incidents.
Coordinates multi-department response, liaises with authorities, and manages guest relocations.
Executes business-continuity plans, leads crisis-communication teams, integrates business-interruption insurance and analyzes after-action reports.
Designs enterprise resilience frameworks, integrates insurance/risk finance, and advises industry bodies.

label: Event & Conference Planning
description: Designs, sells, and executes on-site, hybrid, and virtual meetings meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions (MICE) while coordinating vendors, budgets, and post-event evaluations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists typical function-rooms layouts; understands basic AV; prepares basic function sheets; and conducts site tours.
Drafts  Banquet Event Orders (BEOs); negotiates simple vendor contracts; and manages on-site setups.
Develops comprehensive run-of-show plans, handles AV and F&B logistics, and monitors budget adherence.
Secures large group business, leads multi-day conferences, executes crisis comms, and deploys event-tech platforms.
Designs destination-wide event strategies, directs convention-center event strategy, innovates hybrid formats, and measures economic impact.

label: Destination Management & Community Engagement
description: Coordinates destination-management initiatives with local stakeholders using United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) sustainable-destination criteria and resident-sentiment tracking.
source_frameworks: Global Sustainable Tourism Council Destination Criteria

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises overtourism indicators; lists key stakeholders.
Collects resident feedback; maps visitor flows; promotes heritage sites responsibly.
Implements carrying-capacity controls; balances events calendar; tracks community KPIs.
Secures GSTC destination certification; mitigates seasonality through marketing; funds local projects.
Leads regional DMO strategy; influences policy; mentors destination managers.

label: Telehealth Service Delivery
description: Provides synchronous and asynchronous virtual care; ensures licensure, consent, technology standards, reimbursement, and digital accessibility compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Schedules virtual visits; explains consent requirements; verifies patient identity and connectivity.
Performs standard tele-exam workflows; troubleshoots technical issues; documents telehealth encounters; educates patients.
Integrates remote patient monitoring (RPM) devices, monitors data alerts, and complies with licensure/payment policies.
Leads telehealth program expansion; optimizes virtual-first models; evaluates clinical outcomes; standardizes workflows; manages licensure compacts.
Develops enterprise telehealth strategy; secures interstate partnerships, and pioneers hybrid-care models.

label: Medical Device Regulatory Compliance
description: Navigates U.S. FDA and EU MDR pathways; implements Quality-Management System under 21 CFR 820/QMSR and ISO 13485; manages design history file (DHF) and post-market surveillance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Maintains device files and understands basic classification.
Prepares 510(k) submissions; maintains DHF and UDI labeling; files MDR reports; reports adverse events.
Conducts design-control audits; manages CAPAs; and liaises with FDA reviewers.
Oversees global regulatory strategy; drives risk-management files; Leads QMS remediation; manages PMS and vigilance; leads mock inspections.
Advises on regulatory-science strategy and policy; integrates real-world evidence; mentors compliance teams.

label: Healthcare Quality & Patient Safety
description: Applies quality-improvement science and patient-safety principles to reduce harm, improve clinical outcomes, and meet regulatory accreditation standards.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reports adverse events and participates in safety huddles.
Uses root-cause analysis tools; charts run/control charts; executes PDSA cycles; tracks unit-level quality metrics.
Leads RCA2 events; tracks HAC, HAI, and readmission metrics; analyzes control charts; implements best-practice bundles.
Oversees hospital-wide quality dashboards, aligns incentives, and passes accreditation surveys.
Guides achievement of zero-harm goals; shapes quality strategy across systems, publishes safety research, and influences national policy.

label: Public Health Surveillance & Epidemiology
description: Designs and operates surveillance systems, performs epidemiologic investigations, and interprets data to guide public-health interventions and policy; analyses trends and communicates findings to stakeholders.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows case-definition guidelines and enters surveillance data accurately.
Enters data into surveillance platforms; calculates incidence/prevalence; creates epi-curves; drafts investigation summaries.
Conducts field investigations; applies statistical tests; ; calculates R₀ and attack rates; communicates findings to stakeholders.
Leads multi-jurisdictional outbreak response; automates ELR, eCR, and ESSENCE feeds; performs modeling evaluates surveillance systems; publishes reports.
Designs national surveillance frameworks; integrates novel data streams (e.g., wastewater, syndromic); mentors epidemiologists; advises WHO/CDC.

label: Population Health Management
description: Stratifies risk, targets interventions, and tracks outcomes across attributed populations; leverages registries, HIE data, and predictive analytics to improve cost and quality.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic population segments and retrieves registry reports.
Calculates quality measures, gaps in care, and risk scores; sends patient reminders.
Builds dashboards for gaps-in-care; designs targeted outreach, evaluates ROI, and collaborates with community resources.
Leads accountable-care initiatives; negotiates shared-savings contracts;drives SDOH and claims analytics; deploys predictive models.
Crafts regional population-health strategy; integrates multi-payer data; leads value-based contracts and shapes reimbursement models; publishes population-level outcomes.

label: Health Equity & Community Engagement
description: Addresses social determinants of health (SDOH); collaborates with community-based organizations to design culturally tailored interventions and measure equity outcomes.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes basic health-equity concepts; identifies SDOH factor; attends community meetings.
Conducts stakeholder mapping; facilitates focus groups; collects demographic data, applies plain-language principles, and adapts materials culturally.
Conducts equity impact assessments; facilitates community advisory boards; integrates SDOH Z-codes into EHR; tracks disparity metrics.
Leads cross-sector coalitions, secures grant funding, and implements evidence-based equity interventions.
Shapes organizational equity strategy and policy, evaluates systemic barriers, and influences public-health policy.

label: Essential Public-Health Competencies
description: Applying the World Health Organization (WHO) Essential Public Health Functions—surveillance, health‑promotion, emergency preparedness, governance & Council on Linkages Core Competencies—assessment, policy development, communication, and leadership—to protect and improve population health through multidisciplinary collaboration.
source_frameworks: PHF Core Competencies for Public Health Professionals (2021)
WHO Roadmap for Strengthening the Public Health and Emergency Workforce 2024
Council on Linkages Core Competencies for Public Health Professionals

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines the Essential Public Health Functions (EPHFs); recognizes social determinants of health; follows basic epidemiological terminology.
Collects routine surveillance data; supports risk communication; participates in vaccination campaigns; communicates health messages to the public.
Conducts outbreak investigations; applies One‑Health approaches; evaluates health‑promotion interventions; drafts evidence-based policy briefs.
Manages cross-sector coalitions; designs population‑health surveillance systems; manages emergency‑preparedness drills; integrates health equity impact assessments; evaluates program impact.
Leads health-department strategic planning and national public‑health programs; advises on global health security frameworks; publishes research on EPHF implementation.

label: Health Informatics & EHR Management
description: Configures electronic-health-record (EHR) systems, clinical decision support, data governance, and analytics to improve quality and clinician workflow.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Enters structured clinical data and navigates the EHR workflows safely.
Builds order sets, templates, and user preferences; reports minor system issues.
Configures interoperability interfaces; implements CDS rules; manages data dictionaries; validates data quality; deploys CDS alerts.
Leads EHR optimization projects; conducts usability analyses; integrates external data via APIs; ensures regulatory compliance.
Architects enterprise informatics strategy, champions standards adoption, and drives vendor negotiations.

label: FHIR-Based Interoperability Engineering
description: Designing, developing, and testing Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) application‑programming interfaces (APIs) and implementation guides to enable secure, standards‑based data exchange across electronic health‑record systems.
source_frameworks: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC) 21st Century Cures Act Final Rule

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes resources, profiles, and RESTful operations; explains FHIR resource structure; uses public FHIR sandboxes; understands basic Health Level Seven (HL7) concepts.
Builds RESTful FHIR endpoints; validates resources with FHIR validator; implements SMART‑on‑FHIR authentication.
Develops custom profiles and extensions; maps legacy HL7 v2 messages to FHIR; implements bulk-data, CDS Hooks, and SMART apps.

Optimises API performance; ensures compliance with United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI); integrates patient‑generated data from wearables; validates IGs, runs inferno tests, and manages versioning
Authors national implementation guides; leads health‑information exchange (HIE) architectures; contributes to HL7 Da Vinci and Gravity project standards.

label: AI-Enabled Clinical Decision Support
description: Evaluates, integrates, and monitors machine-learning and large-language-model tools for diagnostics, triage, and workflow automation; addresses bias, safety, and FDA Software-as-Medical-Device (SaMD) guidance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes AI vs traditional CDS; recognizes potential bias.
Validates vendor model performance on local data; monitors drift.
Implements HL7 CDS-Hooks or FHIR-based AI APIs; documents model facts labels.
Leads clinical trials for AI tools; sets governance for continuous learning.
Defines enterprise AI-CDS strategy; contributes to regulatory frameworks.

label: Value-Based Care Data & Quality Metrics
description: Collecting, analyzing, and reporting clinical and financial metrics—quality measures, patient‑reported outcomes, cost‑of‑care indicators—to support value‑based payment models, risk adjustment, and continuous improvement.
source_frameworks: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Merit‑based Incentive Payment System (MIPS) Quality Measures
National Quality Forum (NQF) Measure Evaluation Framework

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists common quality measures (e.g., readmission rates); recognizes basic cost‑of‑care terminology; references MIPS categories.
Extracts measure data from electronic health records (EHRs); calculates numerator and denominator; validates data sources; submits data via Quality Payment Program (QPP) portals.
Performs risk adjustment and benchmarking; links clinical outcomes to claims data; visualises composite scores; submits QRDA/IQR files.
Designs dashboards for accountable‑care organizations (ACOs); models shared‑savings forecasts; integrates social‑risk stratification; leads gap-closure initiatives; integrates feedback loops.

Shapes organization’s VBC contract strategy; leads value‑based contracting analytics; advises on national measure‑development; publishes research on value‑based performance; collaborates with CMS/NCQA.

label: Revenue Cycle & Healthcare Finance
description: Manages end-to-end revenue-cycle activities—registration, patient access, charge capture, coding (ICD-10-CM/PCS, CPT), claims, denials, and payer contracts to optimize cash flow and ensure regulatory compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains front-end vs back-end revenue-cycle steps; verifies insurance information and captures basic demographics accurately.
Verifies eligibility; applies ICD-10-CM / CPT codes; submits claims; posts payments; resolves edits.
Analyzes denial trends; negotiates payment plans; uses RCM dashboards; implements coder education.
Leads revenue-cycle optimization projects; aligns with value-based contracts; automates RPA bots; negotiates payer contracts; benchmarks KPIs ensures audit readiness.
Designs enterprise finance strategy; leads enterprise revenue-integrity program; aligns with value-based models integrates AI-driven RCM tools; mentors financial analysts.

label: Emergency Preparedness in Healthcare
description: Develops and maintains emergency-preparedness plans for healthcare facilities, ensuring continuity of critical functions and coordination with public-health agencies.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes four core elements (risk assessment, P&P, training, comms); participates in drills;understands basic emergency codes.
Updates unit response plans, stocks supplies, and completes incident reports.
Conducts hazard vulnerability analyses; manages vendor and MOU agreements; coordinates surge staffing; manages HICS roles.
Leads full-scale exercises, integrates regional coalitions, and evaluates after-action reports.
Directs enterprise all-hazards preparedness strategy; aligns with national response frameworks; liaises with FEMA/HHS ASPR; mentors emergency managers.

label: Data Privacy & Security (HIPAA)
description: Safeguards protected health information (PHI) per the HIPAA Privacy, Security, and Breach-Notification Rules; implements administrative, physical, and technical safeguards and conducts risk assessments.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies PHI and follows basic privacy procedures.
Applies role-based access controls; encrypts data; reports incidents promptly.
Conducts risk assessments; manages BAAs; implements audit controls.
Leads security-incident response; integrates vulnerability testing; audits logs and DLP tools; trains workforce.
Leads organization-wide HIPAA compliance and OCR investigations; aligns with international standards; influences policy.

label: Clinical Care Coordination
description: Orchestrates patient-centered plans of care, aligning interdisciplinary team (physicians, nurses, pharmacists, and allied staff) actions, resources, and timelines to achieve optimal clinical and psychosocial outcomes.
source_frameworks: Agency for Healthcare Research & Quality (AHRQ) TeamSTEPPS

proficiency_levels.indicator: Participates in daily huddles; gathers basic patient data; communicates care-plan updates to team members.
Develops care pathways for routine cases; updates shared care plans; tracks pathway adherence; schedules follow-up services.
Manages complex care transitions; reconciles medications; resolves service gaps.
Leads interdisciplinary rounds; leverages analytics to reduce readmissions; revises pathways for efficiency; mentors new coordinators.
Designs enterprise care-coordination models; integrates social determinants of health;  influences reimbursement policy; publishes best-practice toolkits.

label: Case Management and Care Coordination
description: Assesses patient needs, develops care plans, coordinates multidisciplinary teams, and manages transitions of care to reduce readmissions and improve patient experience.
source_frameworks: Commission for Case Manager Certification (CCMC) Standards

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains roles of case manager vs social worker; follows established care plans and carries out basic caregiving or support tasks as directed by supervisors.
Schedules routine appointments; conducts needs assessment; assists clients with accessing services; and maintains records of services provided under guidance; arranges follow-up appointments.

Utilises risk-stratification tools; coordinates with multiple providers (medical, social, community) to implement a comprehensive care plan and adjusts services to client needs; reconciles medications post-discharge.

Implements closed-loop referral workflows; develops individualized care plans for complex cases, monitors progress, and adjusts resources or interventions as clients’ needs evolve; reports quality metrics.
Oversees care management programs or departments; establishes best practices for service coordination; ; secures payer contracts;  mentors case managers or social workers.

label: Behavioral Health Integration
description: Integrates mental-health and substance-use services into primary and specialty care, applying collaborative-care models, evidence-based screenings, and trauma-informed approaches.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Administers basic mental-health screenings, flags positives, and documents results.
Coordinates warm hand-offs to behavioral providers and follows SBIRT protocols.
Tracks caseload registry; implements collaborative-care workflows; tracks PHQ-9/ GAD-7 scores; evaluates outcomes; participates in weekly case reviews.
Leads integration pilots; secures reimbursement pathways; integrates tele-psychiatry consults; and trains multidisciplinary teams.
Shapes system-wide behavioral-integration policy, embeds digital therapeutics, and contributes to research.

label: Intergovernmental Relations & Stakeholder Engagement
description: Coordinates policies and programs across federal, state, local, and tribal entities; fosters partnerships with civil society and industry to advance shared objectives.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies key jurisdictions and mandates; maps stakeholders; maintains contact lists and attends coordination meetings.
Organises bilateral meetings; drafts Memorandum of Understanding (MoU); prepares briefing materials; records commitments; and follows up on actions.
Negotiates MOUs, designs outreach sessions, resolves jurisdictional conflicts, and tracks commitments.
Coordinates multilevel governance on complex policy (e.g., climate); reports joint outcomes.; leads interagency task forces, secures co-funding agreements, and manages high-visibility consultations.
Shapes national intergovernmental policy, brokers multi-level governance compacts, and mentors liaison officers.

label: Public-Sector Project Management
description: Plans, executes, and controls government projects using industry frameworks adapted for public-sector constraints, emphasizing value delivery, risk, and accountability.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies project objectives, scope, and basic milestones.
Develops work breakdown structures, schedules, and cost estimates.
Applies earned-value management (EVM), manages risks, and reports performance metrics.
Aligns projects with strategic plans, leads integrated project teams, and conducts independent reviews.
Oversees enterprise portfolio management, champions agile government practices, and sets PM policy.

label: Public Policy Development
description: Researches, develops, and implements public policies and programs, coordinating with stakeholders and complying with governmental regulations to address community needs.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands the basic structure of government agencies and the fundamental steps in the policy-making process.
Assists in gathering data or drafting portions of policy documents under supervision.
Designs options analysis; facilitates public consultation; prepares cabinet memo; analyzes policy impacts, prepares briefs or reports, and coordinates stakeholder feedback for policy proposals.
Leads the development of significant policy initiatives, navigating regulatory approvals and managing public communications.
Shapes broad government strategies, oversees multi-agency programs, and mentors policymakers in legislative and regulatory processes.

label: Data-Driven Public Policy & Analytics
description: Utilizes data analysis and evidence-based methods in policy development and public administration;   interprets data from open data portals, statistical reports, and smart city sensors to inform decisions, and measures policy outcomes with quantitative metrics.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands the concept of evidence-based policy and knows that data (surveys, statistics) can guide decisions; explains open-data licenses; recognizes Personally Identifiable Information (PII) safeguards.
Cleans CSV files; generates summary tables; retrieves basic datasets or reports (e.g., census data, budget figures) and uses them to create simple charts or summaries for a policy proposal.

Builds regression or clustering models; maps policy indicators; shares dashboards securely; performs analysis on public datasets (e.g., trends in traffic data for transit policy); uses tools like Excel or basic GIS to support arguments; contributes to open data releases.

Automates Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines; integrates APIs; validates model accuracy; designs key performance indicators (KPIs) for programs; uses advanced analytics or visualization (BI tools, statistical software) to evaluate policy impact; ensures data quality and ethics in analysis.

Leads a government analytics unit; incorporates big data or AI (when appropriate) into forecasting and policy simulations; shapes data governance policies and open data initiatives in line with OECD frameworks.

label: Participatory Budgeting & Civic Engagement
description: Designs and implements participatory-budgeting (PB) cycles, facilitating citizen idea generation, deliberation, voting, and transparent allocation in accordance with International Association for Public Participation (IAP2) standards.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines PB stages; understands inclusion principles (gender, youth).
Conducts outreach; moderates idea workshops; posts budget data online.
Implements secure e-voting; validates cost estimates; publishes progress dashboards.
Integrates PB with annual budget cycle; analyses equity outcomes; scales to multiple districts.
Advises national PB policy; secures donor funding; mentors civic-engagement teams.

label: Evidence‑Based Policy Analytics
description: Leveraging administrative data, statistical methods, and program‑evaluation techniques to formulate, implement, and review public policies in compliance with the Foundations for Evidence‑Based Policymaking Act and OMB Circular A‑11.
source_frameworks: U.S. Foundations for Evidence-Based Policymaking Act

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies data sources; understands logic‑model basics; distinguishes outputs vs. outcomes.
Collects administrative datasets; performs descriptive statistics; drafts evaluation questions.
Conducts quasi‑experimental designs; applies machine‑learning prediction to policy targeting; visualises findings for stakeholders.
Integrates cross‑agency data; manages privacy‑preserving record linkage; publishes Evidence Act Learning Agendas.
Leads national policy‑evaluation portfolios; standardises evidence‑quality criteria; advises Congress on data‑driven legislation.

label: Policy Analysis & Program Evaluation
description: Conducts rigorous policy research, impact assessments, and program evaluations to inform decision-making and improve public outcomes.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains formative vs summative evaluation; collects qualitative and quantitative data and summarizes literature.
Drafts logic models, selects design (experimental, quasi-experimental, qualitative), drafts scope, calculates basic cost-benefit ratios, and prepares policy briefs.
Collects mixed-methods data, applies statistical tests, triangulates findings, drafts evidence matrix, and formulates recommendations.
Leads multi-stakeholder evaluations, integrates equity lenses, calculates effect size, assesses cost-benefit, communicates actionable recommendations, and defends findings to oversight bodies.
Sets agency evaluation agendas, pioneers experimental policy labs, and publishes peer-reviewed studies.

label: Performance Measurement & Results-Based Management
description: Develops and implements performance frameworks, KPIs, and data-driven reviews to ensure programs deliver results aligned with strategic goals and statutory mandates.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Differentiates inputs, outputs, outcomes, impact; collects performance data and updates dashboards per guidance.
Develops SMART indicators, defines output/outcome indicators and drafts quarterly performance narratives.
Conducts root-cause analyses, supports strategic reviews, collects data, reports progress, and recommends corrective actions.
Conducts outcome evaluations, integrates performance budgeting, facilitates data-driven decision forums, and validates data quality.
Architect of enterprise performance systems, influences legislative reporting standards, and trains senior leaders.

label: Legislative Drafting & Regulatory Compliance
description: Drafts statutes and regulations, navigates rulemaking procedures, and ensures alignment with administrative-law standards and oversight requirements.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies bill sections (preamble, clause, schedule); explains enabling vs subsidiary legislation; cites legal authorities and formats basic rule text accurately.
Drafts purpose clause; checks definitions; cites enabling authority; prepares notices of proposed rulemaking (NPRM) and tracks public comments.
Conducts regulatory impact analyses; harmonises cross-references; liaises with legal editors; resolves interagency concerns; and drafts final rules.
Coordinates Congressional liaison, manages consultation feedback, litigates administrative challenges, and trains drafters.
Crafts landmark legislation, steers complex omnibus rules, and advises on regulatory-policy reforms.

label: Public-Private Partnership Management
description: Structures, negotiates, and manages public-private partnerships (PPP) using World Bank PPP Reference Guide and International Project Finance Association (IPFA) best practices to deliver infrastructure and services.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines PPP models (BOT, DBFO) and risk-allocation principles.
Screens projects; drafts pre-feasibility study; sets Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Runs value-for-money (VfM) analysis; manages tender; negotiates term sheet.
Oversees financial close; monitors contract compliance; renegotiates amendments.
Leads national PPP unit; structures multi-billion portfolio; mentors sector agencies.

label: Public Budgeting & Financial Management
description: Plans, allocates, and monitors public funds in compliance with statutory requirements and sound fiscal-management principles, supporting transparency and stewardship.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines budget classifications (economic, functional); distinguishes cash vs accrual; prepares basic cost estimates and understands the budget calendar.
Compiles baseline budget, forms program justifications, reconciles obligations, and follows apportionment rules.
Conducts mid-year review, performs variance analysis, reprogramming requests, and multi-year budget projections.
Leads cross-agency budget formulation, integrates performance data, and ensures Anti-Deficiency Act compliance.
Shapes fiscal policy, optimizes enterprise resource-planning (ERP) integration, negotiates donor budget support, and mentors public-finance professionals.

label: Government Procurement & Contract Management
description: Executes end-to-end acquisition life-cycle activities—planning, solicitation, negotiation, administration, and closeout—ensuring best value, fairness, and compliance with the Federal Acquisition Regulation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists procurement methods (open, restricted, negotiated); prepares purchase requests and understands micro-purchase thresholds.
Drafts request for proposal (RFP), sets evaluation criteria, drafts statements of work (SOW), evaluates bids, and maintains contract files.
Negotiates cost-reimbursable contracts, manages modifications, monitors contractor performance, and manages risks.
Leads source-selection boards, resolves disputes, and applies cost-price analytics.
Designs acquisition strategies, leads procurement-reform program, optimizes category management, and mentors contracting officers.

label: Public-Service Ethics & Accountability
