Troubleshoots ground faults; upgrades systems; optimizes production via shading analysis and micro‑inverter selection.
Leads multi-megawatt installs; designs utility‑scale PV systems; trains installers.

label: Renewable Energy Systems Integration
description: Implements and manages renewable energy technologies (solar, wind, etc.) and integrates them with existing systems to advance sustainability and efficiency; studies power-quality, inertia, and flexibility; designs EMS and forecasting.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes common renewable energy components like solar panels, wind turbines, and basic storage batteries; lists curtailment, ramp-rate, and voltage-ride-through terms
Assists in installing or configuring small-scale renewable systems according to established plans and safety standards; models day-ahead forecasts; configures inverters for reactive power.
Conducts hosting-capacity studies; integrates multiple renewable sources with energy storage and existing grids at a project level, addressing intermittency and load considerations.
Optimizes performance of renewable energy installations, implements grid-forming inverters; analyzes data to improve output, and troubleshoots complex integration issues; coordinates with TSOs.
Leads regional integration plans and large-scale renewable energy projects, shapes sustainable energy policies/standards, and innovates new integration techniques, mentoring others in the field.

label: Renewable Energy Systems Design
description: Performs resource assessment, sizing, and electrical design for solar PV, wind, and hybrid plants; uses tools (PV*SOL, WindPRO) and codes (IEC 62548).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads solar irradiance maps; identifies wind‑class zones; understands basic components.
Uses PVsyst/SAM models; sizes inverters; calculates capacity factors.
Conducts site assessments; designs electrical layouts, protections, and grounding; models wake effects; develops single‑line diagrams.
Integrates battery storage; performs grid‑impact studies; optimizes levelized cost of energy (LCOE); secures permits.
Leads utility‑scale project design; secures interconnection approvals; publishes renewable‑design research.

label: Renewable‑Hydrogen Supply‑Chain Management
description: Planning, coordinating, and optimizing the production, storage, transport, and distribution of renewable‑based hydrogen—from electrolyser siting to end‑use delivery—ensuring cost efficiency, safety, and carbon‑intensity targets.
source_frameworks: International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA) Green Hydrogen Supply Chain Report 2025

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes key supply‑chain stages and grey vs green vs blue hydrogen; distinguishes compressed‑gas vs. liquid hydrogen; notes transport modes.
Calculates levelised electrolyser sizing,  capacity factor, and supply‑chain costs; tracks pressure‑vessel certifications; schedules trailer deliveries.
Optimises logistics routes; assesses pipeline‑blend feasibility; applies ISO 19880‑1 safety requirements.
Performs LCOH analysis; manages H₂ certification and offtake; coordinates port export terminals; secures power‑purchase agreements; implements digital‑twin logistics models.
Designs global renewable‑hydrogen corridors; advises governments on supply‑chain policy; publishes cost‑reduction roadmaps.

label: Green Finance & ESG Reporting
description: Structuring green bonds, sustainability‑linked loans, and ESG disclosures, aligning with EU Taxonomy, Green Bond Principles, and Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) standards.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines green‑finance instruments; lists ESG metrics; recognizes investor expectations.
Compiles ESG data; calculates KPI baselines; drafts TCFD-aligned climate disclosures; tracks KPIs.
Aligns projects to EU Taxonomy; engages second‑party opinions; reports GHG reductions; manages bond frameworks.
Structures sustainability‑linked loans; manages ongoing disclosure; assesses impact KPIs.
Leads corporate green‑finance strategy; advises regulators; publishes ESG‑finance research.

label: Green Building Principles
description: Applies LEED, BREEAM, and WELL frameworks to optimize energy, water, materials, and indoor-environment quality in buildings.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes LEED credit categories; chooses eco‑friendly materials where available.
Calculates preliminary scorecards; selects low-VOC materials; implements simple waste‑reduction and recycling on site.
Calculates insulation R‑values and daylighting requirements; leads energy-model compliance; coordinates commissioning.
Guides projects through LEED or equivalent certification; achieves Platinum projects; integrates biophilic design.
Designs net‑zero or regenerative building strategies across portfolios.

label: Energy Auditing and Efficiency Optimization
description: Conducts ASHRAE Level 1-3 audits; benchmarks facilities, identifies ECMs (energy-conservation measures), calculates ROI, and verifies M&V results.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies obvious energy wastes (e.g. lights left on, poor insulation) and suggests basic remedies; familiar with the concept of an energy audit; reads utility bills and basic ENERGY STAR scores.
Performs walk-through audit; uses simple tools (e.g. energy meters or IR thermometers) to measure usage; documents findings; ; lists low-cost ECMs and recommends straightforward fixes.

Conducts detailed energy audits of facilities, analyzing HVAC, electrical, and building envelope performance; uses data-loggers and BMS exports; calculates ROI for efficiency upgrades such as equipment retrofits or improved controls.

Implements comprehensive energy optimization projects (advanced HVAC control systems, variable frequency drives, etc.); monitors energy metrics over time to validate savings and adjust strategies; oversees retro-commissioning.

Develops organization-wide energy management policies and programs; integrates IoT sensors and automation for real-time energy optimization; guides large-scale sustainability initiatives and certifications (e.g. LEED, Energy Star).

label: Climate Risk Modelling & Scenario Analysis
description: Modelling physical and transition climate risks using climate-economic models (GCAM, REMIND), network-based stress tests, downscaled climate data, and Task Force on Climate‑related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) frameworks.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies RCP/SSP scenarios; maps hazards; reviews TCFD pillars.
Imports climate datasets; runs simple exposure analyses; interprets outputs; reports qualitative risks.
Performs sector vulnerability assessments; applies damage functions; quantifies transition pathways.
Builds stochastic scenario models; integrates financial stress tests; aligns disclosures with ISSB.
Leads enterprise climate‑risk analytics; shapes reporting standards; publishes scenario‑analysis research.

label: Climate Adaptation Infrastructure Planning
description: Integrates climate-hazard projections into infrastructure siting, design, and O&M; applies nature-based solutions, resilience metrics, and financing models.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies climate hazards; reviews design codes; estimates exposure.
Calculates freeboard elevations; sizes detention basins; selects resilient materials; screens projects with climate-risk checklists.
Uses downscaled data for design loads; conducts cost‑benefit adaptation analysis; integrates NbS; coordinates stakeholder workshops.
Develops regional adaptation plans; secures funding; implements adaptive O&M regimes; monitors resilience KPIs.
Leads national or portfolio-level adaptation strategies; shapes climate‑resilient codes; publishes adaptation research.

label: Sustainable Materials & Life‑Cycle Assessment (LCA)
description: Evaluates material choices using embodied-carbon, toxicity, and circularity metrics; selects low-impact alternatives and supplier EPDs (environmental product declarations).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads EPDs; defines system boundaries; identifies impact categories.
Compares materials via EPD databases; uses LCA tools (SimaPro/OpenLCA); collects inventory data; calculates global‑warming potential (GWP).
Performs sensitivity analysis; evaluates biogenic carbon; compares material options.
Integrates LCA into BIM workflows; specifies bio-based or recycled materials at scale; publishes material passports; optimizes circularity.
Develops material-circularity targets;; leads corporate LCA programs; shapes product‑category rules; publishes LCA methodology advancements.

label: Circular Economy Design Engineering
description: Applies cradle-to-cradle principles to product and infrastructure design; prioritises reuse, remanufacturing, recycling, and regenerative materials.
source_frameworks: Ellen MacArthur Foundation Circular Design Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines linear vs circular models; identifies waste streams; calculates recyclability; recognizes take‑back schemes.
Applies design‑for‑disassembly principles; selects recyclable materials; designs for disassembly; analyses end‑of‑life pathways.
Develops product‑as‑service models; quantifies circularity indicators; conducts reverse‑logistics studies.
Integrates circularity into product development stage‑gates; measures economic returns; secures certification (Cradle to Cradle).
Leads systemic CE transitions at city or sector scale and/or multi‑product circular portfolios; shapes circular‑economy standards; publishes design‑engineering research.

label: Lifecycle GHG Accounting & Life‑Cycle Assessment (LCA)
description: Conducts cradle-to-grave life-cycle assessments per ISO 14040/44; models embodied carbon, energy, and environmental impacts using databases (Ecoinvent, GREET) and tools (SimaPro, OpenLCA).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines functional unit and system boundary terms; identifies scope 1, 2, 3 emissions; gathers activity data; utilizes emission‑factor databases.
Builds simple process‑flow diagrams; selects secondary data; calculates cradle‑to‑gate emissions; reports midpoint impacts; documents data quality.
Conducts sensitivity analyses; applies allocation methods; uses LCA software (SimaPro, OpenLCA).
Integrates consequential LCA; validates results with third‑party review; aligns disclosures to IFRS S2.
Leads corporate‑wide GHG inventories; develops sector‑specific guidance; publishes peer‑reviewed LCA studies.

label: Carbon Capture, Utilisation & Storage (CCUS) Operations & Monitoring
description: Operating post‑combustion and pre‑combustion carbon‑capture systems, managing CO₂ utilization pathways, and monitoring geological storage sites to ensure safe, long‑term containment and regulatory compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains absorption vs. adsorption capture; identifies amine‑scrubbing components; recognizes basic monitoring methods, process variables, and alarms.
Tracks capture‑efficiency metrics; collects flue‑gas samples; follows injection‑well safety protocols; logs compression data.
Calibrates gas‑analysis instrumentation; analyses plume‑migration models; adjusts operations; reports to environmental regulators.
Optimises solvent regeneration; integrates carbon‑utilization reactors; implements real‑time seismic monitoring; Implements digital twins and predictive maintenance.
Designs multi‑facility CCUS hubs; leads measurement‑verification programs; Establishes MRV protocols for regulatory compliance; influences international CCUS standards.

label: Carbon Capture, Utilisation & Storage (CCUS)
description: Designs post-combustion, pre-combustion, and direct-contact CO₂ capture processes; evaluates transport, utilization, saline and EOR storage options; navigates permitting and MRV (monitoring, reporting, verification).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains capture pathways; lists sorbent types; recognizes storage reservoirs.
Calculates mass balance; models amine absorption; estimates energy penalties; assesses injectivity.
Designs heat‑integration schemes; performs techno‑economic analysis; monitors storage integrity.
Optimises solvent regeneration; manages pipeline compression; complies with MRV (Monitoring, Reporting, Verification).
Leads gigaton-scale hubs and CCUS projects; shapes capture policy incentives; publishes CCUS scale‑up research.

label: Carbon Accounting & GHG Inventory
description: Quantifies Scope 1-3 greenhouse-gas emissions using ISO 14064 and GHG Protocol standards; manages data quality, boundary setting, and verification for corporate or municipal inventories.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists emission scopes and global-warming potentials; collects activity data; applies emission factors.
Builds spreadsheets for CO₂e calculations; tracks utility bills; verifies data sources.
Utilises LCA databases (e.g., ecoinvent); calculates scope‑3 categories; manages QA/QC and uncertainty; drafts inventory reports.
Implements software platforms; applies market‑based electricity factors; manages third‑party verification.
Designs enterprise carbon-management strategy; leads corporate GHG programs; shapes carbon‑accounting standards; publishes inventory methodologies.

label: Environmental-Blockchain Energy Trading
description: Utilises blockchain or distributed-ledger platforms for peer-to-peer renewable energy certificates (RECs), carbon credits, and micro-transactions; ensures traceability, verification, and regulatory compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains tokens vs certificates; reads simple smart-contract UI.
Issues and retires RECs on a public testnet.
Integrates IoT meters; automates settlement and audit trails.
Designs cross-chain registries; navigates compliance (MiCA, SEC).
Leads national-scale DLT energy-trading frameworks; shapes policy.

label: Utility Regulatory Compliance
description: Interprets and implements FERC, NERC, EPA, and state utility-commission regulations covering operations, reliability, and environmental performance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes basic FERC/NERC roles; follows document-control.
Tracks compliance tasks; files routine reports.
Conducts internal compliance audits; mitigates violations.
Leads settlement negotiations; integrates compliance into OMS/EMS systems.
Shapes corporate compliance strategy; mentors teams; influences regulatory policy.

label: Safety, Health & Environment (SHE) Compliance
description: Implements OSHA 29 CFR, EPA, and ISO 45001 requirements for occupational safety, health, and environmental protection across utility operations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows PPE and hazard-communication rules.
Completes incident reports; conducts toolbox talks.
Performs job-safety analysis; tracks lag/lead indicators.
Integrates SHE management system with ISO 14001 & 45001; leads audits.
Shapes enterprise SHE culture; mentors professionals; liaises with regulators.

label: Thermal Power-Plant Operations
description: Operates and optimizes steam-cycle or combined-cycle power units, controlling boilers, turbines, heat-recovery steam generators (HRSG), and emissions systems to meet load while complying with NERC and EPA requirements.  See also `utility_regulatory_compliance`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Monitors key pressures, temperatures, and flows; follows start-up checklists.
Adjusts controls to match dispatch instructions; records operational data.
Optimises heat-rate; coordinates fuel changes; executes NOx-control procedures.
Runs model-based predictive control; integrates carbon-capture skid performance.
Leads multi-unit optimization; mentors operators; interfaces with grid operators on real-time reliability concerns.

label: Wind & Solar Plant Operations
description: Monitors, analyses, and dispatches utility-scale wind and photovoltaic assets, maximising availability and integrating with ISO/RTO market signals.  See also `distributed_energy_resource_management` for behind-the-meter DERs.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands basic SCADA metrics (kW, availability); performs visual inspections.
Executes remote resets; logs inverter or turbine alarms.
Performs power-curve and soiling analyses; coordinates curtailment with grid operator.
Implements condition-based maintenance using vibration and IV-curve data.
Leads hybrid (PV + storage) dispatch strategies; mentors technicians; drives fleet-wide performance analytics.

label: Low-Carbon Hydrogen Production Operations
description: Operates electrolysers or reformers with carbon capture to produce hydrogen, meeting DOE H₂-standard purity and ISO safety requirements. See also `hydrogen_storage_safety` for high-pressure storage and dispensing controls.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies key equipment (electrolyser stacks, compressors).
Tracks cell-voltage, temperature; follows H₂ venting protocols.
Optimises current-density vs. efficiency; manages de-ionised-water and power-supply quality.
Integrates renewable-powered load-following; analyses degradation data; coordinates CCS interface.
Leads multi-MW hydrogen-hub operations; mentors staff; interfaces with regulators and offtakers.

label: Nuclear Energy Operations & Safety
description: Operates and maintains nuclear power generation systems, including reactor controls, cooling systems, and safety protocols (reactor shutdown, radiation protection, waste handling) to ensure safe, continuous power production.
source_frameworks: Adapted from ONET Nuclear Power Reactor Operator competencies (USDOL/ETA, public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Knows fundamental concepts of nuclear fission and the purpose of reactor control rods and cooling systems.
Monitors reactor instruments under supervision; follows standard operating procedures and can perform basic tasks like adjusting control rod positions or coolant flow with guidance.
Operates reactor systems on shift; responds to typical variations in power demand; executes normal startup and shutdown procedures; practices radiation safety rules and emergency drills.
Supervises reactor operations; troubleshoots anomalies in reactor behavior; leads response to non-critical alarms; ensures rigorous compliance with NRC regulations and safety standards at the plant.

Manages overall nuclear plant operations; develops safety protocols and emergency response plans; interfaces with regulatory bodies (NRC/IAEA) and leads training on nuclear safety culture across the organization.

label: Utility Financial & Regulatory Strategy
description: Develops cost-of-service studies, performance-based ratemaking (PBR) models, capital-expenditure plans, and regulatory filings to secure revenue requirements and align with policy objectives.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads rate-case dockets; recognizes revenue requisites.
Calculates rate base and depreciation; prepares data requests.
Builds cost-of-service and PBR models; analyses WACC scenarios.
Leads settlement negotiations; integrates ESG financing (green bonds).
Shapes corporate finance strategy; mentors analysts; influences regulatory reform proposals.

label: Energy-Market Operations & Trading
description: Executes day-ahead and real-time energy, capacity, and ancillary-service bids; manages risk and settlement in ISO/RTO markets such as ERCOT, PJM, and CAISO.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads LMP dashboards; understands offer curves.
Submits DA energy offers; reconciles settlements.
Optimises virtual trading, congestion hedges; manages credit limits.
Integrates renewable forecasts; arbitrages energy-storage rights.
Leads multi-market trading desk; mentors traders; shapes market-design comments to FERC.

label: Nuclear Energy Operations & Safety
description: Operates reactor and balance-of-plant systems, implements IAEA and NRC safety fundamentals, and maintains emergency-preparedness and radiation-protection programs.
source_frameworks: IAEA Conduct of Operations Safety Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains defense-in-depth; reads reactor status indicators.
Performs normal operations and surveillance tests; follows ALARA principles.
Manages transient response; interprets core-physics data.
Leads outage & refuelling; analyses operational events; coordinates with NRC.
Oversees fleet operations; mentors licensees; engages with IAEA peer reviews.

label: Transmission & Distribution Grid Operations
description: Monitors and controls high-voltage networks, ensuring reliability per NERC Operations & Planning (O&P) standards, managing contingencies, and issuing switching orders.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads one-line diagrams; recognizes alarm priorities.
Executes routine switching under supervision; updates SCADA logs.
Performs real-time contingency analysis; balances reactive power.
Coordinates outage scheduling; applies State Estimator and PMU data for stability.
Directs Balancing-Authority operations; mentors operators; interfaces with RC/ISO on wide-area events.

label: Smart Grid Operations & Demand Response
description: Monitors and controls smart grid systems with advanced metering infrastructure (AMI);   coordinates demand response programs and distributed energy resources (DERs) to maintain grid stability and optimize energy distribution.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands the concept of smart grids versus traditional grids; knows that smart meters and IoT devices provide real-time data.
Uses software to read AMI data and execute simple demand response actions under instruction (e.g., remote meter connect/disconnect).
Adjusts grid control settings based on load forecasts; manages DER inputs (like rooftop solar) and dispatches demand response events to balance load.

Optimises grid sections by integrating storage and EV charging load; investigates and resolves complex grid anomalies using AMI analytics; coordinates with market operators for demand response scheduling.
Architects utility-wide smart grid strategy; ensures interoperability (following IEEE standards); leads deployment of advanced control systems and mentors operators in real-time grid management.

label: Renewable Integration in Grid
description: Plans and operates transmission and distribution systems with high shares of variable renewable energy (VRE), using forecasting, congestion management, and grid-forming inverters.  See also `distributed_energy_resource_management` and `battery_energy_storage_operations`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes variability impacts; reads curtailment reports.
Applies forecast updates; adjusts reactive-power set-points.
Conducts congestion studies; implements advanced inverter functions.
Designs grid-support services (synthetic inertia); coordinates storage dispatch.
Leads high-VRE grid roadmaps; mentors operators; informs policy on grid-integration codes.

label: Energy Infrastructure Cybersecurity
description: Protects energy generation, transmission, and distribution systems from cyber threats;   secures SCADA and ICS networks, implements NERC CIP compliance, and responds to incidents to maintain resilient utility operations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes basic cyber threats to utilities (malware, phishing, etc.) and knows that critical systems need special protection (SCADA).
Follows cybersecurity protocols for system access; helps maintain up-to-date patches on utility IT/OT systems under supervision.
Monitors SCADA network traffic for anomalies; implements access controls and intrusion detection systems; participates in incident response drills as a technical member.

Manages utility cybersecurity programs (ensuring compliance with NERC CIP); leads incident response when grid control systems are under cyber-attack; coordinates with IT and OT teams to strengthen defenses.

Designs and oversees comprehensive cybersecurity architecture for national-level energy infrastructure; influences policy or contributes to standards enhancements; mentors teams in advanced ICS/SCADA security practices.

label: Distributed Energy-Resource (DER) Management
description: Aggregates and dispatches rooftop PV, batteries, EV chargers, and demand-side assets in compliance with FERC Order 2222 and IEEE 1547 interconnection requirements. See also `battery_energy_storage_operations` for BESS control routines and `demand_side_management_energy_efficiency` for customer-program coordination.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains DER aggregation concept; tracks basic telemetry.
Validates IEEE 1547 ride-through settings; submits DER bids to market platform.
Optimises fleet dispatch for price signals; monitors telemetry quality.
Runs DERMS forecasting models; mitigates voltage / congestion impacts.
Designs ISO-compliant DER programs; mentors operators; quantifies grid-services value streams.

label: Greenhouse-Gas Reporting & Compliance
description: Quantifies Scope 1 emissions, completes EPA GHGRP reports, and develops mitigation plans (CCS, offsets) for utility operations.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies reportable GHG sources; collects fuel-use data.
Calculates CO₂-e using EPA factors; submits e-GGRT forms.
Implements CEMS; verifies third-party offsets.
Leads facility-level emissions audits; integrates CCS capture data.
Oversees enterprise GHG strategy; mentors staff; engages regulators and ESG investors.

label: Environmental & Emissions Management
description: Monitors and controls NOₓ, SO₂, particulate, and greenhouse-gas emissions; maintains ISO 14064 inventory and ensures EPA and state-permit compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies regulated pollutants; understands permit limits.
Operates CEMS; logs deviations; submits quarterly reports.
Performs emissions calculations; optimizes SCR / scrubber operation.
Leads multi-pollutant compliance strategy; evaluates offsets & CCS.
Shapes enterprise EMS; mentors specialists; liaises with regulators & ESG investors.

label: Battery Energy-Storage Operations
description: Operates grid-scale lithium-ion or flow-battery systems per IEC 62933 safety requirements, optimizing state-of-charge for arbitrage and grid-services value. See also `distributed_energy_resource_management` for aggregation dispatch and `asset_integrity_management`  for ISO 55000 asset-management governance .

proficiency_levels.indicator: Monitors state-of-charge and temperature; follows E-stop procedures.
Runs charge/discharge cycles for time-shifting; records performance.
Applies degradation models; participates in frequency-regulation markets.
Utilises EMS predictive optimization; conducts thermal-runaway prevention tests.
Designs multi-site BESS portfolios; mentors operators; integrates second-life battery modules.

label: Demand-Side Management & Energy Efficiency
description: Designs and administers utility programs—demand response, time-of-use rates, energy-efficiency incentives—to shift or reduce customer load in compliance with FERC Orders 719 and 2222.  Cross-reference `distributed_energy_resource_management`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains DSM vs. supply-side; tracks kWh savings.
Calculates measure savings using TRMs; processes rebates.
Develops load-impact models; coordinates with market operator.
Designs M&V plans; integrates DERs for flex-load portfolios.
Leads utility DSM strategy; mentors analysts; reports cost-effectiveness to regulators.

label: Energy Data Analytics
description: Collects, cleans, and analyses SCADA, AMI, and market data to inform asset optimization and forecasting across generation, grid, and storage assets.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Runs basic queries; visualises KPIs.
Builds load profiles; flags data anomalies.
Creates time-series forecasts; integrates weather data.
Trains ML models for predictive maintenance; automates report pipelines.
Leads enterprise analytics strategy; mentors data engineers; applies AI for real-time optimization.

label: Work-Based Learning Coordination
description: Designs, coordinates, and evaluates apprenticeships, internships, and cooperative education aligned with industry standards, labor regulations, and learner outcomes.
source_frameworks: U.S. Department of Labor Apprenticeship Toolkit
European Alliance for Apprenticeships Quality Framework

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines placement types; identifies legal and safety requirements.
Matches learners to hosts; drafts learning agreements; orients supervisors.
Monitors progress via site visits; assesses competencies; resolves workplace issues.
Scales multi-sector partnerships; aligns tax incentives; tracks return-on-investment (ROI).
Leads regional work-based-learning strategy; secures grants; publishes best-practice toolkits.

label: Instructional Coaching & Peer Mentoring
description: Facilitates reflective cycles (pre-observation, feedback, goal setting) to support colleagues’ growth, using the International Coaching Federation (ICF) core competencies and ISTE Educator Standard 7.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Demonstrates active listening; builds rapport; sets confidentiality norms.
Uses questioning protocols; co-creates SMART goals; conducts non-evaluative observations.
Analyses video evidence; applies data to feedback; tracks progress over cycles.
Coaches multiple peers; facilitates professional learning communities (PLCs); aligns coaching to strategic goals.
Leads district coaching program; certifies new coaches; researches coaching impact.

label: Educational Research Literacy
description: Critically reads, interprets, and applies educational research following American Educational Research Association (AERA) and evidence-based practice standards to enhance pedagogy.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines quantitative vs qualitative study; locates abstract and findings.
Evaluates sample size, validity, and reliability; summarizes implications.
Conducts literature review; calculates effect size; applies findings to course revision.
Designs action-research study; secures ethical approval; shares results at conferences.
Leads institutional research committee; publishes peer-reviewed articles; mentors scholar-practitioners.

label: Educational Policy & Leadership
description: Develops, implements, and evaluates education policies, accreditation processes, and change-management initiatives that advance equitable student outcomes.
source_frameworks: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) Standards

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes policy cycle; lists accrediting bodies.
Conducts policy scans; drafts position briefs; facilitates stakeholder forums.
Leads accreditation self-study; analyses compliance evidence; manages project timelines.
Implements change-management plans; allocates resources; monitors key performance indicators (KPIs).
Shapes regional or national policy; guides system-wide reform; mentors emerging leaders.

label: Language-Inclusive Pedagogy
description: Implements Content and Language Integrated Learning (CLIL), scaffolding, and translanguaging strategies to support multilingual learners and foster language equity.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies levels of language proficiency; recognizes additive vs subtractive approaches.
Uses visuals, sentence frames, and first-language (L1) supports; checks comprehension.
Designs CLIL units with subject-language outcomes; differentiates tasks by proficiency.
Integrates formative language assessment; leverages translanguaging spaces; mentors colleagues.
Leads multilingual-education policy; aligns curriculum across grades; researches language equity.

label: Instructional Design and Delivery
description: Applies ADDIE (Analyse-Design-Develop-Implement-Evaluate) and Universal Design for Learning (UDL 3.0) to build evidence-based, multimedia courses that motivate and develop diverse learners.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists ADDIE phases; matches objectives to activities; presents information or instructions using provided materials and guidelines.
Creates basic lesson plans or training sessions under guidance and delivers them to small groups; develops storyboard; selects media; pilots lesson.
Produces SCORM-compliant modules; designs engaging curricula and adapts teaching methods to different learning styles and audience needs.
Aligns with accreditation standards; runs usability and accessibility audits; implements assessment techniques and continuously improves programs based on feedback and learning outcomes.
Leads organizational learning strategy and design, develops advanced training programs, publishes design research, and mentors other instructors or trainers in best practices.

label: Inclusive Instruction & Universal Design
description: Designs learning experiences using Universal Design for Learning (UDL) 3.0 Guidelines—multiple means of engagement, representation, and action—to ensure accessibility for all learners, including those with disabilities and diverse linguistic backgrounds.
source_frameworks: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines 3.0

proficiency_levels.indicator: States the three UDL principles and basic accessibility laws (e.g., Americans with Disabilities Act).
Provides alternative text, captions, and varied response options; checks color-contrast ratios.
Aligns learning objectives with UDL checkpoints; co-designs supports with learners; uses assistive-tech tools.
Audits entire courses for barriers; conducts formative usability tests; mentors colleagues in inclusive practice.
Leads institution-wide UDL adoption; publishes research on inclusive pedagogy; advises policy makers.

label: Experiential Learning Facilitation
description: Guides learners through Kolb’s Experiential Learning Cycle—concrete experience, reflective observation, abstract conceptualisation, active experimentation—using simulations, fieldwork, and service-learning.
source_frameworks: National Society for Experiential Education (NSEE) Principles

proficiency_levels.indicator: States the four ELT stages; identifies reflection prompts.
Organises small-scale simulations; debriefs using reflective-journals.
Coordinates field placements; develops assessment rubrics; connects theory to practice.
Manages multi-stakeholder service-learning projects; measures impact on competencies.
Researches experiential-learning outcomes; consults across departments; secures partnerships.

label: Classroom Management & Learner Engagement
description: Establishing positive learning environments through proactive behavior strategies, culturally responsive practices, and motivational techniques that maximise instructional time and learner engagement.
source_frameworks: UNESCO ICT Competency Framework for Teachers
Positive Behavioural Interventions and Supports (PBIS) Framework

proficiency_levels.indicator: Sets clear expectations; uses seating arrangements; recognizes off‑task behavior triggers.
Applies praise‑to‑correction ratios; implements simple routines; leverages student interests.
Utilises data to adjust management plans; differentiates engagement strategies; applies restorative practices.
Coaches peers on behavior supports; integrates social‑emotional learning (SEL); analyses engagement analytics.
Designs school‑wide behavior frameworks; coaches faculty in multi-tiered support; publishes engagement research; advises education ministries; influences policy.

label: Learning Analytics & Data‑Informed Instruction
description: Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting learner‑interaction data to personalise instruction, predict at‑risk students, and improve pedagogical decisions at classroom and institutional levels.
source_frameworks: Society for Learning Analytics Research (SoLAR) Practitioners Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Accesses LMS gradebook; identifies basic engagement metrics; recognizes privacy considerations.
Generates learning‑analytics dashboards; flags low‑participation patterns; implements simple interventions.
Utilises predictive‑risk models; correlates engagement with achievement; applies anonymization protocols.
Designs randomised‑controlled trials; integrates multi‑source datasets; measures intervention efficacy.
Leads institution‑wide learning‑analytics programs; publishes open datasets; advises on ethical AI in education.

label: Global Citizenship & Sustainability Education
description: Facilitates learning that advances United Nations Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 4.7—knowledge, skills, and values for global citizenship, peace, and sustainable development.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines SDG pillars; identifies local-to-global issues.
Embeds global perspectives into lessons; hosts classroom debates.
Co-designs service projects; assesses intercultural competence and ecological literacy.
Integrates sustainability across curricula; partners with international schools; secures funding.
Leads SDG-aligned institutional strategy; advises ministries; publishes impact studies.

label: Online & Hybrid Pedagogy

label: Artisan Craft Mastery
description: Mastering and innovating traditional craft techniques—ceramics, weaving, metal‑smithing—while integrating digital fabrication tools and sustainable materials to preserve cultural heritage.
source_frameworks: Crafts Council – Power of Experiences Guide

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies regional craft styles; uses basic hand tools safely; follows cultural protocols.
Produces simple craft items; selects eco‑friendly materials; documents process with photography.
Combines traditional methods with Computer‑Aided Design (CAD); operates small‑batch kilns or looms; prices items for local markets.
Mentors apprentices; integrates digital fabrication (CNC, laser cutting); curates exhibitions; manages online storefronts.
Revives endangered crafts; consults museums; leads international residencies; publishes craft‑innovation research.

label: Operating System & System Administration
description: Installs, configures, and maintains Linux/Unix servers; manages users, packages, services, storage, and shell scripting; troubleshoots performance and security.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Navigates shell; runs basic commands; performs routine package updates and user account changes.
Automates tasks with shell or PowerShell scripts; Manages packages and services with systemd; schedules backups.
Implements configuration-management tools (e.g., Ansible, DSC); monitors system health; configures networking.
Designs scalable, immutable infrastructure and enforces CIS benchmarks; tunes kernel parameters, implements RAID/LVM, sets SELinux/AppArmor.
Designs high-availability clusters; architects multi-OS fleet management, disaster-recovery playbooks, and cost-optimized provisioning.

label: IT Support & Helpdesk Operations
description: Provides technical support to end-users; triages incidents via ITIL-aligned ticketing systems; troubleshoots hardware, software, and connectivity issues; documents resolutions and drives continuous knowledge-base improvement.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Performs simple tasks with guidance (password resets, printer setup); logs tickets accurately.
Resolves common OS/application issues; follows knowledge-base runbooks; communicates clearly with users.
Prioritises and escalates incidents; analyses recurring problems and proposes systemic fixes; images and provisions devices.
Manages helpdesk queue and SLAs; automates deployments and self-service scripts; mentors junior technicians.
Leads enterprise support strategy; designs ITSM workflows; integrates AI chatbots and analytics to improve MTTR and CSAT.

label: Cloud Identity & Access Management
description: Designs and administers identity, federation, and access policies across cloud providers; applies least-privilege, MFA, and role-based access control.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains users, roles, policies.
Creates roles/policies; enforces MFA.
Implements SSO/SAML/OIDC federation; audits access logs.
Automates policy-as-code and periodic access reviews.
Designs cross-cloud identity fabric and zero-trust enforcement.

label: Confidential-Computing Services
description: Deploys and manages cloud workloads inside hardware-based Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) or memory-encrypted VMs; configures attestation, key-release, and runtime-encryption to protect data-in-use.
source_frameworks: NIST SP 800-207A draft – Zero-Trust & Confidential-Compute patterns (2023)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines TEE, attestation, and why data-in-use matters.
Launches an SGX/TDX VM; verifies attestation quote; encrypts disks.
Integrates remote attestation into CI/CD; configures key-release policies and secure enclave libraries.
Migrates containerised apps to confidential-K8s; implements side-car attestation and secret-mount flows.
Designs multi-cloud confidential platform; aligns with zero-trust architectures; leads audits of enclave integrity.

label: Cloud Security Architecture
description: Designs defense-in-depth cloud security aligned with NIST SP 800-207 Zero-Trust principles; integrates IAM, WAF, SIEM/SOAR, and CSPM across multi-cloud estates.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies shared-responsibility model components.
Configures IAM roles, security groups, encryption keys.
Implements zero-trust micro-segmentation, CWPP/CSPM tools.
Automates security as code, threat-modeling, continuous compliance.
Leads security architecture strategy, red/blue-team collaboration.

label: Network Fundamentals
description: Understands OSI/TCP-IP layers, IPv4/6 addressing, routing, switching, DNS, DHCP, and basic firewall concepts; uses packet-capture tools for troubleshooting.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common protocols (HTTP, DNS, SSH); identifies IP vs. DNS issues using ping or traceroute.
Configures subnets, VLANs, and basic firewall rules; tests connectivity.
Diagnoses latency/packet-loss with traceroute, tcpdump; analyzes packet captures, optimizes routing tables, and implements VPNs.
Designs VLANs, VPNs, BGP peering; and redundant, secure network topologies for cloud/hybrid environments.
Leads enterprise network architecture, zero-trust segmentation, and high-availability strategies.

label: Cloud Data Governance & Residency
description: Ensures cloud data lifecycle, locality, privacy, and residency compliance (GDPR, CPRA, Schrems II); sets policies for classification, encryption, retention, and cross-border transfers.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies Personally Identifiable Information (PII) classes; tags data locations; follows encryption‑at‑rest policies; labels sensitive vs non-sensitive data.
Configures region restrictions; sets Data Loss Prevention (DLP) inspection jobs; implements encryption at rest/in transit; sets retention tags; audits access roles.
Implements Customer‑Managed Encryption Keys (CMEK); maintains data‑processing agreements; integrates Cloud Data Catalog; audits residency controls; automates classification workflows.
Designs cross‑border data‑replication strategies with pseudonymisation; monitors residency‑compliance dashboards.
Defines organizational data-governance policy; advises on global data‑protection regulations; architects sovereign‑cloud landing zones; leads third‑party assurance audits.

label: Version Control & Collaboration
description: Uses distributed version-control systems (Git) for branching, merging, tagging, and pull-request workflows; integrates commits with CI/CD pipelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Clones repos; commits local changes; and resolves simple merge conflicts.
Creates branches, submits pull requests, and reviews peers’ code.
Designs branching strategies (e.g., GitFlow); automates CI triggers; manages pull-requests, tagging, and semantic versioning.
Defines branching strategies (GitFlow, trunk-based) and hooks; enforces code-review policies; secures repositories; integrates release pipelines.
Architects enterprise-wide SCM governance and cross-repo dependency management.

label: Programming Fundamentals
description: Writes, debugs, and documents code in at least one high-level language (Python, Java, Go); applies control structures, data structures, and basic algorithms; follows clean-code and testing practices.s.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains variables, loops, and functions; writes small scripts that compile and run with guidance.
Implements simple functions, uses version control, and debugs common errors.
Designs modular programs; applies basic algorithmic analysis, OOP, and error handling; writes unit tests.
Optimizes code for performance and readability across multiple languages and paradigms; performs code reviews.
Establishes enterprise coding standards; architects complex systems; mentors engineers; evaluates new language adoption.

label: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: Applies core security principles to safeguard confidentiality, integrity, and availability; recognizes threats, enforces least-privilege, patches systems, and participates in incident-response processes.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common threats (phishing, malware) and follows basic security hygiene.
Implements least-privilege access, routine patching, and basic incident reporting.
Runs vulnerability scans, analyses logs, and responds to alerts.
Designs layered security architectures, incident-response playbooks, and compliance controls.
Leads enterprise security strategy, threat-modeling, and continuous risk-management programs.

label: Green-Cloud Optimisation
description: Measures and reduces cloud carbon footprint through carbon-aware workload placement, right-sizing, renewable-energy alignment, and FinOps-driven efficiency metrics (gCO₂e per vCPU-hr / per API call).
source_frameworks: FinOps Foundation State of FinOps 2025 – green-ops metrics

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads carbon dashboards; explains difference between embodied and operational emissions.
Tags resources for carbon reporting; schedules batch jobs in low-carbon regions; rightsizes idle VMs.
Implements carbon-aware autoscaler; optimizes storage tiering vs. durability CO₂ impact; tracks gCO₂e/unit.
Integrates carbon signals (grid-intensity API) into CI/CD; drives cost + CO₂ trade-off decisions in FinOps reviews.
Sets enterprise carbon-budget policies; reports to ESG frameworks (GHGP, CDP); leads supplier engagement on renewable PPAs.

label: Cloud FinOps Cost Optimization
description: Tracks, allocates, and optimizes cloud spend; sets KPIs (unit economics), rightsizes workloads, negotiates committed-use discounts, and drives culture change per FinOps Framework.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Retrieves basic cost‑and‑usage reports; identifies untagged resources.
Implements cost‑allocation tags; sets budget alerts in Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure.
Rightsizes instances; negotiates Savings Plans or Reserved Instances; presents monthly show‑back reports to stakeholders; implements autoscaling and spot.
Automates anomaly detection using Application Programming Interface (API) feeds; forecasts spend allocates show-back/charge-back; integrates cost KPIs into Continuous Integration pipelines.
Leads organization‑wide FinOps program; drives cloud‑service provider contract optimisations; mentors cross‑functional FinOps teams; influences vendor pricing.

label: Edge‑Cloud Orchestration
description: Deploying, scaling, and updating containerised workloads across heterogeneous edge devices and central cloud clusters using orchestration frameworks (such as **KubeEdge**, **OpenYurt**, or **Azure IoT Hub**) and tackles latency, connectivity, and security constraints.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains the edge‑cloud continuum; installs edge agents on Linux gateways; pulls container images from registries.
Deploys pods with node‑selector labels; configures Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) brokers; monitors edge‑node health.
Implements fllet-management and remote over‑the‑air (OTA) updates; manages local‑storage volumes; configures device‑twin synchronisation.
Designs multi-region edge-mesh with fail-over; orchestrates artificial‑intelligence inference at the edge; applies policy‑based traffic routing; integrates observability stacks (Prometheus, Grafana).
Designs planet‑scale edge‑cloud architectures; secures device attestation; contributes to open‑source orchestration standards.

label: Kubernetes & Container Orchestration
description: Deploys, configures, and operates Kubernetes clusters; manages workloads, networking, storage, and security; automates Helm/ArgoCD deployments.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes pods, services, and manifests.
Applies deployments; exposes services; uses kubectl.
Implements ingress, RBAC, StatefulSets, Helm charts.
Tunes autoscaling, network-policies, CSI drivers, upgrades.
Designs multi-cluster, multi-cloud platforms; contributes upstream.

label: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
description: Uses declarative tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi) to provision and manage cloud resources with version control, peer review, and automated testing.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Applies basic modules in a sandbox cloud account.
Plans/applies stacks; stores state securely.
Builds reusable modules, CI validation, policy-as-code.
Manages multi-cloud workspaces, drift detection, orchestration.
Sets enterprise IaC standards; integrates with FinOps/SecOps.

label: DevOps Tooling & CI/CD
description: Automates build-test-deploy pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab; manages artefacts, container registries, and release orchestration.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Triggers simple builds on commit and views pipeline status.
Adds unit-test stages, static code analysis, and artifact storage.
Implements blue-green or canary deployments with rollback automation.
Enforces security scanning, canary releases, infra-as-code hooks; orchestrates microservice pipelines with container orchestration (K8s, ECS) and policy compliance.
Optimises throughput/MTTR; architects enterprise DevSecOps platforms; integrates SRE practices; drives throughput/MTTR KPIs.

label: Database Administration & Optimization
description: Designs schemas, writes optimized queries, manages backup/restore, replication, and performance tuning for relational (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL stores (MongoDB, DynamoDB).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Performs basic CRUD operations and routine backups; executes SELECT queries; understands ACID.
Configures roles/permissions; normalises tables; sets indexes; backups; monitors query plans.
Tunes queries; implements replication, sharding, and disaster-recovery strategies.
Tunes performance for high-throughput workloads and orchestrates migration/upgrade paths.
Designs multi-region data-platform strategy, multi-modal data platforms, cost governance, and automated self-healing clusters.

label: Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Practices
description: Applying Google‑originated Site Reliability Engineering principles—Service Level Objectives (SLOs), error budgets, and blameless post‑mortems—to maintain service reliability, scalability, and security in production systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes SRE vs traditional ops; differentiates SLO, Service Level Indicator (SLI), and Service Level Agreement (SLA); participates in on‑call rotations.
Configures alert thresholds; writes run‑books; conducts root‑cause analysis with five‑whys method.
Implements graceful degradation; maintains error‑budget policies; integrates chaos‑engineering tools.
Automates capacity‑planning dashboards; designs multi‑region fail‑over; leads incident response, chaos testing, capacity planning, post‑mortem reviews.
Drives reliability culture; advises on org-level budgets/thresholds; aligns SRE roadmaps with business objectives; mentors SRE teams; publishes open‑source reliability‑tool frameworks.

label: Cloud Observability & Monitoring
description: Collects and correlates metrics, logs, and traces using tools (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry); defines SLOs/SLIs and implements alerting and dashboarding.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads basic dashboards; acknowledges alerts.
Creates metrics, log filters, and basic alerts.
Implements tracing, anomaly detection, runbooks.
Automates root-cause analysis and self-healing.
Defines org-wide observability strategy and telemetry standards.

label: Cloud Infrastructure Management
description: Operates production cloud estates—patching, capacity, tagging, incident response, and change control—via DevOps pipelines and ITSM tooling. Deploys and administers virtual networks, compute, storage, and identity services on major cloud platforms.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows runbooks; opens incident tickets; launches basic instances; manages snapshots in a single region.
Creates VPCs, security groups, and load balancers following best practices; uses monitoring dashboards; executes scripted changes.
Automates IaC with Terraform/CloudFormation, patching, backup, and scaling policies.
Optimizes multi-region architectures for cost, latency, and resilience; enforces guardrails; implements service-level objectives and continuous improvement.
Leads cloud strategy, hybrid integrations, chaos-engineering, and sustainability/cost-governance programs.

label: AIOps – Predictive Scaling & Autonomous Remediation
description: Designs and operates AIOps pipelines that correlate telemetry, predict incidents, auto-scale workloads, and trigger self-healing runbooks (restart, rollback, config-tune) with minimal human intervention.
source_frameworks: Gartner Market Guide for AIOps Platforms 2024

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains five AIOps characteristics (ingestion, topology, correlation, patterns, automation).
Ingests logs/metrics into an AIOps tool; sets alert thresholds; reviews ML-based anomaly flags.
Builds predictive-scaling policy; links alerts to auto-remediation runbooks; measures MTTR.
Tunes ML models (seasonality, drift); orchestrates blue/green rollback; validates AI decisions against SRE error-budget policies.
Architects org-wide AIOps fabric; integrates continuous-learning pipelines; publishes reliability KPIs to exec dashboards.

label: Serverless Architecture
description: Designs and operates event-driven applications using FaaS (Lambda, Cloud Functions) and managed services; optimizes cold starts, observability, and cost.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Triggers simple functions from HTTP events.
Connects functions to managed DB/queue; sets IAM least-privilege.
Implements step-functions, retries, DLQs, tracing.
Tunes performance, manages large fan-out, blue-green deploys.
Architects enterprise serverless platforms, multi-region cold-start strategy.

label: Cloud Infrastructure Architecture
description: Designs secure, resilient, performant cloud topologies using reference architectures and Well-Architected pillars (AWS, Azure, GCP); selects compute, storage, and networking patterns aligned with business requirements.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Uses basic cloud services (e.g., launching a virtual server or storage bucket) following step-by-step instructions.
Uses reference diagrams; applies tagging/iam basics; deploys simple applications on a cloud platform; monitors resource usage with standard tools.

Designs moderately complex cloud architectures using multiple services (compute, database, networking); implements best practices for performance and security; designs multi-tier VPCs/VNets, ALB/NLB, autoscaling.

Optimizes cloud resource allocation and configurations at scale; implements infrastructure-as-code and automated deployments; ensures robust security controls; implements multi-AZ/region DR, cost/performance trade-offs.
Architects enterprise-level cloud systems, plans multi-region deployments for high availability, and leads cloud strategy and governance across the organization.

label: Green Building & Sustainable Construction
description: Designs and builds to LEED v4 BD+C credits—energy optimization, water efficiency, material transparency—while aligning with Whole Building Design Guide sustainability principles.
source_frameworks: USGBC LEED v4 Building Design + Construction

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes basic concepts of sustainable building (solar orientation, insulation, low-VOC materials).
Participates in a green building project team; helps track LEED points or local green code compliance under guidance.
Integrates green building strategies (rainwater harvesting, energy modeling) into designs; prepares documentation for LEED certification.
Optimises building systems for sustainability (HVAC, lighting automation for efficiency); leads a project to achieve a high-level green certification.
Drives firm-wide adoption of green construction best practices; advises on policy or building codes; shapes sustainable construction standards.

label: Structural Engineering Fundamentals & Framing
description: Understands fundamental structural principles (loads, forces, material strength) and can read structural plans to ensure construction projects meet engineering requirements for stability and safety.
source_frameworks: NCCER Curriculum & O*NET Civil Engineer Tech Competencies
AISC Steel Manual & Wood Design Standards

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes common structural elements (beams, columns, foundations) on blueprints and knows they support loads.
Reads simple structural drawings (e.g. residential beam layouts); follows instructions to implement reinforcement (rebar placement, specified concrete psi).
Interprets structural plans for commercial buildings; calculates basic loads or stresses with provided formulas; ensures construction (formwork, steel erection) follows engineering specs.

Coordinates with structural engineers to adjust field conditions (e.g. minor modifications on site while maintaining integrity); identifies potential structural issues during construction (overloaded support, misalignments) and resolves them.

Integrates structural considerations into project planning proactively; mentors others in reading complex structural and seismic retrofit plans; contributes to value engineering discussions by suggesting structurally sound yet cost-effective solutions.

label: Masonry & Concrete Construction Techniques
description: Places formwork, reinforcement, and masonry units in compliance with ACI 318 and ASTM C standards, ensuring durability, alignment, and structural integrity.
source_frameworks: ACI 318 Building Code Requirements for Structural Concrete

proficiency_levels.indicator: Mixes concrete or mortar under supervision; assists journeymen in basic tasks like carrying bricks and setting up forms.
Lays simple brick or block walls and pours small concrete slabs following instructions; achieves basic finishing (troweling, edging) on flatwork.
Reads construction drawings for masonry and concrete work; sets up and secures formwork, places rebar, and executes standard pours and masonry layouts with minimal supervision.

Constructs complex masonry structures (e.g. arches, retaining walls) accurately; supervises large concrete pours (foundations, multi-stage slabs), ensuring proper curing and finishing techniques are applied.

Engineers formwork and reinforcement plans for challenging projects; troubleshoots material or structural issues on-site; mentors others in advanced masonry techniques and ensures all work meets code and durability requirements.

label: Construction Safety Management (OSHA 1926)
description: Implements OSHA 29 CFR 1926 Subparts C thru P — including fall protection, trenching, scaffolding, PPE, and hazard communication—to prevent incidents and ensure regulatory compliance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common site hazards; wears required PPE.
Conducts daily Job-Hazard Analyses; completes OSHA logs.
Develops site-specific safety plans; audits subcontractor compliance.
Implements behavior-based safety and leading-indicator dashboards.
Shapes corporate safety culture; interfaces with OSHA on VPP status.

label: Quality Assurance & Commissioning
description: Implements Whole Building Design Guide and GSA Commissioning Guide processes for verification, functional performance testing, and turnover documentation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Maintains RFIs/submittals; observes inspections.
Executes pre-functional checklists; logs NCRs.
Leads functional performance tests; tracks issue logs.
Integrates commissioning into BIM CDE; validates O&M training.
Manages enterprise quality program; mentors Cx agents; drives continuous turnover improvements.

label: Asset Integrity & Maintenance Programs
description: Implements ISO 55000-aligned systems for inspection, preventive and predictive maintenance, and risk-based asset-lifecycle planning across generation, grid, and storage assets.  See also `battery_energy_storage_operations` for BESS-specific routines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows basic work-order and safety-tagging procedures.
Records asset condition; schedules preventive tasks.
Conducts risk-based inspection (RBI); analyses failure data; updates CMMS.
Deploys predictive analytics (vibration, thermography); optimizes spare-parts strategy.
Architectures enterprise ISO 55001 asset-management system; mentors engineers; links integrity KPIs to financial plans.

label: Site Logistics & Material Handling
description: Plans lay-down areas, crane picks, hoisting, and just-in-time deliveries to optimize site flow and minimise congestion in dense urban projects.
source_frameworks: Whole Building Design Guide—Construction Site Logistics best practice

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads logistics plans; follows traffic paths.
Schedules deliveries; allocates storage zones.
Coordinates tower-crane utilization; manages hoist permissions.
Integrates takt-time logistics with Last Planner System.
Designs logistics for mega-projects; mentors supers; leverages digital-twin simulation.

label: Project Scheduling & Control (CPM / PMBOK Extension)
description: Develops critical-path schedules, earned-value baselines, and look-ahead plans per PMI Construction Extension to the PMBOK Guide.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads Gantt charts; recognizes float.
Updates progress; calculates SPI/CPI.
Runs what-if scenarios; integrates pull plans.
Links 4-D BIM to schedule; manages risk registers.
Leads portfolio controls; mentors planners; aligns with earned-schedule methodology.

label: Off-Site Modular Construction Management
description: Plans, fabricates, transports, and installs volumetric or panelised modules, coordinating factory QA, logistics, and on-site assembly per Modular Building Institute best practices.  See also `site_logistics_material_handling`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies volumetric vs. panelised modules; follows factory quality‑assurance (QA) checklists.
Coordinates module shipping schedules; verifies lift points; uses Building Information Modeling (BIM) to check tolerances.
Integrates modular design into project charter; applies lean takt‑time planning; tracks on‑site assembly metrics.
Leads integrated project delivery (IPD) contracts; manages multi‑trade modular fabrication; conducts life‑cycle cost analysis.
Develops corporate modular strategies; advises on regulatory approvals; publishes research on modular safety benchmarks.

label: Lean Construction & Continuous Improvement
description: Applies Lean Construction Institute (LCI) tenets—value definition, pull planning, Last Planner System, and waste elimination—to maximise flow and stakeholder value.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines eight wastes; attends daily huddles.
Builds weekly work plans; tracks PPC metrics.
Facilitates pull-plan sessions; analyses constraint logs.
Integrates takt planning and 5S; drives Kaizen events.
Leads enterprise lean program; mentors teams; publishes continuous-improvement case studies.

label: Contract Administration & Regulatory Compliance
description: Administers construction contracts under AIA A201 general conditions, tracks change orders, claims, and statutory requirements (lien, certified payroll).
source_frameworks: AIA Document A201 – General Conditions of the Contract for Construction

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads contract clauses; logs RFIs and submittals.
Issues change directives; maintains payment applications.
Manages claim documentation; enforces subcontract flow-downs.
Leads dispute negotiations; ensures regulatory filings (EEO, certified payroll).
Shapes contract-risk strategy; mentors administrators; liaises with legal counsel.

label: Smart-Home Integration
description: Designs and commissions residential automation systems using KNX, Matter, or similar protocols, integrating lighting, HVAC, security, and energy management devices.  See also `hvac_system_fundamentals_troubleshooting`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains smart-home bus architecture; recognizes device types.
Programs scenes in ETS software; sets IP addressing.
Integrates voice assistants; configures secure remote access.
Performs interoperability tests; deploys edge analytics.
Leads whole-house IoT strategy; mentors integrators; aligns with cybersecurity best practice.

label: Fire & Life-Safety System Design
description: Designs fire-alarm, mass-notification, and smoke-control systems in accordance with NFPA 72, coordinating detection zones, power supplies, and supervision circuits.
source_frameworks: NFPA 72 National Fire Alarm and Signaling Code

proficiency_levels.indicator: Locates detector symbols on drawings; understands initiation devices.
Calculates circuit voltage drop; places appliances per candela rules.
Develops sequence-of-operations matrix; coordinates with IFC/IMC.
Uses BIM to avoid clashes; runs smoke-control CFD models.
Leads AHJ plan-reviews; mentors designers; integrates smart-building analytics.

label: Pipefitting Techniques
description: Measures, cuts, threads, welds, and assembles pipe systems following ASME B31.3 process piping requirements, ensuring proper supports, expansion loops, and pressure tests.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies pipe schedules and fittings; cuts and threads pipe under supervision.
Makes threaded and soldered joints; applies pipe dope; follows schematic to route simple piping systems.
Uses precision instruments to ensure proper slope and alignment; performs GTAW/SMAW welds; hydrostatic testing..
Aligns stress-analysis results; installs specialty valves; coordinates multiple pipe trades and pressure tests systems.
Leads complex pipe-routing strategy; mentors fitters; ensures QA documentation.

label: HVAC Fundamentals & Troubleshooting
description: Applies ASHRAE Handbook principles to size, commission, and troubleshoot HVAC equipment, including refrigeration cycle diagnostics, airflow balancing, and thermal-system optimization.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies refrigeration components; reads gauges.
Performs superheat/sub-cool checks; balances diffusers.
Diagnoses compressor cycling, sensor faults; adjusts controls.
Conducts TAB reports; integrates BMS analytics.
Designs advanced HVAC retro-commissioning plans; mentors technicians; quantifies energy savings.

label: Electrical Wiring & NEC Compliance
description: Installs branch circuits, raceways, and service equipment in accordance with the National Electrical Code (NFPA 70), performing load calculations, conduit sizing, and inspections.  See also `building_information_modeling` for model coordination.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies conductor colors; follows lock-out/tag-out.
Pulls wire; terminates receptacles; applies box-fill rules.
Calculates conductor ampacity & voltage-drop; selects OCPDs.
Designs panel schedules; coordinates AFCI/GFCI zones; drafts as-built drawings.
Leads facility NEC compliance audits; mentors electricians; interfaces with AHJs.

label: Heavy Equipment Maintenance
description: Performs preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance on heavy construction machinery—excavators, cranes, bulldozers, loaders—ensuring safe operation, maximum availability, and compliance with manufacturer specifications and ISO 55000 asset-management principles.  See also `asset_integrity_management` for organization-wide maintenance governance.
source_frameworks: OEM heavy-equipment service manuals (e.g., Caterpillar, Komatsu)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies lubrication points and daily inspection items; follows lock-out/tag-out during basic servicing.
Performs routine services (fluid changes, filter replacement); documents work orders and parts usage.
Diagnoses common faults (hydraulic leaks, sensor alerts); utilizes telematics data to schedule repairs; conducts torque checks.
Implements predictive-maintenance tools (vibration, thermography); analyses downtime trends; coordinates warranty/recall work with OEMs.
Designs fleet-wide maintenance programs aligned with ISO 55000; mentors technicians; optimizes lifecycle cost through overhaul vs. replacement strategies.

label: Heavy Equipment Operation
description: Operates heavy construction machinery (e.g. excavators, bulldozers, cranes) safely and efficiently for earthmoving, material handling, and site operations.
source_frameworks: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Subpart N – Cranes & Derricks
National Center for Construction Education & Research (NCCER) Heavy Equipment Curriculum

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies types of heavy equipment and their basic uses; observes proper hand signals and safety procedures around operating machinery.
Operates entry-level machinery (such as skid steers or forklifts) for simple tasks under guidance; performs basic pre-start inspections (fluid levels, tire pressure).
Independently operates common heavy machines (excavator, loader, backhoe) to perform tasks like trenching, lifting, or grading while adhering to safety protocols and work plans.

Skillfully maneuvers multiple types of equipment in complex scenarios (tight spaces, rough terrain) with precision; plans equipment workflow on job sites and instructs junior operators in safe practices.

Oversees all heavy equipment operations on large projects; optimizes equipment selection and usage for efficiency; develops training and certification programs for operators and enforces rigorous safety standards.

label: Digital Twin Operations for Built Assets
description: Creates and maintains operational digital twins post-handover, linking BIM, IoT sensors, and asset-management systems per ISO 23247 to enable predictive maintenance and performance optimization.  See also `asset_integrity_management`.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains difference between BIM and digital twin; synchronises basic sensor data feeds.
Configures Internet of Things (IoT) gateway devices; maps data streams to asset models; sets performance thresholds.
Implements fault‑detection algorithms; calibrates energy models; visualises live dashboards.
Integrates artificial‑intelligence predictive models; automates work‑order generation; manages cloud‑edge hybrid deployment.
Leads city‑scale digital twin programs; defines interoperability standards; publishes asset‑twin KPIs for global benchmarking.

label: Digital-Twin Asset Management
description: Creates and operates digital-twin models that synchronise real-time sensor data with BIM geometry to support predictive maintenance, lifecycle costing, and sustainability reporting across built assets.
source_frameworks: ISO 19650 series – Information Management with BIM

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes what a digital twin is and how it differs from BIM; recognizes basic data flows (IoT → twin dashboard).
Links sensor streams (temperature, vibration) to a 3-D model; views KPIs (runtime hours, energy use) on a dashboard.
Builds rules or ML models that flag asset-condition anomalies; schedules work orders directly from the twin.
Integrates ISO 55000 lifecycle-cost analysis; deploys twin across multiple facilities with common data environment (CDE) governance.
Leads enterprise digital-twin program; sets data standards and cybersecurity controls; quantifies ROI and carbon-reduction benefits for board reporting.

label: Building Information Modeling (BIM)
description: Applies ISO 19650 information-management processes—CDE, container numbering, information exchange—to create, coordinate, and deliver federated 3-D/4-D models through design, construction, and hand-over.
source_frameworks: ISO 19650 series for BIM information management
