Runs multi-title events; negotiates publisher licenses; manages player logistics and health protocols.
Directs international esports festivals; innovates hybrid fan zones; mentors coordinators.

label: Community Event Planning
description: Designs, budgets, and executes in-person, hybrid, or virtual community events that meet stakeholder goals and CSR guidelines; manages permits, sponsors, and risk assessments in line with ILEA CSEP competency domains.
source_frameworks: NRPA Special Event Risk Management Checklist

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists basic event types; recognizes permit requirements.
Prepares task timelines; coordinates volunteers; follows safety plans.
Secures venues, vendors, and insurance; aligns events with community objectives.
Integrates hybrid-tech platforms; negotiates sponsorship; measures KPI outcomes.
Leads multi-year event portfolios; embeds DEI and sustainability metrics; mentors planners.

label: Quantum Networking Protocols
description: Understanding and implementing the protocols that enable qubit‑level entanglement distribution, Quantum Key Distribution (QKD), and error‑corrected quantum‑repeater networks for the emerging quantum internet.
source_frameworks: European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) QKD Standards
National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Quantum Internet Roadmap 2024

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains qubit entanglement, Bell tests, and basic QKD principles.
Operates a laboratory‑scale QKD demonstration; aligns entangled‑photon links over optical fibre.
Configures entanglement swapping with multiplexed channels; characterises quantum‑bit error rates.
Designs routing protocols for hybrid classical‑quantum networks; integrates quantum repeaters into metropolitan backbones.
Leads deployment of metropolitan quantum backbones; contributes to international standards bodies on quantum‑internet protocols.

label: Quantum Error-Correction Engineering
description: Implements surface-code and bosonic-code error-correction schemes; evaluates logical-qubit overhead, syndrome extraction circuits, and fault-tolerance thresholds on noisy intermediate-scale quantum (NISQ) devices.
source_frameworks: EU Quantum Technologies Competence Framework – fault-tolerant QC profile

proficiency_levels.indicator: States why qubit decoherence demands error correction; sketches Shor code concept.
Simulates small surface-code patches in Qiskit Ignis; measures logical error rate.
Designs syndrome-measurement circuits; benchmarks threshold under realistic noise models.
Integrates real-time decoding hardware; optimizes lattice surgery for qubit overhead.
Contributes to open-source QEC compilers; publishes new code families and threshold analyses.

label: Quantum Computing Fundamentals
description: Explains qubits, superposition, and entanglement; runs simple quantum circuits on a simulator and understands foundational algorithms and hardware constraints.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes the concept of qubits versus classical bits and basic quantum logic gates.
Uses simple quantum algorithms or simulators via high-level frameworks with guidance.
Writes basic quantum circuits, explores noise and decoherence and interprets their output on quantum hardware or simulators.
Optimizes quantum algorithms for noise mitigation and efficiency on current quantum platforms.
Advances novel quantum computing techniques and guides organizational strategy for quantum adoption.

label: Quantum Algorithm Design & Programming
description: Designs and implements quantum algorithms (e.g., Grover, Shor, QAOA) on real or simulated hardware; evaluates complexity, noise resilience, and hybrid quantum-classical approaches.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises famous quantum algorithms conceptually.
Implements textbook algorithms with guided tutorials.
Adapts algorithms to domain problems and runs on cloud QPUs.
Optimises circuits and develops novel algorithmic variations.
Leads R&D into new quantum algorithms and cross-disciplinary applications.

label: Distributed Quantum-Cloud Orchestration for Hybrid Workloads
description: Develops schedulers and orchestration layers that partition and route hybrid quantum-classical jobs across heterogeneous quantum-processing units (QPUs) and high-performance-computing (HPC) clusters; manages latency, queueing, error budgets, and cost optimization for multi-vendor quantum clouds.
source_frameworks: Qonductor – Cloud orchestrator for hybrid quantum-classical apps (arXiv 2408.04312)
Qoro Quantum + CESGA distributed circuit-simulation pilot 2025
AWS Braket hybrid-job interface & BB84 QKD example (2025 blog)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes why hybrid workflows need orchestration (classical pre- and post-processing, quantum resource scarcity).
Submits a hybrid variational-quantum-eigensolver (VQE) job via a managed service (e.g., Braket); monitors queue time and cost.
Implements a workflow that splits circuits across simulators and real QPUs; applies simple scheduling policies (first-fit, cost-aware).
Develops custom resource-estimation and circuit-bundling logic (Qonductor-style); integrates error-mitigation metrics into scheduling.
Architects multi-tenant quantum clouds; publishes open-source orchestration APIs; drives standardisation of hybrid-job descriptors and quantum-resource SLAs.

label: Scalable ML Infrastructure
description: Designs distributed compute/storage environments (on-premise, cloud, GPU clusters) for training and serving large-scale ML models; balances performance, cost, and reliability.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes why GPUs/accelerators speed up ML; runs notebook training on a single GPU instance.
Containersizes models and deploys to managed serving services.
Implements distributed training jobs, auto-scaling, and spot-capacity optimization.
Tunes heterogeneous hardware clusters for throughput/cost and establishes caching strategies.
Leads organization-wide platform strategy for large-scale AI workloads; designs multicloud, multi-tenant ML platforms with dynamic resource orchestration and green-AI targets.

label: MLOps Security Hardening
description: Applying secure‑by‑design and zero‑trust principles across the machine‑learning lifecycle—data ingestion, model training, artifact storage, deployment, and monitoring—to defend against model theft, data poisoning, and supply‑chain compromise.
source_frameworks: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication (SP) 800‑218
Open Source Security Foundation (OpenSSF) Machine‑Learning Security Operations (MLSecOps) Guide 2025

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises that ML systems can be attacked; follows data‑classification rules; stores model artifacts in approved repositories.

Implements Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) checks for dependency Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) files; enables Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) and strong authentication and encryption on model endpoints.
Detects data-poisoning patterns; sets up drift‑detection plus adversarial‑input alerts; applies encryption and key‑vault rotation for model secrets.
Automates model signing, watermarking, and runtime attestation; conducts red‑team simulations of machine‑learning pipelines.
Leads organization‑wide Machine‑Learning Security Operations (MLSecOps) program integrating threat intelligence, governance, and continuous compliance across multi‑cloud Machine Learning (ML) stacks.

label: Federated Learning Architecture
description: Designing, deploying, and optimizing Federated Learning (FL) systems that train shared models across decentralized data silos while preserving privacy and minimising communication overhead.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes FL versus centralised Machine Learning (ML); sets basic hyper‑parameters in an open‑source FL framework.
Configures client‑server orchestration and secure aggregation; monitors training rounds.
Tunes communication/computation trade‑offs; mitigates straggler effects; implements Differential Privacy (DP) noise or secure enclaves.
Designs hierarchical or peer‑to‑peer FL topologies; integrates heterogeneous edge devices and dynamic client selection.
Architects multi‑tier FL across telecommunications networks, public cloud, and on‑device nodes; publishes benchmarks and privacy/security research.

label: Edge-AI & TinyML Deployment
description: Optimises and deploys machine-learning models on microcontrollers and resource-constrained devices using frameworks such as TensorFlow Lite Micro; balances latency, power, and accuracy for on-device inference.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes why on-device inference saves bandwidth and enhances privacy.
Quantises a trained model to 8-bit and flashes it to a dev board; measures inference latency.
Applies model pruning and CMSIS-NN kernels; profiles energy and memory footprint.
Implements continuous-learning and over-the-air (OTA) model updates with secure boot.
Designs fleet-scale Edge-AI architectures and optimization tool-chains; publishes TinyML benchmarks.

label: AI Safety & Red-Team Operations
description: Plans and executes adversarial testing (“red teaming”) of AI systems to uncover safety, security, and ethical failure modes; develops attack scenarios (prompt injection, privacy leakage, bias exploits), coordinates fixes, and documents residual risk in line with standards for responsible AI deployment.
source_frameworks: NIST AI Risk-Management Framework 1.0 (2024) — Red-Team Annex

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common failure modes (toxic outputs, data leaks) and basic red-team goals; observes simple adversarial demos.
Runs published attack scripts (prompt-injection, jailbreak) in a test environment; logs findings and follows triage procedures.
Designs novel test cases targeting bias, privacy, or cyber-security vectors; collaborates with dev teams to reproduce and patch issues; retests fixes.
Leads multi-disciplinary red-team exercises; coordinates blue-team mitigation, root-cause analysis, and risk documentation; integrates continuous red-teaming into ML-Ops pipelines.
Establishes enterprise AI-safety strategy; develops red-team tooling and metrics; liaises with regulators and contributes to industry standards for generative-AI safety.

label: AIOps & Model Monitoring
description: Monitors data and model drift, latency, cost, and security of AI services; implements automated alerting, retraining triggers, and self-healing pipelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Views dashboard metrics for prediction latency and failures.
Sets basic alerts on model accuracy or latency thresholds.
Implements automated drift detection, retraining triggers and root-cause analysis.
Deploys full AI-observability stacks, integrates SLO/SLA management and cost dashboards.
Orchestrates enterprise AIOps strategy, self-healing pipelines, and cost-optimization policies.

label: Data Pipeline Architecture
description: Designs and maintains scalable data pipelines (batch and streaming) to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from heterogeneous sources while ensuring quality, lineage, and reliability.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes the purpose of ETL/ELT processes.
Configures existing ETL jobs; monitors basic failures.
Automates workflows, implements incremental loads, and enforces data-quality checks.
Architects distributed pipelines (Spark/Kafka); optimizes cost and performance.
Defines enterprise data-engineering standards, including real-time streaming and governance integration.

label: Data Analysis Fundamentals
description: Utilises descriptive statistics and basic visualisation to interpret datasets; cleans and preprocesses data to support evidence-based decisions across business functions.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common data types and simple charts; describes observable trends.
Uses a spreadsheet or BI tool to calculate summary statistics and plot charts.
Writes queries/scripts to aggregate data; applies measures such as variance, correlation, and basic hypothesis tests.
Conducts multivariate analyses, builds dashboards, and communicates insights to stakeholders.
Designs complex analytical studies, mentors others in statistical reasoning, and governs analytical best practices organization-wide.

label: Neuro-Symbolic AI Pipeline Engineering
description: Designs end-to-end pipelines that combine sub-symbolic machine-learning (deep neural networks) with symbolic knowledge-representation and logical reasoning; implements frameworks such as DARPA ANSR and IBM Neuro-Symbolic AI to achieve interpretable, data-efficient, and verifiable models.
source_frameworks: DARPA ANSR (Assured Neuro-Symbolic Learning & Reasoning) program overview
IBM Research – Neuro-Symbolic AI topic page (2025)
IBM/IEEE Workshop on Neuro-Symbolic Software Engineering 2025

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains how symbolic rules augment neural nets; cites examples like neural theorem-proving.
Integrates a pretrained vision model with a Prolog rule-set for simple scene-question answering; validates logic outputs.
Builds hybrid pipelines with ontologies (OWL/RDF) and deep embeddings; debugs symbol grounding errors; measures accuracy vs. logic coverage.
Implements neuro-symbolic training loops that learn and revise rules from data; optimizes reasoning latency in PyTorch-based graphs; documents assurance cases per DARPA ANSR guidelines.
Publishes new neuro-symbolic architectures; leads enterprise adoption for safety-critical domains; influences standards for explainable hybrid AI systems.

label: Model Evaluation & Validation
description: Validates model performance, robustness, and fairness using cross-validation, statistical tests, and bias-detection metrics; documents findings for stakeholders and regulators.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Calculates accuracy and loss on validation sets.
Uses cross-validation and confusion matrices to compare models.
Performs bias, fairness, and sensitivity analyses; documents findings.
Designs robust stress tests, configurable evaluation frameworks, and A/B tests in production.
Governs enterprise model-risk management and external auditing practices.

label: Machine Learning Model Development
description: Builds, trains, and tunes ML models (regression, classification, clustering, deep learning) using appropriate algorithms and frameworks; iterates to optimize performance and generalisation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains basic ML concepts (train vs. test); applies basic algorithms to datasets using existing tools under guidance.
Trains simple models on curated data and evaluates results for accuracy.
Customizes neural network architectures and tunes hyperparameters for specific tasks.
Optimizes model performance on complex datasets; addresses data quality issues at scale; develops custom pipelines; deploys models to production.
Researches novel architectures; pioneers new AI solutions; mentors data science teams in advanced modeling techniques.

label: Machine Learning Engineering
description: Builds, deploys, and maintains machine-learning models in production; automates pipelines, manages feature stores, sets up scalable serving architectures, and monitors lifecycle performance in alignment with responsible-AI guidelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Trains off-the-shelf models on sample data.
Tunes hyperparameters and evaluates models with standard metrics.
Automates model pipelines, handles feature engineering, and monitors drift.
Implements scalable serving architectures with CI/CD and rollback strategies.
Leads ML platform strategy, governs model lifecycle, and enforces responsible-AI guidelines.

label: Generative-AI Prompt Engineering
description: Crafts, refines, and evaluates prompts that steer large-language or multimodal models toward accurate, safe, and high-utility outputs; applies techniques such as role-setting, chain-of-thought, system-/user-message separation, and few-shot prompting while mitigating risks like prompt injection.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains what a prompt is and recognizes basic pitfalls (vagueness, broad scope).
Uses documented patterns (role + task + context) to achieve consistent answers in a sandbox; tests prompts for edge-case failures.
Applies chain-of-thought or few-shot examples to boost reasoning; measures output quality with rubrics; mitigates simple injection attempts via delimiters/validation.
Optimises prompts for latency/cost trade-offs; A/B tests variants; parameterises templates for localisation or personalisation; collaborates with red-team to harden prompts.
Designs enterprise prompt-libraries and governance; drives prompt-style innovation (hybrid prompting, self-consistency); mentors teams and aligns prompts with responsible-AI policies.

label: Data Governance & Ethics
description: Establishes policies for data quality, privacy (e.g., GDPR), and responsible AI use; oversees stewardship, lineage, consent, and ethical review of data assets and models.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies sensitive data and basic privacy obligations.
Labels datasets correctly; follows retention and consent procedures.
Implements stewardship roles, audits datasets, and addresses bias concerns.
Leads governance programs, aligns with international regulations, and embeds ethical checkpoints in AI workflows.
Chairs data-ethics boards, sets organizational policy, and influences external standards bodies.

label: Automated AI Policy Compliance Monitoring
description: Builds pipelines that continuously scan AI/ML systems for alignment with evolving regulations (EU AI Act, NIST AI RMF) and internal policies; auto-generates impact-assessment reports and alerts on drift.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists major AI regulations (EU AI Act, U.S. Executive Order) and basic compliance artefacts.
Creates rule-based checks for model metadata (purpose, data lineage) in a CI pipeline.
Links monitoring dashboards to risk-scoring metrics; triggers alerts on policy violations.
Implements automated documentation (Model Cards, Impact Assessments) and governance workflows.
Architect enterprise compliance-as-code platform; maps global regulatory changes to automated controls.

label: AI Ethics & Governance
description: Ensures artificial intelligence systems are developed and used responsibly and transparently; implements bias mitigation techniques, fairness metrics, and compliance with AI ethics guidelines (e.g. organizational AI policies, OECD AI Principles).

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes basic ethical concerns in AI (bias, privacy) and knows of AI guidelines or ethics boards.
Identifies bias in datasets/models under supervision; follows standard procedures to document AI decisions (model cards, etc.).
Implements bias detection tools (e.g. fairness metrics in ML) and improves model transparency; ensures models meet privacy requirements.
Integrates ethics checkpoints in AI development workflows; leads bias audits and compliance reviews (e.g. AI model validation against internal policies).
Shapes enterprise AI governance policy; chairs AI ethics committees, designs frameworks to ensure accountability and regulatory compliance across all AI initiatives.

label: Sustainable Aquaculture Practices
description: Cultivates fish or shellfish using eco-friendly methods that minimize environmental impact;   manages water quality, feed, and stocking density in line with sustainable aquaculture guidelines.
source_frameworks: FAO Guidelines for Sustainable Aquaculture – shared principles for eco-friendly aquaculture

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands basic aquaculture concepts (fish farming, water circulation) and why sustainability (low pollution, efficient feed use) is important.
Monitors aquaculture tanks/ponds under supervision; measures water quality (pH, oxygen) and performs routine feeding and cleaning.
Manages day-to-day operations of a small aquaculture system; adjusts feeding regimes and stocking based on growth data; implements waste management (e.g. filters, recirculation).

Optimizes production for resource efficiency (e.g. uses recirculating aquaculture systems to reuse water); integrates species (polyculture) to recycle nutrients; ensures compliance with environmental regulations.

Designs large-scale sustainable aquaculture facilities; adopts innovative practices (e.g. RAS, biofloc technology) and consults on national aquaculture policy; aligns operations with international sustainability standards (FAO, etc.).

label: Climate-Resilient Farming
description: Adapts agronomic practices—drought-tolerant varieties, carbon-sequestration techniques, water-harvesting—to mitigate climate risks and reduce greenhouse-gas emissions.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies local climate threats (drought, heat).
Implements no-till or cover-cropping; selects resilient cultivars.
Calculates carbon footprint; adopts water-efficient irrigation and nutrient-use efficiency.
Redesigns rotations and agroforestry systems; accesses climate-smart subsidies or carbon markets.
Leads regional climate-adaptation programs; influences policy on sustainable agriculture incentives.

label: Agroecology Principles
description: Designs farming systems based on ecological processes—diversity, synergies, recycling, resilience—to enhance productivity while conserving biodiversity and soil health.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Can define agroecology and lists basic practices (crop rotation, organic composting).
Participates in soil conservation measures (cover crop planting, reduced tillage) under guidance.
Manages a farm plot using regenerative methods; monitors soil organic matter and crop diversity outcomes.
Optimises whole-farm ecosystem (integrates crops and livestock, biological pest control) to improve resilience and yield.
Advocates and designs region-wide regenerative programs; contributes to policy or frameworks (e.g., FAO) promoting sustainable agriculture.

label: Agricultural Supply-Chain Logistics
description: Plans and coordinates post-harvest handling, cold-chain storage, transportation, and distribution of agricultural products to minimise loss, maintain quality, and meet market timelines.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies stages of crop flow from field to market; recognizes cold-chain importance.
Schedules local transport; checks packaging and temperature controls.
Optimises routing and load planning; tracks inventory via software; mitigates spoilage.
Integrates IoT sensors for real-time condition monitoring; negotiates with carriers; manages export documentation.
Designs end-to-end value-chain strategies; leverages blockchain or traceability platforms; reduces post-harvest loss at scale.

label: Farm Safety & Regulatory Compliance
description: Implements Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) agricultural standards, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) pesticide rules, and food-safety regulations (FSMA) to protect workers, consumers, and the environment.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies common farm hazards; follows PPE requirements.
Maintains SDS sheets; complies with Worker Protection Standard for pesticides.
Conducts safety training; documents incidents; implements FSMA compliant harvest-handling.
Audits farm for OSHA/EPA/FDA compliance; leads corrective-action plans; manages third-party safety audits.
Designs enterprise safety systems; liaises with regulators; mentors industry on best-practice compliance.

label: Smart Livestock Farming
description: Applies sensors, computer vision, and automation to monitor animal health, welfare, and productivity, optimizing feed, environment, and early disease detection.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reads basic biometric tags or RFID ear tags.
Uses wearable sensors to track temperature and activity; flags deviations.
Integrates barn-climate IoT devices; analyses weight-gain and milk-yield dashboards.
Implements AI-enabled sound/vision analytics for disease or stress; automates feeding to precision rations.
Designs multi-facility smart-livestock systems; mentors producers; publishes best-practice protocols for data-driven animal welfare.

label: Livestock Husbandry & Management
description: Applies best-practice animal-care routines—feeding, housing, health checks, breeding—to ensure welfare and productivity across cattle, poultry, or other farm animals.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows basic feeding and watering schedules; observes animals for visible illness.
Maintains clean housing; administers routine vaccinations or deworming under guidance.
Monitors body-condition scores; records production metrics; implements biosecurity protocols.
Optimises rations with nutritionist; manages breeding schedules; analyses herd-health data for improvements.
Designs welfare-certified programs; mentors producers; integrates precision-livestock tech across operations.

label: Cell-Based Meat Production & Regulatory Compliance
description: Designs and operates cultivated-meat processes—including cell-line selection, bioreactor scale-up, and food-safety controls—while navigating global regulatory frameworks (FAO/WHO, FDA/USDA, Singapore SFA).
source_frameworks: FAO/WHO 'Food-Safety Aspects of Cell-Based Food' report (2023)
US FDA & USDA-FSIS Joint Framework for Cell-Cultured Meat (2024)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Defines “cell agriculture” and lists agencies overseeing pre-market approval.
Operates bench-scale bioreactors; documents hazard-analysis per HACCP.
Develops master cell bank SOPs; prepares regulatory dossiers (human-food, GRAS notice).
Manages pilot-plant GMP validation; aligns labeling with jurisdictional rules (e.g., “cell-cultured chicken”).
Leads multinational regulatory strategy; publishes risk-assessment studies; shapes Codex guidance on novel foods.

label: Farm Financial Planning & Analysis
description: Prepares budgets, cash-flow projections, and profitability analyses for farm enterprises; assesses investment returns and risk scenarios.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Records basic income and expense items; understands Schedule F tax form.
Develops enterprise budgets; calculates breakeven prices.
Projects multi-year cash flows; evaluates equipment ROI; analyses sensitivity to price or yield changes.
Uses whole-farm financial ratios; secures financing; incorporates conservation-practice cost–benefit.
Leads strategic capital allocation; mentors producers; interfaces with lenders and investors on complex deals.

label: Soil Health Analysis
description: Assesses physical, chemical, and biological soil properties—pH, nutrient levels, organic matter, microbiome diversity—to guide fertilisation, crop rotation, and regenerative practices.
source_frameworks: Adapted from O*NET Soil and Plant Scientist tasks (USDOL/ETA, CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Collects soil samples following basic instructions.
Interprets lab reports for pH and N-P-K; recommends standard amendments (intro to soil-fertility management).
Conducts field surveys; uses portable sensors and GIS layers to build variable-rate nutrient maps; cross-references **`climate_resilient_farming`** for integrated fertility & carbon strategies.
Incorporates biological indicators (microbial activity, earthworm counts) into fertility plans; advises on cover-cropping and compost integration.
Designs region-wide soil-health improvement programs; mentors agronomists; publishes best-practice guidelines on regenerative soil management.

label: Precision Pest-Management with Drone & AI Vision
description: Deploys unmanned-aerial vehicles (UAVs) equipped with multi-spectral cameras and on-device computer-vision models to detect pest outbreaks and trigger site-specific pesticide application, reducing chemical load and improving crop yields.

ISO 18466:2024 – Guidelines for UAV Application in Agriculture

proficiency_levels.indicator: Lists common UAV sensors (RGB, NDVI) and explains hotspot mapping.
Flies automated scout mission; uploads imagery to cloud model; verifies pest heat-map overlay.
Trains a local YOLO model on labeled pest images; adjusts flight altitude and overlap for 3 cm/px resolution.
Integrates AI alerts with variable-rate sprayer; validates reduction in pesticide per hectare; complies with aviation & crop-protection regs.
Designs regional pest-forecasting networks using swarm drones and edge inference; publishes IPM (Integrated Pest Management) impact studies.

label: Smart Irrigation Technology
description: Uses soil-moisture probes, weather data, and automated valves to deliver precise water volumes, improving yield while conserving resources.  See also **`climate_resilient_farming`** for whole-farm water-resource strategies.
source_frameworks: USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service smart-irrigation notes (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Monitors basic drip or sprinkler timers; recognizes signs of water stress.
Reads soil-moisture sensors; adjusts schedules manually; checks emitters for clogs.
Integrates weather-based controllers; calibrates flow meters; analyses water-use dashboards.
Designs zone-specific variable-rate irrigation; links systems to GIS prescription maps; calculates water-use efficiency.
Leads large-scale smart-irrigation deployments; mentors growers; quantifies water-savings KPIs for sustainability audits.

label: Crop Disease Management
description: Identifies, monitors, and controls integrated management of crop pests and diseases using integrated pest-management (IPM) strategies that combine cultural, biological, and chemical controls.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common disease symptoms; reports to supervisor.
Scouts fields systematically; records incidence with mobile app.
Selects resistant varieties; times fungicide or biological releases based on threshold data.
Designs field-specific IPM plans using predictive models and weather data.
Leads regional surveillance networks; collaborates with researchers to develop new biocontrol solutions.

label: Precision Agriculture Technologies
description: Utilises Global Positioning System (GPS), Geographic Information System (GIS), drones (unmanned aerial vehicles – UAVs), and real-time sensors for site-specific crop management and operations at sub-field resolution.; analyzes sensor data (soil moisture, nutrient levels) to optimize irrigation, fertilization, and yields.
source_frameworks: O*NET Precision Agriculture Technicians profile 19-4012.01 (CC BY 4.0)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands basic precision ag concepts (yield mapping, variable-rate tech) and common agri-sensors.
Operates GPS-guided farm machinery and simple yield monitors; collects sensor data.
Integrates UAV imagery, soil grids, and variable-rate controllers; produces prescription maps; interprets data dashboards to adjust farming practices..
Implements full IoT network (edge sensors, RTK GPS) across farm to implement variable-rate input application; calculates tech ROI and environmental impact to save resources and improves yield.
Leads enterprise-scale precision ag programs; innovates AI-driven analytics; mentors others in data-driven farming; sets regional best-practice standards for digital agriculture.

label: Agricultural Robotics Maintenance
description: Installs, calibrates, troubleshoots, and maintains field robots and autonomous implements used for planting, weeding, and harvesting, ensuring uptime and safe operation.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies major robot subsystems; follows lock-out/tag-out procedures.
Performs routine cleaning, lubrication, and firmware updates.
Diagnoses sensor or actuator faults; replaces components; tunes navigation software.
Integrates new robotic attachments; analyses log files to prevent failures; documents SOPs.
Designs predictive-maintenance programs for multi-robot fleets; mentors technicians; collaborates with OEMs on next-gen reliability.

label: Advanced Machinery Operation
description: Operates and maintains modern farm equipment—including Global Positioning System (GPS)-guided tractors, combines, and autonomous implements—while optimizing machine settings for efficiency and safety.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows safety checks; operates basic controls under supervision.
Uses GPS autosteer; calibrates yield sensors; performs routine lubrication.
Diagnoses telemetry alerts; replaces sensors; updates firmware; collaborates with **`agricultural_robotics_maintenance`** specialists for robotic attachments.
Integrates autonomous implements with management zones; analyses machine telematics to reduce fuel and idle time.
Leads fleet-automation strategy across multiple farms; mentors operators; consults with OEMs on next-generation features.

label: Agricultural Data Analytics
description: Collects, cleans, and analyses multi-source farm data (yield, climate, satellite) to inform decisions and benchmark performance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Exports basic reports from farm-management software.
Visualises yield trends; flags anomalies.
Runs statistical correlations (soil vs. yield); builds dashboards.
Applies machine-learning models for yield prediction or input optimization.
Designs enterprise analytics pipelines; integrates economic and sustainability KPIs; mentors data-driven decision-making.

label: Travel & Expense Processing
description: Arranges domestic and international travel, optimizing cost and compliance with corporate policies; reconciles expenses using digital expense-reporting systems and supports visa or insurance processes.

Books flights/hotels through approved portals; submits expense reports accurately.
Manages complex itineraries (multi-city, multi-traveller); resolves issues with vendors; ensures policy compliance.
Negotiates corporate rates; analyses spend reports; streamlines visa/insurance workflows.
Designs travel-policy improvements; integrates expense systems with ERP; mentors travel-coordinators network-wide.

label: Customer Service & Escalation Management
description: Resolves frontline enquiries and manages escalation workflows; applies de-escalation techniques, logs issues in CRM, and coordinates with higher tiers to ensure timely resolution and client satisfaction.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Greets callers; forwards issues accurately.
Uses scripts; logs tickets; escalates per matrix.
Applies de-escalation skills; tracks SLAs; follows up on pending cases.
Analyses trend data; updates knowledge base; trains peers in escalation paths.
Designs escalation policies; integrates omnichannel support; mentors supervisors on service excellence.

label: Calendar & Scheduling Coordination
description: Manages complex calendars across cloud platforms (Outlook, Google Workspace), prioritising appointments, preventing conflicts, and protecting confidential information while coordinating resources (rooms, AV, catering) for hybrid meetings.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies basic calendar functions; recognizes meeting requests.
Creates single-time-zone meetings; sends confirmations; avoids obvious overlaps.
Coordinates multi-time-zone schedules; books shared resources; updates invites when agendas shift.
Maintains executives’ complex calendars; automates buffers via rules; integrates virtual-meeting links and privacy settings.
Designs enterprise scheduling standards; deploys calendar-automation tools; mentors staff in efficient hybrid-meeting workflows.

label: Calendar & Email Coordination
description: Triages high-volume email inboxes, applies rules and flags, and synchronises accepted calendar invites, ensuring executives’ schedules remain conflict-free and correspondence receives timely attention.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Sorts basic email folders; recognizes meeting requests.
Flags priority emails; schedules standard meetings; avoids overlaps.
Applies filters/labels; drafts responses; manages delegated calendars across time zones.
Automates email triage; integrates task lists; maintains inbox zero for execs.
Designs email-management SOPs; deploys shared-inbox tools; mentors team on inbox optimization.

label: Workflow & Process Improvement (Admin)
description: Maps administrative workflows, identifies inefficiencies using Lean or Kaizen tools, and implements process improvements or automation to increase speed, accuracy, and customer satisfaction.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common bottlenecks; knows basic improvement terms.
Documents current-state flowcharts; suggests quick wins (5S).
Collects cycle-time data; facilitates Kaizen events; tracks KPIs pre/post change.
Leads cross-team process-redesign projects; integrates digital tools (RPA, forms) to eliminate waste.
Runs continuous-improvement program across admin functions; mentors green/black belts; realises ≥15 % productivity gains year-on-year.

label: Office Software Proficiency
description: Efficiently uses office productivity suites (word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, databases) and collaboration tools to create, analyze, and share information while adhering to accessibility and security best practices.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Opens, saves, and prints files.
Uses formatting, formulas, and slide templates; shares docs via cloud links.
Builds pivot tables, mail merges, slide masters; collaborates in real time.
Automates tasks with macros; troubleshoots file issues; ensures document accessibility.
Trains teams; evaluates and deploys new productivity tools; enforces digital-skills standards.

label: Office Administration Fundamentals
description: Oversees day-to-day office functions—reception, supplies, mail, facilities requests—and coordinates with internal departments to maintain smooth operations and a professional environment.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Understands basic office services (mail, reception).
Logs facility tickets; reorders supplies; greets visitors.
Coordinates multiple vendors; updates office procedures; ensures workspace ergonomics.
Manages office budgets; implements sustainability initiatives; trains junior staff.
Designs office-services strategy; optimizes space utilization; leads cross-site coordination.

label: Procurement Administration Processes
description: Sources office supplies and services, manages stock, processes purchase orders, and reconciles invoices while applying budgeting controls and vendor KPIs.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Monitors low-stock items; follows reorder lists.
Creates POs; verifies deliveries; matches invoices.
Negotiates quotes; maintains inventory system; prevents stock-outs.
Conducts spend analysis; applies supplier KPIs; audits sustainability compliance.
Leads strategic sourcing; mentors staff; integrates procurement analytics dashboards.

label: Business Communications & Writing
description: Crafts clear, audience-appropriate emails, memos, and reports; applies grammar, tone, and style guidelines; adheres to email, chat, and video-meeting etiquette to represent the organization professionally.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Distinguishes professional vs. informal tone.
Writes concise emails; follows templates; proofreads for errors.
Tailors messages for stakeholders; summarizes complex info clearly.
Edits high-stakes documents; coaches peers; delivers persuasive presentations.
Establishes org-wide comms standards; resolves cross-cultural communication challenges.

label: Meeting & Event Logistics
description: Plans on-site, virtual, and hybrid meetings; arranges venues, AV, catering, travel, budgets, and post-event evaluations, ensuring accessibility and sustainability.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Checks room availability; schedules basic calls.
Orders catering; sets up conferencing tools; records minutes.
Coordinates vendors; manages budgets; supports hybrid AV.
Negotiates contracts; integrates event apps; analyses feedback.
Leads enterprise event strategy; mentors planners; embeds CSR in events.

label: Records & Knowledge Management
description: Curates organizational knowledge bases; designs taxonomies, tags documents, and facilitates knowledge-sharing platforms (wikis, intranets) to reduce information silos and speed onboarding.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Searches intranet; adds simple wiki entries.
Tags documents; updates FAQs; promotes use of knowledge base.
Develops taxonomy; analyses usage metrics; removes redundant/outdated info.
Integrates KM with EDRMS; facilitates communities of practice; trains staff on knowledge capture.
Leads KM strategy; measures ROI; aligns KM processes with ISO 30401.

label: Document & Records Management
description: Maintains structured physical and digital filing systems; aligns with file plans, ensures secure storage, enables rapid retrieval, and supervises timely disposition per retention policies.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Labels folders; follows basic security measures.
Applies naming conventions; retrieves requested files promptly.
Manages off-site storage; schedules destruction; logs retention actions.
Digitises archives; audits compliance; integrates barcode/RFID tracking.
Architects taxonomy; leads enterprise digitisation; ensures legal holds and audit trails.

label: Document Preparation & Editing
description: Drafts, formats, and edits business documents—memos, reports, presentations— ensuring clarity, consistency, and brand style; uses advanced word-processing and desktop-publishing tools.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Applies basic formatting (fonts, spacing).
Uses templates; checks spelling/grammar; saves PDFs.
Applies styles, section breaks; edits for tone; inserts cross-references.
Creates complex layouts; merges data (mail merge); enforces accessibility rules.
Manages enterprise templates; trains teams; integrates docs with translation/localisation workflows.

label: Office Document Creation & Management
description: Produces high-quality documents (reports, slide decks, forms) using office suites; applies templates, accessibility, and version-control best practices within cloud collaboration platforms.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Opens and saves documents; applies basic formatting.
Uses templates and styles; applies spell-check and basic layout.
Collaborates in real-time; inserts dynamic content (tables of contents, data links).
Manages document versions; enforces accessibility standards; converts formats (PDF/A).
Administers template libraries; trains teams; integrates document workflows with EDRMS.

label: Digital Record Systems Management
description: Administers electronic records-management systems (EDRMS); configures metadata, retention schedules, and e-discovery searches, ensuring ISO 15489 compliance and secure access controls.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes record lifecycle and sensitivity levels.
Indexes documents; applies retention tags.
Builds metadata schemas; executes e-discovery queries.
Audits permissions; automates retention and disposal workflows.
Leads enterprise records strategy; integrates EDRMS with collaboration suites.

label: Data Entry Accuracy & Quality Assurance
description: Inputs and verifies data in business systems, applies validation rules, conducts double-entry checks, and maintains audit trails to ensure accuracy, integrity, and compliance with records-management policies.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises importance of accurate data; performs simple keying.
Achieves ≥ 97 % accuracy; uses built-in validation prompts.
Runs query checks; corrects discrepancies; documents QA steps.
Designs data-entry SOPs; implements batch validations and error logs.
Automates QA dashboards; leads continuous-improvement projects reducing error rate < 0.5 %.

label: Voice-Driven Document Creation & Meeting-Minute Capture
description: Utilises speech-recognition and transcription engines (Web Speech API, intelligent voice assistants) to draft business documents, e-mails, and real-time meeting minutes; applies accuracy review workflows and ensures compliance with privacy and accessibility standards.
source_frameworks: Systematic Review of Voice-Assistant Usability (2022) – ISO usability lens

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes speech-to-text pipeline; recognizes common accuracy and privacy concerns.
Uses off-the-shelf transcription to create draft notes; edits output for clarity; stores audio securely.
Configures custom vocabularies and speaker-diarisation; embeds auto-timestamps and action-item tags within minutes.
Integrates real-time captions into virtual-meeting platforms; automates approval workflow with version control and access-rights management.
Designs enterprise voice-documentation strategy with multilingual models and domain-specific language packs; ensures alignment with accessibility (WCAG 2.2) and data-protection policies.

label: Business Communications & Writing
description: Produces clear, concise, and audience-appropriate business documents, presentations, and correspondence.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Drafts routine emails and memos with grammar assistance.
Writes meeting minutes, one-page briefs, and proofreads for accuracy.
Crafts executive summaries, slide decks, and persuasive proposals aligned with brand voice.
Establishes writing standards, edits cross-functional documents, and mentors colleagues.
Shapes enterprise communication strategy, directs messaging for high-stakes audiences, and trains organization-wide writing programs.

label: Customer Service Support
description: Provides frontline support via phone, email, chat, or reception, resolving inquiries respectfully and escalating issues appropriately while maintaining accurate interaction logs in CRM or help-desk systems.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Greets callers; forwards messages accurately.
Uses call scripts; logs basic tickets; follows data-privacy scripts.
Handles multi-channel queries; updates CRM records; resolves common issues independently.
Analyses service metrics; drafts knowledge-base articles; coaches peers on de-escalation.
Leads service-quality programs; integrates chatbots and FAQ flows; aligns KPIs with organization strategy.

label: Customer Service & Escalation Management
description: Handles inquiries, resolves issues, and manages escalations to maintain high internal and external customer satisfaction.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Responds to routine questions using prepared guidelines.
Logs tickets, follows escalation paths, and tracks resolution times.
Analyzes common issues, proposes process improvements, and communicates empathetically.
Develops knowledge bases, escalation protocols, and service-level dashboards.
Defines enterprise customer-experience strategy and leads continuous-improvement programs.

label: Conversational-AI Chatbots for Customer Interaction
description: Designs, deploys, and maintains conversational-AI chatbots that handle routine inquiries, authenticate users, and triage complex requests before escalating to human agents; aligns bot dialog with customer-experience principles and regulatory requirements (privacy, accessibility).
source_frameworks: Microsoft Style Guide – Chatbots & Virtual Agents (2022)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains chatbot benefits and limitations; maps simple FAQ to intents.
Builds a rule-based bot with natural-language intents; tests flows for clarity and ISO 9241-110 dialog principles.
Integrates an LLM to improve intent coverage; establishes human-handoff triggers; monitors user-satisfaction metrics.
Implements guardrails (PII redaction, profanity filters) and live-learning loops; tunes prompt engineering for tone consistency; validates against NIST AI RMF trustworthiness traits.
Architects omni-channel chatbot platforms across voice, chat, and mobile apps; drives continuous-improvement using analytics; aligns bot operations with enterprise CX and accessibility standards.

label: Robotic Desktop Automation for Front-Office Tasks
description: Configures robotic desktop automation (RDA) bots that assist customer-service and clerical staff by auto-populating forms, copying data between apps, and launching workflows with minimal code.
source_frameworks: IEEE Guide for RPA Implementation Std 2755

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies repetitive tasks suitable for RDA; records simple click-path.
Builds attended bot in an RPA studio; handles basic exceptions.
Integrates bots with APIs; monitors run logs and KPIs (handle-time).
Optimises human-in-the-loop design; secures credentials via vault; scales bots across teams.
Governs RDA program enterprise-wide; measures ROI and continuous-improvement backlog.

label: Robotic Process Automation (Admin)
description: Designs and deploys robotic process automation bots to handle repetitive office tasks (e.g. data entry, report generation); monitors bot performance and maintains workflow integrity.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes what RPA is and identifies office tasks that could be automated.
Builds simple attended bots; uses RPA software templates to automate simple tasks under supervision.
Develops unattended bots and custom RPA scripts for common administrative processes; schedules and monitors bot tasks.
Implements governance and security; measures ROI; integrates RPA solutions with office IT systems (CRM, ERP); optimizes bots to reduce errors and exceptions.
Leads enterprise RPA adoption; architects enterprise automation roadmap; ensures governance, security and compliance of automated workflows; mentors others in RPA development.

label: Generative Document Summarization Assistants
description: Uses large-language-model (LLM) tools to create concise, accurate summaries of lengthy business documents (reports, contracts, meeting minutes) while preserving confidentiality and formatting guidelines.
source_frameworks: NIST AI RMF 1.0 – trustworthy summarization controls

proficiency_levels.indicator: Explains benefits and risks of LLM summarization; runs a prompt in a secure company tool.
Generates summaries for internal memos; reviews output for hallucinations and tone.
Builds prompt templates with role/context instructions; integrates summarizer into document-management workflow.
Tunes organization-specific retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines; enforces privacy filters and citation checks.
Designs enterprise summarization strategy; sets governance aligned with NIST AI RMF and internal policies.

label: Stress Management Techniques
description: Employs evidence-based techniques to manage stress and maintain performance, resilience, and health under pressure.
source_frameworks: Adapted from CDC/NIOSH stress-management guidelines (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common stress signals; uses a brief breathing exercise to relax.
Applies simple practices (micro-breaks, stretching, gratitude journaling) during routine stress.
Utilises structured coping strategies (progressive relaxation, time-boxing, social support) to navigate busy periods; reflects on stress triggers.
Integrates stress-reduction techniques into daily habits; coaches teammates; tracks personal stress metrics.
Designs enterprise stress-management programs; measures impact on wellbeing and retention; advocates for systemic changes that reduce chronic stressors.

label: Sensory Mindfulness
description: Cultivates present-moment awareness through attention to breath, body sensations, or surroundings, enhancing emotional regulation and cognitive clarity.
source_frameworks: Based on Kabat-Zinn’s Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (public descriptions)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises moments of distraction; brings focus back to current activity.
Practices brief grounding exercises (e.g., 3-breath pause).
Maintains 10–15 min daily mindfulness routine; applies techniques during stress.
Leads mindfulness sessions for teams; integrates mindful pauses into meetings and workflows.
Designs organizational mindfulness programs; researches and shares outcomes on stress, focus, and well-being.

label: Growth Mindset
description: Believes abilities can be developed through effort, feedback, and learning, embracing challenges and persisting after setbacks.
source_frameworks: Based on Carol Dweck’s growth-mindset research (widely cited public work)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Acknowledges that skills can improve with practice.
Seeks feedback; views mistakes as learning opportunities.
Pursues stretch goals; reframes setbacks as data for improvement.
Coaches others to adopt growth mindset; designs learning challenges that build resilience.
Embeds growth-mindset culture; influences talent and performance systems to reward learning and adaptability.

label: Moral Courage
description: Acts on ethical convictions despite fear of negative consequences, defending principles and others who may be at risk.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises instances where speaking up is necessary.
Raises concerns about minor policy violations to supervisor.
Challenges unfair practices respectfully; documents and escalates serious issues.
Takes principled stands in high-stakes contexts; protects whistle-blowers; seeks systemic fixes.
Inspires culture of moral courage; influences industry norms and legislation for ethical conduct.

label: Integrity Alignment
description: Consistently aligns words and actions with stated values, maintaining honesty and transparency even under pressure.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows rules and commitments when monitored.
Admits mistakes promptly; keeps promises to peers.
Upholds standards despite inconvenience; addresses integrity lapses in team.
Balances conflicting interests ethically; models courageous integrity in difficult negotiations.
Embeds integrity systems in culture; influences external partners toward higher ethical standards.

label: Ethical Reflection & Reasoning
description: Examines moral dilemmas, applies ethical principles, and justifies decisions that align with personal and organizational values.
source_frameworks: Rest’s Four-Component Model of Moral Behavior (public summaries)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises when choices have ethical implications.
Consults policies and values statements before acting; explains chosen course.
Weighs competing values; uses structured methods (e.g., stakeholder impact matrix) to decide.
Leads ethical discussions; anticipates downstream consequences; documents rationale.
Shapes codes of conduct; mentors others in ethical reasoning; influences industry ethics standards.

label: Impulse Control
description: Manages impulses and emotions, delaying gratification to pursue long-term goals and maintain constructive behavior under pressure.
source_frameworks: Informed by neuroscience-based self-discipline exercises (publicly available)
Aligned with Baumeister ego-depletion research concepts

proficiency_levels.indicator: Pauses briefly before reacting when reminded.
Uses simple techniques (deep breath, 10-second rule) to resist temptations.
Employs strategies (implementation intentions, environment design) to maintain focus; recovers quickly after lapses.
Sustains self-control during prolonged stress; mentors others in habit-breaking and willpower techniques.
Designs programs that enhance behavioral self-regulation at scale; links impulse control to organizational safety and ethics outcomes.

label: Attention Switching & Focus
description: Deliberately maintains deep focus on priority tasks, minimizes distractions, and switches attention efficiently when goals change.   See also `deep_work_practice` for extended protocols on multi-hour distraction-free sessions.
source_frameworks: Guided by research on deep-work cycles (Cal Newport)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises common distractions; follows guidance to regain focus.
Schedules focused blocks (e.g., 25-minute Pomodoro); limits notifications during work sessions.
Sustains 60- to 90-minute deep-work cycles; uses context-switch routines to prevent attention residue.
Designs team norms for deep work vs. collaboration windows; leverages apps/analytics to monitor and optimize focus time.
Leads organizational initiatives to reduce distraction culture; mentors others in cognitive-load management and attention training.

label: Self-Reflective Insight
description: Examines one's thoughts, emotions, and behaviors to gain deeper self-understanding, informing intentional growth and improved decision-making.
source_frameworks: Based on Schön’s reflective practice model (public domain concepts)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes recent actions and feelings when prompted.
Journals or debriefs to identify what worked and what didn’t; sets small improvement goals.
Analyzes cognitive and emotional patterns; adjusts strategies accordingly.
Integrates structured reflection (after-action reviews, learning logs) into routines; coaches peers in reflective techniques.
Embeds reflective-learning systems across teams; champions a culture of continuous introspection and adaptation.

label: Metacognition Skills
description: Monitors and regulates one’s own thinking and learning processes, selecting strategies that optimize understanding and performance.
source_frameworks: Aligned with Flavell’s metacognition theory; informed by workplace-learning research

proficiency_levels.indicator: Describes how a task was approached after completion.
Selects learning tactics (note-taking, retrieval practice) and evaluates basic effectiveness.
Chooses and adapts strategies in real time; articulates why a method works or fails.
Coaches peers on strategy selection; measures learning return on investment (ROI) for projects.
Embeds metacognitive routines in organizational learning systems; innovates new reflection frameworks for complex problem-solving.

label: Identity & Self-Authorship
description: Defines and lives by an internally generated sense of values, purpose, and identity—rather than external scripts—guiding consistent, authentic actions.
source_frameworks: Kegan’s self-authorship theory (publicly summarized) and leadership-identity research

proficiency_levels.indicator: Articulates personal values when asked.
Identifies conflicts between external expectations and core values; chooses authentic responses.
Aligns career or life choices with self-defined purpose; resists incongruent pressures.
Leads others from a clear inner compass; adapts style while retaining authenticity.
Mentors emerging leaders in self-authorship; shapes culture that honours individual purpose and integrity.

label: Purpose Articulation
description: Identifies, clarifies, and communicates one’s overarching life or career purpose, aligning daily actions and goals with that intrinsic motivation.
source_frameworks: Based on self-determination theory and purpose-driven leadership research

proficiency_levels.indicator: Reflects on what feels meaningful; notes broad interests.
Writes a personal purpose statement; sets short-term goals consistent with it.
Evaluates opportunities through the lens of purpose; communicates purpose to peers for accountability.
Aligns major career or project choices with purpose; inspires others by sharing purpose-linked narratives.
Designs organizational roles or ventures anchored in shared purpose; mentors others in articulating and living purpose.

label: Energy Management
description: Optimizes physical, mental, and emotional energy through routines of rest, nutrition, movement, and focused recovery to sustain high performance.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises personal energy highs and lows; schedules demanding tasks at peak times when possible.
Uses simple strategies (hydration, short breaks) to maintain alertness.
Implements balanced exercise, sleep, and nutrition plans; cycles work and recovery for sustained output.
Tracks energy metrics (heart-rate variability, fatigue scores) to fine-tune routines; mentors colleagues on energy rituals.
Integrates energy-management programs into organizational health strategy; leverages data analytics to link energy patterns to productivity and wellbeing KPIs.

label: Digital Minimalism
description: Intentionally curates digital tools and information consumption to minimize distraction, maximize value, and support mental well-being.
source_frameworks: Concepts from Cal Newport’s digital-minimalism framework (publicly discussed)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Notices impact of excessive notifications; silences non-urgent alerts.
Audits apps; removes low-value digital clutter; schedules screen-free periods.
Establishes usage rules (e.g., email windows); practices single-tasking online.
Coaches team in digital-minimalism practices; redesigns workflows to reduce digital overload.
Shapes organizational tech-use policies to promote focused, healthy digital environments; measures impact on productivity and well-being.

label: Deep Work Practice
description: Schedules and protects extended blocks of distraction-free, cognitively demanding work to maximize learning, creativity, and throughput, and deliberately balances these sessions with restorative breaks.
source_frameworks: Cal Newport’s Deep Work framework (publicly summarized)
Sophie Leroy’s attention-residue research (public domain summaries)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognises that frequent context-switching harms concentration.
Blocks 30–60 min sessions; silences notifications; logs interruptions.
Protects 90–120 min deep-work cycles daily; uses recovery breaks that avoid attention residue.
Designs weekly cadence of deep vs. shallow work; tracks output metrics (e.g., words written, features shipped); mentors peers on setup and rituals.
Embeds deep-work norms in team culture (meeting-free mornings, focus hours); measures impact on innovation and delivery KPIs; evangelises organization-wide practices.

label: Vision-Setting
description: Creates and articulates a compelling long-term vision that inspires others and guides organizational direction.
source_frameworks: Based on U.S. OPM ECQ Leading Change—Vision (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: States team goals when prompted; understands the organization’s mission.
Articulates clear near-term objectives linked to broader goals; communicates enthusiasm for future possibilities.
Synthesizes trends to craft an engaging multi-year vision; aligns team efforts with strategic priorities.
Inspires cross-functional commitment to an ambitious vision; adjusts direction responsively to environmental changes.
Shapes enterprise-wide or societal vision; influences external stakeholders and resources to realize long-range goals.

label: Team Leadership & Collaboration
description: Inspires and fosters team commitment, spirit, and trust; facilitates cooperation and motivates team members to accomplish group goals.
source_frameworks: OPM Leadership Competency – Team Building (inspires team commitment and trust)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes the importance of teamwork and respects input from all team members.
Organizes team meetings and encourages participation; addresses minor conflicts with supervision.
Builds cohesive project teams, defining roles and goals; boosts team morale through recognition and inclusive decision-making.
Leads high-performing teams on complex initiatives; coaches others in collaborative problem-solving and conflict resolution.
Cultivates a culture of trust and collaboration organization-wide; designs team-building programs and mentors leaders in team development.

label: Strategic Thinking
description: Analyzes complex factors, anticipates future trends, and formulates long-term plans that position the organization for success.
source_frameworks: Based on OPM ECQ Strategic Thinking plus public-domain strategy models

proficiency_levels.indicator: Contributes data for planning; recognizes organizational goals.
Performs simple Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats (SWOT) or Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Legal, Environmental (PESTLE) analyses for projects.
Synthesizes internal and external trends; proposes strategic options with supporting rationale.
Integrates cross-functional insights; selects strategic path; establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) for execution.
Shapes enterprise strategy; anticipates industry disruptions; guides resource allocation to realize long-range vision.

label: Strategic Communication
description: Delivers clear, persuasive messages tailored to diverse stakeholders to build understanding, alignment, and commitment. See also `remote_hybrid_team_leadership` for asynchronous-communication norms that apply in virtual contexts.
source_frameworks: Based on OPM ECQ Leading Change communication competencies (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Conveys basic information accurately; follows communication protocols.
Adjusts tone, format, and channel (email, briefing) to audience; provides concise updates.
Crafts persuasive narratives linking initiatives to stakeholder interests; uses data and storytelling effectively.
Aligns messaging across multiple channels; anticipates objections; influences decision-makers to adopt proposals.
Orchestrates enterprise communication strategy; manages high-stakes messaging (media, investors); mentors leaders in strategic influence.

label: Stakeholder Coalition Building
description: Builds alliances and collaborative networks among diverse stakeholders to achieve shared objectives.

proficiency_levels.indicator: Identifies key stakeholders; communicates project goals to them when directed.
Maintains positive relationships; seeks input and support for initiatives.
Aligns interests of multiple parties; negotiates resource sharing to advance mutual goals.
Leads multi-organizational coalitions; resolves competing priorities to maintain momentum.
Creates enduring networks that drive systemic change across sectors; influences policy or industry standards through broad coalitions.

label: Remote & Hybrid Team Leadership
description: Leads geographically dispersed or schedule-flexible teams by creating clear norms, sustaining engagement, and fostering equity and performance across virtual and in-person contexts.
source_frameworks: Informed by MIT Sloan Management Review hybrid-leadership research (2025) and Gartner remote-work studies (publicly available)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Uses basic collaboration tools (video, chat); attends virtual meetings on time; follows stated online etiquette.
Sets clear response-time expectations; holds regular check-ins to monitor well-being; ensures remote members access resources equal to on-site peers.
Establishes asynchronous workflows (documented processes, shared boards); designs “moments that matter” onsite/online to build cohesion; mitigates proximity bias in recognition and assignments.

Balances synchronous vs. asynchronous collaboration strategically; leverages analytics (engagement dashboards, pulse surveys) to adjust workload and support; champions inclusive meeting practices (rotation of time zones, closed captions).

Architects enterprise-wide hybrid-work strategy; integrates remote-leadership competencies into talent systems; mentors other leaders on sustaining innovation, culture, and DEI in distributed environments.

label: Persuasion & Negotiation
description: Persuades others to accept ideas or change behaviors and negotiates mutually beneficial agreements through active listening, evidence-based arguments, and diplomacy.
source_frameworks: Adapted from OPM Influencing/Negotiating competency (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Presents ideas clearly; accepts differing viewpoints respectfully.
Uses logical arguments and basic data to gain agreement on routine matters; seeks common ground.
Builds rapport; applies win-win techniques to negotiate project resources or timelines; adapts persuasion style to audience needs.
Leads high-stakes negotiations; overcomes resistance with tailored value propositions; achieves complex agreements that balance multiple interests.
Shapes organizational or inter-organizational decisions through expert negotiation; mentors others in advanced influence strategies; brokers consensus on contentious strategic issues.

label: Mentoring & Coaching
description: Develops others by providing guidance, feedback, and opportunities that foster growth and performance.
source_frameworks: Based on OPM ECQ Developing Others (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Shares basic knowledge with peers when asked.
Provides constructive feedback and encouragement; sets clear expectations for mentees.
Establishes development plans; uses coaching techniques (e.g., open-ended questions) to build capability.
Mentors multiple individuals across functions; aligns development efforts with organizational succession planning.
Creates mentoring programs; embeds coaching culture in the organization; builds pipelines of future leaders.

label: Inclusive Leadership
description: Creates an environment where all individuals feel valued, respected, and able to contribute fully, leveraging diverse perspectives for better outcomes. See also `remote_hybrid_team_leadership` for practices that ensure equitable inclusion of off-site team members.
source_frameworks: Guided by public materials from U.S. EEOC and OPM Diversity & Inclusion competency (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Treats colleagues with respect; avoids biased language.
Encourages input from diverse team members; addresses minor exclusion incidents promptly.
Identifies systemic barriers to inclusion; implements practices (e.g., unbiased recruitment) to enhance diversity.
Advocates for equitable policies; measures and reports diversity and inclusion (D&I) metrics; mentors others on inclusive behaviors.
Embeds inclusion into organizational culture and strategy; influences industry or community standards for equity and belonging.

label: Ethical Governance
description: Models integrity and transparency; establishes policies and oversight mechanisms that ensure ethical decision-making and regulatory compliance.
source_frameworks: Aligned with public-domain ethics guidelines from OPM and OECD

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows code of conduct; discloses conflicts of interest when prompted.
Applies ethical standards to daily decisions; reports observed misconduct.
Implements controls to prevent unethical behavior; conducts ethical risk assessments.
Leads ethics investigations; integrates ethics and compliance into strategic planning; communicates ethical expectations organization-wide.
Establishes industry-leading governance frameworks; advises external bodies on ethics policy; fosters culture of integrity and accountability.

label: Delegation & Empowerment
description: Entrusts responsibilities and authority to others, providing guidance and resources that enable team members to make decisions and develop autonomy. See also `remote_hybrid_team_leadership` for delegating and monitoring work in distributed teams.
source_frameworks: Based on OPM ECQ Developing Others (public domain)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Assigns straightforward tasks with clear instructions.
Delegates routine responsibilities; provides support and monitors progress.
Matches task complexity to individuals’ strengths; offers coaching and constructive feedback to build confidence.
Delegates decision-making authority for significant work streams; mentors emerging leaders in effective delegation practices.
Cultivates an organizational culture of empowerment and accountability; designs systems that reinforce distributed decision-making and talent growth.

label: Crisis Leadership
description: Maintains composure, makes timely decisions, and directs coordinated responses during high-pressure or emergency situations.
source_frameworks: Aligned with FEMA ICS leadership principles (publicly released); wording original

proficiency_levels.indicator: Follows emergency procedures; remains calm under guidance.
Communicates clear instructions during minor incidents; escalates appropriately.
Leads team response to significant disruptions; balances fast action with available data.
Coordinates multi-team crisis operations; reallocates resources dynamically; briefs senior leaders and media.
Designs crisis-management frameworks; anticipates systemic risks; mentors leaders in resilience and antifragile practices.

label: Conflict Resolution
description: Addresses and resolves disagreements constructively, fostering collaboration and maintaining positive relationships.
source_frameworks: Informed by Thomas-Kilmann Conflict Mode Instrument concepts (public domain)
Aligned with interest-based relational approach principles

proficiency_levels.indicator: Recognizes signs of conflict; avoids escalating tension.
Facilitates calm discussion between parties; seeks win-win compromise on routine issues.
Applies active-listening and negotiation techniques to resolve complex interpersonal or inter-team conflicts.
Mediates high-stakes disputes; rebuilds trust and commitment among stakeholders.
Establishes conflict-management frameworks and training; resolves organizational or multi-party conflicts with lasting agreements.

label: Change Leadership
description: Leads organizational change by communicating purpose, engaging stakeholders, and sustaining momentum through transition.
source_frameworks: Informed by Prosci ADKAR Model principles (conceptual alignment)
Aligned with Kotter's 8-Step Change Model (public domain concepts)

proficiency_levels.indicator: Supports change initiatives when directed; adapts personal work habits accordingly.
Explains reasons for change to team; addresses straightforward resistance.
Develops change plans, including milestones and stakeholder engagement; mitigates risks and maintains performance.
Drives complex, multi-department transformations; aligns structures, processes, and culture with new strategy.
